We are sixty seconds from losing. Shall we surrender now and spare ourselves the ignominy, or shall we make one last push to overthrow the enemy's trade monopoly?
We shall win a glorious victory, if only this timer would hurry up!
We are sixty seconds from victory! Let us enjoy the final moments of this contest by watching our enemy writhe in the agonies of his failure.
Just one minute before our triumph, my friend! It may be a bit premature, but let me congratulate on a game well fought.
It seems there is nothing I can do to keep you from winning. But there is still a little time for me to take action.
Put away that bunting, I haven't given up yet!
That clock does not scare me; we still have some time.
Tick tock. Hurry now, but not too much. Haste makes waste.
Oh my, we are close to victory, aren't we? Hahaha.
Rule, Britannia! Britannia dum de dum...
How annoying. Now we have to start the countdown all over again.
Well... it was fun while it lasted.
Haha! Now you will have to start over again.
Take that! And expect it again, just as good!
There. Now, we can have a stand up fight. I will not tolerate any more of your tricks.
The enemy has a trade monopoly! We have to act fast!
Oh no. We'll need to get our act together, and quickly!
Look sharp now, we have work to do. Let us be about it!
Now all we have to do is sit back and wait for victory to fall into our laps.
Time brings victory to the patient. Would you join me for tea?
The fight is not over yet. Your timer does not mean we are finished.
Oh dear, now I suppose I shall have to send my armies to annihilate you. And we were having such fun.
My lobsterbacks know just how to deal with your trading posts!
Hear that? The clock is ticking now. Just a few short minutes and you lose!
Oh dear, what is that I hear? Why it's... it's your defeat approaching. Tick tick tick.
Look at the timer. Tick, tick, tick. The countdown to doom.
The Aztecs do build lovely cities. Too bad they will soon lie in ruin.
A gallant fight from the Haudenosaunee. I am almost sad to see them defeated. Almost.
The Aztecs are arrayed in their finest regalia, a fearsome sight indeed.
The Haudenosaunee are strong and growing stronger.
I had never thought to see any stand against our alliance. Alas! The Aztecs not only stand, they tower!
The Haudenosaunee cannot be stopped, I fear.
The Aztecs are close to defeat! Let us make one last grand rally and take them with us!
The Haudenosaunee cling to a thin thread. Perhaps we can cut it before we are defeated.
If we cannot attack their trading posts now, then it is indeed over.
I told you that trust in me was well-placed. We are close to victory.
We have persevered this time, my friend. Ottoman goods and diplomacy have won again!
There is still time for me to snatch victory from the lion's mouth.
No matter where you go, your destiny follows you. Yours has followed you to the brink of defeat.
He bites his tongue who speaks in haste. Do not crow your victory from the hilltops yet.
I have persevered, and soon I shall be rewarded.
If skill could be gained by watching, then dogs would be butchers. And you would be a general.
One already wet does not feel the rain. You, my friend, are soaked in failure!
They have destroyed one of our trading posts and stolen away our well-deserved victory.
We were so close to victory, my friend. Perhaps we should try again.
Thorns and roses grow from the same root. The rose you have found will soon show you its thorns.
That is quite enough of that!
An open door invites enemies. Forgive me for walking through yours and crushing you.
Your children's grandchildren will not look back on this defeat with shame. No, not at all.
We should have known they would try to win this way.
Victory does not come so easily as starting a timer. Who buys cheap buys dear.
They have chosen to be the nail rather than the hammer. Poor choice.
A red apple invites stones. Our prosperity will make us a target. We must prepare.
We have chosen to be the anvil rather than the hammer. Our patience will outlast your strength.
Patience is bitter, but it bears sweet fruit. Now the waiting begins.
My armies will crush the victory you seek. But where will they strike?
There are many places you must defend. But where will Suleiman attack?
You cannot hold two watermelons under one arm. How do you expect to keep all those trading posts?
The moment of my victory approaches. I can hear the bombards sounding.
I am sure your children's children will be able to forgive your coming defeat.
The Aztecs rival the Ottoman Empire in grandeur, though not for much longer.
The Haudenosaunee alliances are shattered and their time at an end.
I can see smoke rising from the Aztec temples, but I do not believe the cities are burning. This makes me uneasy.
The Haudenosaunee are like lions - we had best keep a close eye on them.
The Aztecs drain our strength like spilled blood.
The Haudenosaunee have proven stronger than our alliance.
We can discuss our many missteps later, with wine, over a proper meal, but now before we lose, let us attack the Aztecs one last time.
We are in poor shape, but so are the Haudenosaunee. Come, my ally, let us march on them one last time.
Only one minute! Inconceivable! Attack, attack, attack, for we are at the critical moment!
Ha! We have them now. One minute left before our enemy's total humiliation!
Just one short minute and the game ends. Our foe is doomed and all because of my... er... I mean "our" power.
Bah! I still have time to snatch victory from your unworthy hands!
Coward! Come face me on battlefield!
It is all over but the victory parade now. Ha!
I tire of you. Now we will be finished.
The end is near, cur. Grovel before me and I might show mercy. (laughter) Who am I kidding?
Those knaves! Let us seek immediate retribution upon their bodies. They will pay for their insolence!
Too bad. Now I will have to crush you the old-fashioned way.
Ha! I knew you would not be able to pull it off! Now REAL fight begins.
I have crushed your monopoly and now you are mine.
Curse their eyes! The enemy has monopoly. They cannot win with strength, so they are trying with cunning.
Quickly! We must destroy one of the enemy posts or all is lost!
The cowards. They are not worthy of sniffing my boot.
Building trading posts is not the most glorious way to win war, but is certainly effective.
They have to come to us now to keep us from winning. Let us prepare an ambush.
Good, I tire of these curs. Let us be done with them by any means possible.
You would settle for winning that way? I am almost ashamed to be fighting you.
Ha! You cannot believe your trading posts will survive the Russian army!
So... you do not think you can beat me on battlefield. You are right, coward!
Ha! The final nails in your coffin are being hammered right now.
If - and is big if - you have trustworthy heirs, now would be the time to send them away.
The Aztecs are ground to dust beneath my bootheel.
The Aztecs are threat to our victory. We must attack!
We should attack the Haudenosaunee before they grow too strong.
The outlook is grim. The Aztecs cause even bold Cossacks to tremble in saddle.
How did you let this happen? The Haudenosaunee cannot be left to grow so strong.
I can see the end coming for us, but the Aztecs are weak - let us deal them one last blow.
Though is clear we will not win, my scouts report that the Haudenosaunee are vulnerable. One good attack might do them in.
Where are you? We must go faster.
Do not stop. We are almost there.
The time is short, but do not get too excited.
You are close, but you are not there yet.
Gloat now, dog - your time in the new world will not be long.
Don't worry about the clock. It will be over soon enough.
Look at the time. You do not have long to wait.
What happened to you? Now we must start again.
How does it feel to be on the receiving end?
That is what you get for challenging the Spanish.
A bold attempt, but you see my power.
The enemy has a trade monopoly. Wake up your men and put them to work.
They have a trade monopoly. Take down a trading post or you'll taste my lash.
The dogs have created a monopoly. We must take it down quickly.
The timer has started. We must stay alert.
We have a trade monopoly, pet. Can I trust you to watch my back?
Be wary, pet. The timer has started and our enemies are everywhere.
Ah, so the snake rears its ugly head.
You think a trade monopoly will save you from the might of the Spanish?
A trade monopoly? Do you think I will take this lying down?
Now you see the cunning of the Spanish.
Lie back, dog. It will all be over soon.
How do you like that? It would seem your strategy has failed you.
These Aztecs are strong, but not strong enough.
It is time we drove these Haudenosaunee back to their homelands.
These Aztecs fight with the strength of many.
The Haudenosaunee have more fight than I expected.
These Aztecs are too powerful. We are losing quickly.
The Haudenosaunee are too strong. I fear we may lose.
We must not lose to these weaklings. Pull yourself together.
How can these Indians be winning? We need to do better.
Well my little upstart, I can't buy our way out of this one.
Well, my little upstart, stick with me and do as I do. Successes like these will become old hat.
You might defeat me this time but understand it won't be easy to do again.
Do not be so certain of your victory that you grow lax in these last moments.
Only one minute until the end. Can you feel the pressure?
If you simply resign you can save yourself the disgrace of waiting out my victory.
A minor setback; we will still be victorious in the end.
Your actions have only delayed the inevitable.
Did you think I would allow you to win in such a manner?
Your countdown has stopped. What other tricks do you have up your sleeve?
We've missed our chance at victory. Let us resign and fight again.
We have some difficult fighting ahead of us, my little upstart. We must be quick about it.
A trade monopoly at last! We will soon put an end to this war.
The Dutch are known for both diplomacy and trade. This will be a fitting victory.
Trying to take the easy way out, eh, my little upstart? I'll put an end to this nonsense.
A victory by diplomacy and trade? I certainly didn't expect anything so civilized from you.
Accept your defeat and just allow this timer to run out in peace.
There. I have dictated the time of your defeat, unless you are made of sterner stuff than I have yet seen.
What do you make of the Aztecs now that their great cities are reduced to smoking rubble?
Our victory over the Haudenosaunee is imminent.
I am concerned about the Aztecs... they've grown strong while we were not looking.
The Haudenosaunee are all that I have heard and more. They are a dangerous enemy, not to be taken lightly.
Feathers and pelts, clubs and arrows - everywhere we turn we see... the Aztecs!
It was a grave strategic mistake to let the Haudenosaunee grow so strong. And now we are paying for it.
The Aztecs are so weak - how is it that we are losing? Never mind; let us rally and deal them a deadly blow.
With the Haudenosaunee so weak we may be able to make one last attack before the war is lost.
There is no time to waste! Throw everything you have at the enemy trading posts or we are done for!
Just one... wait! Surely you don't want it to end this way? Demolish one of your trading posts, quickly! Let us end this with a bang, not a whimper.
Victory is all but assured now. They have but one minute to stop us, and I do not think they can do it.
This is quite irksome. I guess we will have to seek victory the old-fashioned way.
You fools. You thought you could defeat me. I am now only seconds from winning.
Well, I have stopped their victory countdown. No doubt they will resort to other means.
Do not think this ends the threat to you.
The problem: too many enemy trading posts. The solution: elimination. Problem solved.
Keep calm. All we must do is knock down some of the enemy posts and all will be well.
The trade monopoly timer has been started. Perhaps you can help protect what is rightfully ours.
Do not relax your vigilance. The enemy will be desperate now.
Clever of you to use map control and a trade monopoly to try for a victory. However, it will not work.
Now the burden for action is on your shoulders. All I have to do is keep a firm grip on my trading posts and it's all over.
The Aztec must not be feeling well to have fought so poorly.
The Haudenosaunee did not have the technology to oppose us.
We have traveled too far to allow the Aztecs to become so powerful.
The Haudenosaunee look formidable; we should concentrate an attack on them.
We should have found a way to ally with the Aztecs.
This is first time I have seen the Haudenosaunee so dangerous.
If we can take out the remaining Aztec army there will be one less foe to worry about.
Before we are overrun, let us take out the puny Haudenosaunee.
We must make a move soon; our enemy is about to win.
If we just hold on, there is little hope for our foe.
It has been a pleasure battling you. I am saddened that you will win in this ignoble manner.
I admit defeat, but I do not admit your winning in this manner was noble. A true commander would have flattened my empire.
I predict another great victory for my empire, as a result of my achieving this monopoly.
My brilliance has prevailed. Instead of crushing your town, I found another way to win.
This is outrageous. How could my trade monopoly have been lost?!
My trade monopoly has been lost.
Your precious trade monopoly has been taken from you.
Your trade monopoly has been defeated. You'll have to fight like a soldier now.
Your attempt to claim this trade monopoly frightens me no more than the neighing of a horse.
I perceive you hope to win with a trade monopoly. But of course, you will fail.
It is a great and noble pleasure to discover that you have just claimed a trade monopoly!
Excellent news, my ally. Our path to victory with a trade monopoly has begun.
You will be forced to defend multiple locations, now that you have claimed a trade monopoly. But, he who defends everything defends nothing.
Do you think this trade monopoly you have begun can lead you to victory? My army has other ideas.
Truth is always the strongest argument. And the truth here is that I have just claimed a trade monopoly.
The trade monopoly timer has begun. It will not be long until yet another victory belongs to us.
Our Aztec foes must submit to a painful truth - they are almost defeated.
I see that our Haudenosaunee foes are close to finished.
Our Aztec enemies are much more powerful than our European sensibilities had guessed they would be.
We have found a mighty adversary in the Haudenosaunee.
Our mighty armies are being routed. It is the ferocity of the Aztecs that is taking us apart.
How could these Haudenosaunee be so powerful? Our team is losing badly.
The grim truth is that our alliance is failing. Let us take the Aztecs down with us before we fall.
Our team will be defeated soon, but we can destroy the Haudenosaunee before we go.

Gall will strike your town hard and fast. A raider with little patience for defense, he is a clever opponent eager to raid your towns and gatherers.
Cuauhtemoc is a crafty opponent whose mood can change at a moment's notice. Expect the unexpected when facing this aggressive Aztec ruler.

The WarChiefs features three playable Native civilizations - the Haudenosaunee, the Lakota, and the Aztec.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Warrior priests can occupy at the Community Plaza for greater effect.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Arrow Knights, Coyote Runner, Eagle Runner Knight, Jaguar Prowl Knight, Otontin Slinger, Puma Spearman and Skull Knight.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique buildings:</color>
Nobles Hut provides excellent defense and trains elite Aztec units.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique ceremonies:</color>
Healing Ceremony and Garland War Ceremony

A powerful central American nation that was well known for its conquest of neighbors. Their power was centered in Tenochtitlan, present day Mexico city.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Begins with a Travois that constructs buildings for free. Trees last longer.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Aenna, Forest Prowler, Kanya Horseman, Light Cannon, Mantlet, Musket Rider, Ram and Tomahawk.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique buildings:</color>
Longhouse supports up to 15 population and Siege Workshop trains and upgrades artillery.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique ceremonies:</color>
Founder Ceremony and Earth Mother Ceremony

The Haudenosaunee was a Native American civilization that thrived in the northeastern part of North America. The rule of the Confederacy was to keep peace with all members, and against a foe, they were a strong united force.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Begins with 200 population and Huntable Animals last longer, but cannot build Walls until the Industrial Age.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Axe Rider, Bow Rider, Cetan Bowman, Rifle Rider, Tokala Soldier, Tashunke Prowler, Wakina Rifle and Club Warrior.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique buildings:</color>
Teepee provides small hitpoint bonus to nearby units.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique ceremonies:</color>
Call the People Ceremony and Tokala Ceremony

The Lakota occupied large territories in North America, and also absorbed the “Great Plains” culture of their neighbors by becoming skilled buffalo hunters.

Gain 1500 Coin or Wood from selling Herdables in a single Skirmish or Multiplayer Match.\nTips: You can sell cattle without even selecting a Livestock Market, by simply ctrl-clicking the Wood or Coin Icons in the global UI.
Earn 500 Influence from Trading Posts placed on Trade Routes.\nTips: Trading Posts can be toggled to produce Influence, even before the Stagecoach upgrade.
Cause a Treasure Guardian to defeat another using the Emir's Chaos Ability in a Skirmish or Multiplayer Game.\nTips: Chaos affects stronger Guardians for a longer duration.

Switch your University to trickle Experience instead of Influence.\nTips: Experience is more important in the early game, but the Hausa also need to secure a steady income of Influence in the mid and late game to produce Cannons, Natives, Mercenaries, and more.

Create a maximum trickle University, by placing it near a Town Center, Palace and Trading Post.\nTips: For maximum Influence income, each University must have its own Town Center, Trade Post and Palace.

Water lanterns floating by the harbor for the Kamihinokinai Paper Balloon Festival.
Deal 1500 damage with Maigadi.\nTips: Maigadi are slow, but powerful Heavy Infantry, especially when engaging in melee.
Research 6 unique technologies at your Mountain Monastery or University.\nTips: Age up technologies can be researched for Influence, in the University for Hausa and in the Monastery for Ethiopia.
Train 20 Mercenaries from the Palace.\nTips: Saloon/Tavern Mercenaries appear in the Palace for African Civilizations.
Build 3 Watch Towers as the Ethiopians or Hausa in a single Skirmish or Multiplayer Game.\nTips: African Civilizations hire Outlaws at the Tower.
Build 10 Granaries in a single Skirmish or Multiplayer match.\nTips: Granaries are free, but take a while to construct.
Inspire a Building with a Griot from your University.\nTips: Griots can increase train and research speed of buildings, heal allies, and slow the attack speed of enemies, even artillery.
Have 20 fully fattened Herdables at the same time.\nTips: Fully fattened Cows trickle influence fast, but selling some at a good market price can be even better.
Gather 2000 Food from Huntables, Herdables, Fields, or Berries with Villagers buffed by a Granary.\nTips: Granaries boost all food income for nearby Villagers.

Eat a second cow before clicking up to the Commerce Age.\nTips: Livestock allows the African Civilizations to be very versatile, sell a cow to build your first House or University, age up quickly by eating them early, or sell one to train several more as an investment for later.
Hit 5 targets with a single shot from the Sebastopol Mortar in a Skirmish or Multiplayer Game.\nTips: The Sebastopol Mortar can be switched to explosive shot to deal less damage in a wider radius.

Earn 1000 Influence from Mountain Monasteries.\nTips: Mountain Monasteries can gather Coin faster and the ratio at which Villagers and Abuns gather Influence and Coin from them can be toggled to fit your strategy.
Use Abuns to gather 1000 Coin from a Mountain Monastery.\nTips: Abuns and Mountain Monasteries can also heal nearby units, even during battle.
Train 10 Gatling Camels from the Palace as the Ethiopians in a Skirmish or Multiplayer Game.\nTips: Gatling Camels can only be trained after aging up with the Arabs Alliance as the Ethiopians.

Tycoon: Players are in a race to obtain the highest score in Tycoon. To win this game mode focus on: building up your economy by training economic units and build buildings. Collect resources, progress in age and improve your technologies. 

Game Rules: 
- Tycoon will start with a 10 minute cease fire. 
- Complete Economic Challenges to boost your score. 
- All military units and buildings do not contribute to your Tycoon Score. 
- All military units are affected with a health decay. 

Economic Victory Conditions: 
- Player has reached the ending age. 
- Player/Team has taken the lead in Tycoon Score of more than 10k. 
- Maintain the position for 5 minutes.

FidelityFX Super Resolution is a “shadow-based” upscaling technique that takes place toward the end of the rendering pipeline. Image is rendered at a lower resolution than the native resolution and performs two passes to improve its visual quality so it's more akin to the native resolution.

Acquire a level 5 or above Home City for the Aztecs.
Tenochtitlan lies in Mexico City, in the state of Mexico, which is one of the United Mexican States.
Revolt to Mexico playing as the Spanish.
The Mexican struggle for independence started 1810 in Guanajuato with the Cry of Dolores.
Ally with the Zapotec Indigenous settlement.
Oaxaca is best known for its indigenous peoples and cultures. The most numerous and well known are the Zapotecs and the Mixtecs, but another fourteen are officially recognized.
Deal 5000 damage with the Skirmisher unit in a single game. (Dutch, French, German, Spanish)

A common misconception is that Cinco de Mayo is the Independence Day of Mexico. It actually commemorates the Battle of Puebla on the fifth of may ("cinco de mayo"), where outnumbered Mexican forces repelled the French invading army half a century after the Mexican War of Independence.
Build 20 Fishing Boats in a single game.
Named after the Nahuatl Michhuahcān, meaning "place of the fishermen" referring to those who fish on Lake Pátzcuaro.
Win a Skirmish/Multiplayer game against the French.
After shortly becoming the interim capital as President Benito Juárez fled from the French invasion, the city of San Luis Potosí fell to and stayed in Imperialist hands until 1866.
Win a Skirmish/Multiplayer game playing as the Spanish.
The port city of Veracruz was founded as the first Mexican municipality under the direct control of the king of Spain, even before the fall of the Aztec Empire.
Ally with the Indigenous Maya settlement.
The original name of the Yucatán peninsula was Mayab. In the Yucatec Maya language, mayab is translated as "flat", and is the source of the word "Maya" itself.
Win a Skirmish/Multiplayer game after revolting to Mexico as the Spanish.
The state motto is "Jalisco es México.", referencing how many characteristic traits of Mexican culture are originally from Jalisco, such as mariachi, ranchera music, birria, tequila, jaripeo...
Revolt 3 times to American nations (Peru, Gran Colombia, Brazil, Argentina, Mexico, United States, Chile, Canada).
Like most parts of Mexico, the state's early history was tumultuous, changing hands between Spanish, French and different Mexican factions many times in its first century.
Deal 1865 damage with your Explorer in a single game.

With the full name "Free and Sovereign State of Querétaro de Arteaga", the state was dedicated to José María Arteaga Magallanes, for his dedication in fighting the War of Reform and French Intervention for an independent Mexico.
Build 35 units from an Indigenous settlement in a single game.
Sonora was home to the Yaqui people resisting European influence, among them famous rebel leader Cajemé.
Gather 1824 Wood in a single game.
Tabasco has year-round rain and is mostly covered by rainforests.
Build 4 Mills in a single game.
Tamaulipas has more area of irrigated cropland than any other Mexican state.
Raze 10 buildings playing as the Aztecs in a single game.
Several attempts to establish a permanent colony of Nuevo León failed because of Chichimeca raids resisting the Spanish Conquistadores.
Win a Skirmish/Multiplayer match on the map Texas.
"Coahuila y Tejas" was one of the constituent states of the newly independent United Mexican States under their 1824 Constitution, and included Texas, Coahuila and Nuevo León.
Gather a total of 4000 Coin in a single game.
Durango opened a number of important mines in the 18th century and still is one of Mexico's leading producers of gold.
Gather 1562 Coin playing as the Spanish in a single game.
The first Spanish city in Chihuahua was settled by explorers who had been looking for "Seven Cities of Gold" in the 16th century.
Revolt to Gran Colombia. (Germans, Portuguese, or Spanish)

After independence from Spain, Chiapas had three paths, independent, Mexican with the north, or with the Federal Republic of Central America. Like Gran Colombia, that republic quickly split into a number of states each going their own way, Chiapas joining Mexico instead.
Train 20 Maya units in a single game.
A modern version of the famous ancient mesoamerican ballgame is still played in Sinaloa today.
Train 30 Revolutionaries in a single game.
Vicente Guerrero was a leading revolutionary during the war for Mexican independence and later abolished slavery on a national level.
Win a Skirmish/Multiplayer match against the Aztecs.

Aztec vassal Tlaxcala allied with Spain to rid themselves of their ruler, earning relative independence from Spanish control in the process and eventually resulting in the smallest state of modern Mexico.
Train 20 Pirate units in a single game. (All European civilizations and Chinese)
In the 17th century, Colima's ports were the target of pirate invasions for the precious cargo of Manila Galleons docking there.
Ship 2 factories from your Home City.
With its central location in Mexico and railway lines to major cities, Aguascalientes became a manufacturing center for the textile industry.
Build 5 ships in a single game.
As an important trading port, Campeche struggled with piracy, with ships sent out against the pirates often ending up captured instead.
Gather 1824 Coin playing as the British in a single game.

Since mining operations in Hidalgo were in shambles after the Mexican war of independence, British mining companies revived the sector, bringing in state of the art steam-powered equipment and experience.
Deal 1812 damage with Revolutionaries in a single game.
The Siege of Cuautla in 1812 was a vital early victory for insurgents by the priest and rebel leader José María Morelos, to whom the state was later dedicated.
Revolt before 20 minutes of game time has passed in Skirmish/Multiplayer starting in the Exploration Age.
While Nayarit did not become its own state until 1917, it participated in the fight for independence with José María Morelos from the very beginning.
Win a Skirmish/Multiplayer match on the map Baja California.
In 1853, filibuster William Walker and 45 other Americans captured the capital La Paz and declared an independent republic, but were quickly driven out by Mexican forces.
Earn 3000 Experience from a match in a single game.
Andrés Quintana Roo was a lawyer, author and rebel during the fight for Mexican independence, writing for insurgent newspapers like El Ilustrador Americano.
Revolt to Mexico on the map Baja California.
Under President Porfirio Díaz, Baja California was split and foreign mining operations and maritime routes were established to develop the country.

Maltese cuisine is known for its mix of influences from all over Europe. Qormi is particularly famous for its bakeries and Maltese bread.
Deal 5,000 Damage with Artillery in a single Skirmish or Multiplayer match.

When Mdina, the barely defended capital, was about to be attacked during the Great Siege of Malta, their cannons opened fire at ineffectively long range, duping the invaders into believing they had enough ammunition to spare, abandoning their assault.

In modern times known as Birgu, the town was named "the victorious" for its major role in the Great Siege of Malta.
Defeat 100 units against the Ottoman civilization in a single Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Valletta is named for the Hospitaller Grand Master Jean Parisot de la Valette, who defended the island against 40,000 Ottomans in the Great Siege of Malta despite being outnumbered 10-to-1.

Aosta was already settled during Roman times, but had a tumultuous journey through the hands of many other AoE civilizations: Goths, Burgundians, Byzantines, Franks, French, and the Holy Roman Empire before Italy was finally unified.

Genoa was an Italian maritime republic with a fierce rivalry with Venice over free trade agreements with other Mediterranean empires.

Bari blossomed into a major port city in the early 19th century, expanding outside its medieval city walls with a new district laid out in an orthogonal grid following rationalist ideals.

By the end of the Middle Ages, Bologna had the most convents in Italy, but the church's heavy influence slowed scientific and industrial progress, targeting intellectuals such as the famous astronomer Galileo.

As a Free Imperial City of the Holy Roman Empire, Trieste was an important and flourishing trading port in the north near Austria.

The Cittadella di Ancona was built under the pretext of deterring Ottoman invasions, but in reality served to help the Pope annex the maritime Republic of Ancona.

Blades forged Campobassan blacksmiths and artisans were used to such effect by its militias during revolts that the Duke of Bourbon banned their production in 1750. Subsequently, the city became famous for its ornamented scissors, razors, and other tools.

After being abandoned by their Savoyard king, the people of Cagliari managed to repel a French invasion force – but expected a reward from their mainland ruler. After none was granted, they turned against him as well, resulting in two years of independent rule.
Revolt 3 times in any amount of Skirmish or Multiplayer matches.
As the second largest city of Europe in the 17th century, Naples was fertile ground for revolts and plagues alike.

The Republic of Venice came to rule much of the Mediterranean through maritime prowess before losing most of their holdings and warships in the many Ottoman-Venetian wars.

Despite initially being woefully outnumbered, Garibaldi captured Palermo during his Expedition of a Thousand – largely because large numbers of Sicilians joined him.

The first University in Perugia was founded in 1308. More followed in 1573 and 1788.

Verona has a 2000 year-old amphitheatre that is still in use today.

Lucca is known as "Città d'arte" (town of art), thanks to its intact Renaissance-era city walls.

The Tower of Pisa constructed over the course of two centuries while Pisa fought the rival Republics of Genoa, Lucca, and Florence – which potentially saved the tower by giving the soil time to settle.

Vittorio Emanuele II\nThe victorious father of the fatherland played a decisive role in the unification of Italy, but he also wears a majestic beard!
Venetian Noblewoman\nA rich noblewoman from Venice with a carnival costume equal in richness. The Doge surely will be much impressed.
Italian Devotee\nA devout believer, this saintly sister fights for the good of all things, great and small.
Roman Centurion\nAve, Caesar! For this centurion the Roman Empire never ceased to exist. Roma invicta!
Morgan Black\nA widely misunderstood Scottish knight who acts and speaks frankly. Be like Captain Morgan Black, be dangerous!
Knightess Templar\nLiving according to the Templar's Creed this knightess tries to recover the Holy Grail which she suspects Illuminati treasure guardians to withhold.
Alain Magnan\nA rogue grand master struck from the official records. Likes to go round in circles in his pursuit of some alleged Fountain of Youth.
Aztec Queen\nThat escalated quickly! A woman on the Aztec throne! Her foes would be fools to expect any leniency though. The only way to survive the mama with the chancla is to obey – or to run away!
Goddess\nWhether you know how to pronounce Malinalxochitl or Xochiquetzal won't make a difference. You either offer her a blood sacrifice – or become one!

General Warwick\nBorn into nobility this general of the British empire considers it a virtue to look down on his opponents. His pretentious demeanor and posh uniform provenly have left a lasting impression on the battlefield.
Francis Drake\nThis British pirate knight has seen the world and claims to know the locations of many treasures. Hire him as privateer if you want a demonstration of his skill!
Zheng Yi Sao\nZheng Yi Sao rose from ship planks to riches as leader of a Pirate confederation. She is great eluding the grasp from mighty opponents but will enforce a strict codex on her fellows.
William the Silent\nThis famous Dutch Stadhouder may be called silent but his splendid shiny armor implies he will remain anything but quiet on the battlefield. Aanvall!
Dutch Prince\nA Dutch prince in picturesque Schutterij attire. The vambraces cost him extra. So better get your brush out and paint!
Captain Pecaudy\nThis captain from New France mastered fort defences and knows how to keep his white uniform clean in between all the dirty combat.
Fernig Sister\nThe famous Fernig Sisters dress like men, fight like men, but ... which of the "sœurs" is she? Théophile? Félicité? Who is the lucky one?
Marianne\nThe French goddess of liberty absolutely busted the monarchy! That's why all the busts.

Fräulein\nO'zapft is! This Bavarian Fräulein had her fill of carrying beer mugs around and decided to carry responsibility in the world outside instead. She still took a heavy mug with her. Hydration is important.
Empress Sissi\nThe lovely Sissi from the House of Wittelsbach, Empress of Austria, Queen of Hungary – and always looking out for her Franz!
Ká:nien\nA fierce warrior of the Mohawk tribe with lightning-fast reflexes driven by the protection of his people.
Thayendanegea\nKnown to Western leaders as "Joseph Brant" this Haudenosaunee war chief used his talents in diplomacy and war to great effect in the interest of the Six Nations.
Nonahkee\nA gentle Haudenosaunee woman with advanced knowledge of herbal medicine that allows her and others to offer resistance in long conflicts.
Queen Amina\nSince the Emir has been a disappointment it is now time for Queen Amina herself pick up the reins of this camel as well as Hausaland!

Qoya\nThis beautiful Inca queen won't stay in the stronghold all day, but it is not recommended to approach her. Getting too close to the Qoya is the same as getting too close to Huayna Cápac or the Inca sun – death by fire!
Quechua Woman\nA quechua woman in the traditional violet Cusco dress featuring an ornate pollera skirt with llama patterns.

Nanib Sahir\nThis former Lieutenant of the British East India Trading Company now issues the fire commands for his Sepoys from the back of an elephant – to push all ruthless trading companies back into the sea!
Armored Elephant\nThis stubborn elephant and his mahout like to run up against a brick wall! They must have copied this behavior from another game. Do not try this at home!
Kichiro\nThis ambitious commander is eager to prove himself on the battlefield. Kichiro is loyal to the core, but will take vengeance – should you prefer another general.

Nakano Takeko\nAs leader of the Jōshitai in the Boshin War Nakano Takeko led by example with her naginata. Her courage and fighting skill easily match that of the male Samurai  – as does her splendid armor.
Kunoichi\nTrained in the martial arts of Ninjutsu this female warrior can infiltrate enemy bases and turn the enemies' heads.
Ogle Tanka Un\nThis Lakota war leader dressed up with his most impressive warbonnet and mounted his finest horse to pay a flying visit to all the Seven Council Fires.
Chayton Black\nDeeply concerned with the state of the Lakota lands Chayton Black will defend them courageously and unleash his wrath on traitors and threats of any kind.

Wise Woman\nThough not a warrior this powerful wise woman knows very well how to defend herself. Her greatest talent is to inspire and talk sense into the warriors to take the necessary measures in order for her tribe to survive and thrive.
Adelita\nA tough soldadera like her can carry almost anything: The wounded back to camp, guns to the battle, and even the game itself. ¡Viva la Revolución!
La Catrina\nThe elegant Catrina still has it in her bones! Rich in calcium and full of morbid humor this dress is ideal to celebrate dead treasure guardians.
Şahin\nThis Ottoman Yüzbaşı sailed to the Americas and visited spots nowhere to be found on Piri Reis' map! His kilij is as sharp as his sense for fruitful alliances.

Çelebi\nEvliya Çelebi is a traveling gentleman who loves to explore countries and cultures. His travelogues put most travel blogs to shame – as well as the track record of all the other amateur explorers.
Cangaçeiro\nIf you ever get tired of building new towns this Cangaçeiro outfit will instead encourage you to plunder the enemy towns like Lampião on fire!

Maria of Portugal\nThere is nothing that Maria's money can't buy. If she ever fell over a rock in enemy territory, she would be able to ransom herself from her worst enemy. She could buy ... immortality!
Boyar\nThis aristocrat landed a job in the landed army. It's not like he needed to work, but remember, respect is everything!
Mila the Bear\nLook into those big wide eyes, could that bear ever harm anyone? She just wants to play! Hurl around those enemy soldiers through the air!
Thor\nBy Thor's hammer! It's him! This Norse god was so bored in Midgard that he brought Mjölnir to smash some treasure guardians. Time to go berserk!

Queen Kristina\nKristina's defiance of norms and hunger for knowledge grants her an advantage over adversaries set in old patterns. Though dressed in the uniform of a Swedish officer her spirit is free and rebellious!
Amelia\nAll too familiar with the dangers of the frontier, Amelia is a crack shot, and her shotgun is never far from her hand. Your State Militias will be awestruck by this determined and fiery lady!

Delgado\nA greedy conquistador who goes by the name Francisco Juan Delgado de León. He has a good nose for the most exquisite treasures as well as the means to load them onto the Spanish treasure fleet

Try out the new Tycoon game mode in Skirmish!
Try out the new game mode, Tycoon in Skirmish! \n\nYou can also learn the tutorial by selecting 'Play Tutorial' or find it in the Tutorials sub-menu.

This new game mode is a more casual play experience in which players vie to create the most productive economic engine for their civilization. 

Free from the pressure of the head-to-head play, this new mode allows players to explore and strengthen economic strategies that they can then deploy in other Game Modes. 

Try out the different game rules as you explore this new game mode!

Welcome to the Tycoon Tutorial. 

This tutorial will teach the fundamentals of this game mode. 

Select Skip Tutorial if you wish to skip and play. 

Or select Continue if you wish to continue with the tutorial.

The main objective of Tycoon is to reach the highest Tycoon Score possible. Players should prioritize building economic units and buildings then upgrading their technologies to increase overall resource gain.\n\nPlayers can also gain Tycoon Score through unique systems, only available in this new game mode.

Completing Economic Challenges will grant Tycoon Score bonuses. \n\nThe system allows all players to compete over who will reach certain milestones on a ranked basis. The Economic Challenges menu can be opened through the in-game HUD for a more detailed view.

Players are able to purchase Tycoon packages, which act as an alternative to training military units which would occur frequently in other game modes. Tycoon Packages are purchased with resources and give a bonus Tycoon Score. The bonus is reduced on each purchase, but slowly recovers over time.
Cease fire is a game rule to rule out early-game rush tactics. \n\nThis option can be turned off in the lobby.

With the exception of Explorers, all Military Units in Tycoon Mode incur Hitpoint decay, similar to that of existing Militia and Levy-type units. This helps further shift the focus away from combative gameplay, as strong Military units cannot be stockpiled, and must be utilised quickly after being trained.

For breakaway players & teams, scoring much higher than others, there is a special victory condition called Economic Victory. To achieve an Economic Victory, players must maintain a lead of 10,000 Tycoon Score & be in the final Age. This is similar to King of the Hill victory or Trade Monopoly. This has been implemented to allow for decisive victories, rewarding the most powerful economies.
You are now ready to play Tycoon! \n\nGood luck and have fun!

In Age III DE, you'll experience a whole new way to play within the Age of Empires franchise, with unique gameplay mechanics, diverse, in-depth civilizations, and exciting game mode options which allow you to experience the game your way. \n\nWith genre-advancing gameplay, such as the addition of the Explorer, unique hero units who can gather special treasures that can dramatically impact the battle -- the removal of resource drop off points which allow you to focus more on strategy and a quicker pace of play -- to the Home City shipment system which provides thousands of unique strategies by allowing you to create & customize specific decks that can be tailored to counter any moves made by your opponents and even turn the tide of battle at critical moments, Age III DE will provide endless hours of fun. And, with the addition of Co-Op play, you can bring your friends and battle your way to victory together. We hope you enjoy the game as much as we enjoyed making it.

Yellow River: Offers extra resources and choke points when flooded, but is open and fertile when dry. Trade Routes on each side of the map, and many natives.

Settlements: Shaolin, Zen
Outlaws: Wokou Horseman, Wokou Monk

During the dry season, the waters of the Yellow River recede to create fertile new islands, and animals often gather near the river's edge to drink. During times of flood, extra resources abound and naval craft are sometimes seen along the river. Recruit local groups as allies to take advantage of their multiple trade routes located along the borders of the map.

Deccan: A central, forested plateau overlooking a series of strategically placed trade sites.

Settlements: Udasi, Sufi, Bhakti
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Marathan Thuggee

Players start on opposite sides of a central plateau that contains thick forests and abundant wildlife. Resources are plentiful, as Mines, small herds, and sparse forests ring the surrounding lowlands. Trade sites are situated at the edge of the map, while natives inhabit the plateau. The plateau is not present in free-for-all games.
Yellow River: A slower version of the Yellow River map, one that requires a strong naval presence.

The Yellow River has flooded. A navy is required to explore the river's central fords, many of which have been submerged by the rising waters. Due to the excessive flooding, fishing in the region is plentiful, and extra berries can be found growing along the fertile riverbanks.\n \nRecruit religious sects as allies to take advantage of their multiple trade sites located along the borders of the map.

Listen, for this is the last statement of Lord Torii Mototada.
A large number of rebel daimyo have lay siege to this castle and are mere moments from penetrating its heart.
But I do not fear death.
If you choose to give your life for your master, you will not have the slightest fear, even in the face of disaster.
It is an honor to lay down my life for my master, Tokugawa.
I only wish I could have done more in his name. That wish is the right of every dead man.
I have news, Kichiro. The unifier of Japan has died, and his dynasty now balances on the edge of a sword.
At this very moment, my enemy Ishida Mitsunari is mobilizing the western clans into an army to oppose me.
So we will march against him. Today if we must.
You remind me why I took a trembling orphan into my care ten years ago. I saw the same ferocity in his eyes that I see now.
But remember, Kichiro. There will come a time when you will have to choose between your own ambition and the ambition of your master.
My loyalty will not falter, tono. No matter what awaits.
As it should be. Even the fiercest of us must learn to heel.

General, Osaka Castle has readied its defenses.
They are fools. I welcome a challenge.
Greetings. You must be the renowned General Kichiro. The last we met, you still had cheeks round with baby fat.
Hello, Daimyo Mototada. Our master said you might choose to join me.
As always, my clan is at your service.
Osaka Castle is the true seat of power. Whoever occupies it holds complete authority.
Are you aware that the heir to the Toyotomi dynasty is just a five-year-old boy?
Yes, but a castle is the home of a ruler, not of a child.
Then it is time we made Osaka Castle fit for a king again.
Increases damage of gunpowder infantry and cavalry.
You have sent informers to investigate the enemy.
The defenses are stronger than anticipated. A headlong charge would end in slaughter.
Look for allies in the surrounding villages. They will know how to exploit the castle's weaknesses.
Look for allies in the surrounding clans.
Osaka Castle has mistreated these people for years. We can use their anger to our advantage.

string.@comment: Objective: destroy the stockade and free the prisoners
string.#text: The castle has imprisoned our brothers for plotting an uprising. They will surely be executed.

string.@comment: Objective: destroy the stockade and free the prisoners
string.#text: Freedom! We are in your debt, stranger. Come, brothers! Let us take back our honor!
The Osaka guard understands only force. If we had a castle then they could no longer mistreat us.
This is the moment we have waited for! Take the walls!
You will pay for this insurrection. Send men to the western gates! The villagers rebel!
We have secured the gates, General. It is time to strike!
Stranger, help us. Murderous ronin from the east have plagued us for months, but the castle does nothing.
Vanquish these bandits and the castle gates will tumble to the ground. We will make sure of it.

string.@comment: This sequence is for the bombing of the castle gates.
string.#text: Thank you. Now we will help you breach the castle gates. They will be sorry for ignoring us.

string.@comment: This sequence is for the bombing of the castle gates.
string.#text: Chiko? Where are you, Chiko? Honorable one, have you seen my pet duck?

string.@comment: This sequence is for the bombing of the castle gates.
string.#text: Get away from that wall! Look for your duck somewhere else!

string.@comment: This sequence is for the bombing of the castle gates.
string.#text: My apologies. I am sure you will know if you find him. Sayonara!

string.@comment: This sequence is for the bombing of the castle gates.

string.#text: Those Osaka outposts lord over our lives. Liberate us, and we simple farmers will help you bring about a bloody harvest.
Take my advice, Kichiro. Train monks to aid you in battle. Their counsel knows no equal.
With the wisdom of the monks, our victory is certain.
The fight for Osaka Castle is over. Japan has no ruler but Tokugawa.
Now that you have done your job, General, let us do ours. Death to the tyrants!
There is not much time. We must hurry and destroy Uesugi's growing army before it becomes a threat.
Many villagers did not agree with this uprising and have been imprisoned. If we free them, they will no doubt take up arms with us.
If we reach them in time, there is no doubt their warriors will take up arms with us.
Many thanks, my lords. This village is friendly to you, but I cannot say the same for the others.
Draw your swords! Uesugi has prepared us a murderous welcome!

string.@comment: Objective: Free first village and prepare army for Uesugi's attack
string.#text: This whole province is a staging area for war. In a matter of minutes, Uesugi will hurl his army upon us.

string.@comment: Objective: Free first village and prepare army for Uesugi's attack
string.#text: Thank you. Many of us were imprisoned for refusing to participate in this foolish uprising.

string.@comment: Objective: Free first village and prepare army for Uesugi's attack
string.#text: Then we must not waste another second. The villages are Uesugi's weakness. He cannot recruit men from villages that are no longer standing.
One village has fallen to us, but there are others. We must hurry to put down this rebellion.
Aizu province is ours, but the final battle nears. Prepare to cross swords with Uesugi.
Tokugawa is on the march. He has made a grave mistake in underestimating those loyal to the heir.
He will strike first, only to have his sword shatter. Assemble the samurai!
Tokugawa has made a grave mistake coming here. Attack! Leave no head attached!
When we refused to join his rebellion, Uesugi shattered our trade route. Help us restore trade and we will fight alongside you.
Uesugi has captured our dojo and disgraced us. Raze the barracks to help restore our honor.
We are yours, General. With your support, we will win back this province for the people.
You do good work, General. Now let us help you with the points of our swords.
We have done it! The uprising has been crushed.
Come. It is time to count the dead. We still have bloodier battles ahead of us.
Seizing the Tokaido Road is the only way to maintain our supply lines. We must destroy Ishida's trading posts and replace them with our own.
But we must act quickly. A warrior should never appear weak in the eyes of his enemy.
We must act fast. A warrior should never appear weak in the eyes of his enemy.
We must keep a trading post on this road at all times. It is our only link to reinforcements.

string.@comment: Objective: destory Ishida's tower by the Wokou dock
string.#text: So, Ishida sides with pirates. Venture west and put an end to this dangerous alliance.

string.@comment: Objective: destory Ishida's tower by the Wokou dock
string.#text: Ishida is weak. We will betray him on one condition: that he suffers an excruciating death.

string.@comment: Objective: build a trading post and defend the first fort
string.#text: Ishida's presence is being reduced to ashes. Quickly! Establish a trading post to hold your ground.

string.@comment: Objective: build a trading post and defend the second fort
string.#text: Clear the land of them and ready the defenses!

string.@comment: Objective: You have cleared the entire road of Ishida's forces
string.#text: Excellent! We have wrenched the road from Ishida's grasp. Now we must keep the supply line open.
General, Ishida is forcing innocent villagers to fight for him. We must stop this injustice and destroy those barracks.
We will not stop fighting until every man responsible finds his head on the tip of a spear.
Powerful lord, you have saved us and we are in your debt.
Kichiro-dono, you have showed us how to fight our oppressors. Now it is our turn. Attack!
Ishida's elite guard makes its camp to the south. Destroy it to deal Ishida a crippling blow.

string.@comment: Objective: execute an amphibious assault on Ishida's flank
string.#text: Our spies report a weakness in Ishida's coastal defenses. We should consider an assault by sea.

string.@comment: Your trading post is under attack.
string.#text: Sir, the trading post is under attack! You must send men to our aid!

string.@comment: Your trading post has been sacked, fool!
string.#text: No! Our last trading post has been destroyed. The blood of the dead is on your hands.
The road is clear but Ishida has vanished. He will not dare show his face in this province again.
The battle is joined! To the walls!
Defend Fushimi Castle until the enemy falls...or until we do!
Our loyalty is to the people of Fushimi. We fight for the castle and for its lord.
Ishida has captured many of the castle garrison. They are being held in stockades to the south.
Thank you, General. My sword craves justice. Its edge will shine with the blood of my enemies.
Our archers wither in the path of the enemy Ashigaru. Locate Ishida's black powder cache and blow it heavenward.
We must hurry! These men are desperately needed inside the castle!
Those monks helped supply Ishida's siege engine. They have paid for their treachery.
Kichiro, it is up to you to escort the people to safety. Use the road to the east, but always be aware of the enemy.
The evacuation is a success, but the battle rages on. If you must die, men, then do so fighting.

string.@comment: You are losing and near defeat
string.#text: Keep fighting! The enemy beats against our door!
There is no turning back, Kichiro. We must fight our way to the enemy's doorstep and end this war once and for all.
The enemy army consists of many potential turncoats. As we fight, keep your eyes open for chances to turn these traitors to our side.

string.@comment: The mysterious Ishida finally appears, and speaks at the beginning of the battle
string.#text: The fog is thick and the skies are gray, but I can see clearly, and all signs point to victory.

string.@comment: The mysterious Ishida finally appears, and speaks at the beginning of the battle
string.#text: Tokugawa will march into the center of our positions and we will batters him from all sides. He will pay once and for all for his aggression.

string.@comment: Ishida panics once the river is crossed and Tokugawa forces attack his castle
string.#text: How can this be? Our positions were strong, our numbers overwhelming.

string.@comment: Objective: win the Kikkawa clan by bringing a cart of coin
string.#text: The daimyo to the east fights this war for riches, not for power.

string.@comment: Objective: win the Kikkawa clan by bringing a cart of coin
string.#text: A gift of gold would persuade him to the righteousness of our cause.

string.@comment: Objective: win the Kikkawa clan by bringing a cart of coin
string.#text: I am impressed, Tokugawa. I did not think you could afford my friendship.

string.@comment: Objective: win the Kikkawa clan by bringing a cart of coin
string.#text: You have my men. Please try to return them when you are finished. They are quite expensive.
Daimyo Otani, a close ally of Ishida, camps to the north. He is a leper with little time left on this earth.
If we assassinate Otani, his forces will surely scatter.
Ishida has more expertise in tea ceremonies than in strategy. Our interest should be in turning his weakest allies.

string.@comment: Objective: destroy the western command post to win allegiance
string.#text: The clan to the east pledged us its loyalty but has yet to act. Remind them who rules these lands.

string.@comment: Objective: destroy the western command post to win allegiance
string.#text: Tokugawa, your authority is supreme. Our clan awaits your orders.

string.@comment: A clan sides with you at your show of force
string.#text: Our show of force has convinced the Akaza clan to fight at our side. Welcome them as brothers.
Ishida's armies have crumbled into dust, and Tokugawa stands victorious.
There has been enough bloodshed. This war for power ends here.
Increases the amount Yamabushi can heal and increases their hitpoints and attack.

Yabusame Archer Speed Shipment has arrived.

Yabusame Archer Attack Shipment has arrived.
Allows you to support 100 population without the need for Houses or Town Centers (total population is not increased).
Military units from native settlements have their attack and hitpoints greatly increased.

Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Osaka is heavily defended. You will need a sizable army to lay siege to the Castle. Surrounding towns may offer you assistance, but for a price.
Destroy the Outposts that guard the farmers.
These innocent farmers are being closely watched by two Outposts of Osaka Castle. If you wish to win their freedom, the Outposts must be destroyed.
Free the captive woodcutters of Osaka.
The Osaka garrison has imprisoned the castle woodcutters for plotting a rebellion. If you find the stockade and free the rebels, they will become powerful allies.

The Villagers to the north have ways to get through the Castle gates. If you force the Ronin out of their territory, the Villagers will share their secrets with you. Of course, the Ronin will not go quietly.
Build a Castle in the western village.

The Villagers to the west have been persecuted for many years. However, with the might of a Castle behind them, the Villagers may finally act on their anger and fight beside you against their oppressor.
Build a Stable near the Osaka Shrines.
Construct a Stable near the homes of the Osaka villagers. They will repay you by toppling a section of the Castle wall.
The Japanese do not hunt for their Food, but they can still take advantage of the wildlife. Building Shrines attracts fauna, and the busier your Shrines become, the higher their rate of production.
The Russians provide you with European siege and banner army shipments and technology.

Bonus: +7% Land Unit Hitpoints

Trains: Musketeers, Falconets, Hussars

Shipments: Support units
The French provide you with European siege and cavalry shipments and technology.
Ships in siege weapons, ships, and mercenaries from Europe.
Diverse tropical trees including palms and strangler figs. Harvest for Wood.
Advance in Age with a Villager.
Use your Villagers to build a Wonder to go to the next age.
The Emperor has honored you with a grant of provisions from the Imperial City.
The Council has provided you with supplies to found a new village.
Villagers gather Food from hunted animals faster.
Villagers gather Coin from Mines faster.
Villagers gather Food from hunted animals faster.
Villagers gather Coin from Mines faster.
Ride to the nearest town and free its villagers.
Ride to the nearest village and free its villagers. Then use their help to quell the loyalist uprising.
Destroy as many villages as you can before Uesugi arrives.
When Uesugi's army marches, it will visit each village in Aizu province and acquire more warriors. Destroy the villages quickly, before the enemy grows too large to fight.
Destroy the headquarters of the loyalist uprising.
Rebuild all of the Trading Posts along the Trade Route.
Uesugi Kagekatsu hopes to lure your army into a trap. Take advantage of nearby villages to build an army strong enough to withstand Uesugi's attack. Then find and destroy his command post.
Advance in Age with a Villager.
Help the refugee Villagers reestablish their Trade Route by rebuilding all of their Trading Posts. After that, they will consider becoming your allies.
The enemy to the northeast will fiercely defend their stolen Barracks, so you will need a strong force. However, when you strike, be sure not to leave your home village defenseless.
Gain control of all 3 Trading Sites on the Tokaido Road.
Trains monks and provides monk improvements.
Ishida controls the length of the Tokaido Road, severing your link to needed supplies. Storm the encampments and destroy the Trading Posts, replacing them with Trading Posts of your own.
Destroy Ishida's Tower by the Wokou Docks.
Ending Ishida's alliance with the Wokou pirates will reduce any threat of an enemy navy. It could also work to your advantage, as Wokou fishing boats will boost your food production.
Maintain control of the Tokaido Road for 5 minutes.
Ishida will most likely launch a counterattack to regain control of his lost Outposts. Gird your defense all along the road to prevent against weakness.
Find and destroy the enemy Barracks and Stables.
To prevent against counterattack, raze the enemy's Barracks, Stables, and Shrines to keep him from rebuilding his armies.
Destroy all enemies along the eastern road.
The enemy occupies the eastern road. The only way for the villagers to escape is if you can rid the road of the enemy's presence.
Escort 30 villagers to freedom before the Castle falls.

The battle does not go well, but all is not lost if a majority of the Fushimi villagers can be brought to safety. Find a clear path to the rear of the castle and escort these villagers out of harm's way.
The enemy has established many camps outside the castle's perimeter, and one of them contains a heavily guarded Stockade. Be prepared to fight for the Yabusame Archer's freedom.
Naginata Riders would help defend the gates from the onslaught of Ishida's armies.
Destroy the enemy Trading Post at the Zen encampment.

As Ishida surrounds your Castle, it is smart to strike out at his allies and undermine their support. Venture to the Zen encampment and destroy the enemy Trading Post. Every effort to cut off Ishida's supply line makes a difference on the battlefield.

With your numbers low, it is imperative that you recruit help from any ally that may be willing to come to your aid. Ninja have been known to roam this region. Locate the Ninja and convince them to reinforce your ailing castle garrison.
Destroy the Gunpowder Stores around the camp to help destroy it and free the prisoners.
Ishida's forces of the western army vastly outnumber your own. To defeat him, you will need to subvert his allies and win them to your side. Then take the fight to Ishida in his Castle.
Assassinate Daimyo Otani of the northern clan.

Otani is a close friend of Ishida's. To assassinate him would deal your enemy a crushing personal blow. The leper daimyo can be found to the north, where his guard will battle to the death for his survival.
Send a Coin Wagon to the eastern village to win its support.
Some friends are better bought than made. Send a Coin Rickshaw to win over the eastern clan. This village will then be a strategic obstacle between your village and that of the enemy.
Damage the Castle in the center of the battlefield.
An attack on the Castle in the center of the battlefield will prove your might to its ruler. This show of power could win his support in battle.
Gain 10,000 experience points to turn Daimyo Kobayakawa to your side.
If you are able to encounter and befriend Ishida's allies, the Kobayakawa clan may be impressed enough to join its destiny with yours.
King of the Hill Victory Started!
%1s has taken control of the King's Hill and will win in %2s
%1s has control of all the Relics and will win in %2s
Ancient relic: Provides coin to its controller. Capture all of them to start a victory timer.
Military Wonder: Defensive Wonder that grants extra attack to nearby units.

string.#text: Capture the Hill by moving military troops into the area
Controlling the Hill starts a victory countdown. Undefended, it will convert to whoever moves military units into the area.

Keep fighting! Cut down your enemies!
The grounds are littered with our dead. Is this the end of Fushimi Castle?
Show the servants of Tokugawa what happens to betrayers. For a unified Japan!
They ground is muddy with the blood of our enemies. Do not stop now. Flood the gates!
The enemy weakens. Strike now, as they catch their breath.
We have fought hard to prevent the inevitable, but our resistance is weakening.
We are free! On our honor, Ishida will never set foot in Fushimi Castle.
Kichiro, you must get the villagers to safety. I will defend the castle while you clear the eastern road of enemies.
Villagers escape to the east. You must protect them.
Build near Native American settlements or Trade Routes. Provides experience points and other benefits.
Heavy cavalry armed with a lance for killing infantry.
Slow, heavy infantry with a large attack.
Ranged cavalry armed with pistols. Good against cavalry and artillery.
Ships 8 Tercios and a Falconet. Allows training of Falconets at the Consulate.
Ships Stadswacht Halberdiers and a Falconet. Allows Falconets to be trained at the Consulate.

Upgrades attack and hitpoints of Falconets and ships Gendarmes.
Upgrades attack and hitpoints of Culverin and ships Voltigeurs.
Ships Gendarmes and allows you to train Falconets at your Consulate.

Ships 1 Wokou Junk containing 11 Thuggees, +1 Villagers.
All Villagers and Fishing Boats gather faster.
Throw down a smoke bomb and vanish to your Town Center.

This Wonder is producing Iron Troop archers.

Ships a Dojo Rickshaw, allowing you to construct a powerful Dojo to produce your choice of military units.
Advances you to the Imperial Age.
Ships a powerful Daimyo. Daimyos receives Shipments, can train infantry and cavalry and boost the attack of nearby allies.
Ships a powerful Daimyo. Daimyos receives Shipments, can train infantry and cavalry and boost the attack of nearby allies.
Ships a powerful Daimyo. Daimyos receives Shipments, can train infantry and cavalry and boost the attack of nearby allies.
Ships the Shogun, a powerful overlord who can receive Shipments and train Yamabushi, Shinobi, and artillery. He also provides a hitpoints boost to nearby units.
An army of Spanish Tercios (Pikemen).\n8 Tercios: Archaic hand infantry that is good against cavalry.
Grants an increase to base XP trickle.
Gives Houses and Villages a healing aura.
Increases the ranged attack of War Academy.
Ships Spies and allows you to train them from the Consulate.
Decreases build time of defenses (Town Center, Village, Tower, and Walls).
A thug, good against heavy infantry
A dangerous Indian thug armed with a rifle.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Increases hitpoints and anti-ship attack of War Academy. Adds a cannon attack.
Release From Service Shipment has arrived.
Ships Mongolian Army units and crates of Food.
Ships Mongolian Army units and crates of Food.
Ships Mongolian Army units and crates of Food.
Ships Mongolian Army units and crates of Food.
Native boat that can attack or transport units.

Fishing Boats gain an attack and get a small boost to hitpoints and line of sight, +1 Villager.

Advance in Age with a Villager.

string.@comment: 1 - max allowed decks, 2 - number of decks that need to be deleted before creating a new one
string.#text: The maximum number of allowed decks is %1d. Please delete at least %2d deck(s) before creating another one.
Immediately delivers a shipment of Settlers. Unlocks shipments of siege, mercenaries, and Surgeons.
Our victory is short-lived. Allies of Ishida have risen up in the eastern provinces.
The enemy hopes to surround my army on all sides, trapping it like a beetle under a jar.
Crush this threat, swiftly and fatally. You cannot breathe when there is a sword at your throat.
I would have waited for Ishida to make a mistake. Instead, we walk right into his trap.
You should not question the master, Kichiro. Obedience means nothing if it is not absolute.
It seems I have much to learn.
Do not learn too much, or soon I will call you "Master."
Our men cling to life, Kichiro-dono. They need time to recover.
There is no time. Our forces must return west to seize the supply road.
Then our men will march, but at a dead man's pace.
Yes, and in the future you will not question my orders.
It is nothing. I still have a head, which is more than I can say for my enemy.
The master wishes me to return home to Fushimi Castle. It seems the enemy has set his eye on my beautiful estate.
Then I will join you when the time comes.
This general of the Oda clan demands to speak with you.
So, it is you, Tokugawa's pet.
You are right, I am the servant of the rightful ruler of Japan.
Your loyalty is to your true clan, Kichiro. Your master is a liar.
Hold your tongue before you lose it!
Do not allow Tokugawa to make a fool of you any longer.
Tell me how I am a fool!
It is time you knew the truth.
Greetings Kichiro. I have fortified the castle as instructed. Now, we wait.
What is wrong, my friend? You look stricken, but not from the field of battle.
Mototada, you have known the master since childhood. You are his friend. Tell me the truth.
Did the master find me wandering the ruins of my conquered village, as he says? Did he rescue me?
Yes, and no. You see, it was he who conquered, first your clan and then your family. He ordered your parents to death.
You have followed him because he is your master.
Then what does that make me?
The master has always seen in you a man with great promise. You must share his confidence.
Now come. I have a feeling that fortune will smile on us in the coming battle.
We have succeeded in occupying the enemy, but the battle is over. You must go, Kichiro.
I cannot. This is Tokugawa's fight, not mine.
Tokugawa has made you the man you are. It is up to you to decide whether that man is an orphan or a general.
Heed my words. I have chosen to make a stand within my castle and to die a quick death.
It would be easy to escape, and to run from death, but that is not the way of the warrior.
To sacrifice your life for your master is an unchanging principle. In that way it is truth.
You have been ready since the day I saved you. Of course, the boy I knew no longer exists. A man has taken his place.
And you have your honor. It is a good thing that I have your trust. Otherwise I might fear your growing thirst for power.
Yes, it is a good thing.
One day you will be a great leader Kichiro. But today you fight for Tokugawa.
Now do what you do best, and follow me.
It is done. The rebel daimyo have been destroyed and you are the only lord left standing. All of Japan lies at your feet.
You have proven yourself yet again. Tell me, Kichiro, what have you won on this field of battle?
I have won the truth, and it is all that matters.
A man who has been raised in the house of a master and yet places no loyalty in his heart will stain that family name for all generations.
A man's duty is to this "truth." Beyond this, there is nothing to be said.

Daimyo Tokugawa Ieyasu lives a life of cutthroat survival, following the motto: "Life means that I can live to see tomorrow." When he speaks, he does so with certainty, as if whatever he says has already come to pass. When he strikes, he does so first swiftly and without a hint of mercy.

Emperor Kangxi of the Qing Dynasty would rather use flattery than force to win over his enemies. His friendly, grandfatherly tone hides a master commander with a long career of military experience. Despite his insight into battlefield strategy, Kangxi tends to adopt a defensive posture, much to the impatience of his allies.

Akbar, Emperor of the Mughals, approaches warfare with a creative and enlightened mind. He resists the urge to let his emotions get the best of him, and as such is very patient and pragmatic. Akbar respects his enemies, yet will not let this prevent him from crushing them with a large and highly sophisticated army.
Harvest for Food with Fishing Boats.
{E^A large amphibian. Harvest for Food.^}{J^A large amphibian. Attracted to nearby Shrines. Enhances resources generated by Shrines.^}

We must hurry and build more trading posts. Without them, we are lost.
Move faster! Our men are wilting without the proper supplies. Open the road!
Ishida still holds the road. Drive a wedge into his positions and then crack them open.
The Tokaido Road is our only objective. We must establish a trade route, and quickly!
Hold on for a few moments longer! The enemy grows weak!
The western army has stolen back its position. Re-form ranks and prepare for a counterattack.
Defeat this guardian to collect its treasure.
That's it! We own the road once more. This time, we must hold it or die trying.
Catch your breath, men. The road belongs to Tokugawa. Your deeds will not be forgotten.
We must not waste any more time. Destroy those enemy barracks!
How dare the villagers of Owari fight back! Kill them, every man, woman, and child.
A Japanese villager that does not eat meat. Gathers all other resources.
Slow, infinite source of Food. Limited to 10 gatherers.
Passive Ability: A small chance to do extra damage when attacking.
Passive Ability: A small chance to disable and damage all nearby enemies.
Passive Ability: A small chance to turn defeated enemies into Disciples.

This morning, Daimyo Toyotomi Hideyoshi, the man who sought to unify our divided and weary country, passed away. Where there is now peace, war will blossom. The time has come for Japan to submit to a new master.

Many weep for Toyotomi, but they should save their tears. One man will still unite this country. My master, Tokugawa Ieyasu, most powerful of the daimyo, has sent me to Osaka Castle to seize the power that rightfully belongs to him. An empire dawns today.

As expected, the daimyo have fractured into two armies, those loyal to the peace, and those in the service of my lord, Tokugawa. As I write, eastern clans under Uesugi Kagekatsu drop their plows and take up swords against us. There are enemies at every turn.

The war rages endlessly on. Doubt and weariness consume me. The master has ordered me west to capture the Tokaido Road. Whichever army holds this vital supply line holds the advantage. I will obey, as always, but I cannot ignore the chill that grips my heart.

I have few words. Lies always litter a battlefield, but this, this lie cuts too deeply. With a heavy spirit, I lead my men to their dooms at Fushimi Castle. There, 30,000 enemies will fall upon them like the stones of an avalanche. As for me, I struggle under a different weight: the truth.

I watch the sun rise over the village of Sekigahara, and I wonder what morning will bring. Two paths now wait at my feet. One holds the truth of who I was. The other holds the truth of who I have become. The choice is mine alone, and the master waits.

Animals. These peasants should lick their fingers, for this will be their last taste of such riches.
Not all of us were born into royalty, Admiral. I was raised one of these "animals."
The treasure fleet is a testament to our emperor's genius.
You know as well as I do that the emperor is a pampered old fool.
He should be more careful with his belongings. Ships vanish. Treasures never reach their destinations.
Good thing we are here to prevent such tragedies.
Every time that boy opens his mouth, I want to fill it with my fist.
I am Lao Chen. A lifetime at sea has left me stinking of fish. If it floats, I have crewed it.
Then tell me, what do you predict for our grand treasure fleet?
The fleet will sail on to glory, without question. But beware the Admiral.
I am not the only one around here who stinks.
Captain, pirate vessels prowl the waters.
Say that again, when you're picking wreckage off the seabed.
The men are tired, Admiral. They cannot work with broken backs.
They will work until the task is finished, broken backs or not.
Can we not give some of this work to the new sailors you hired?
I know they are not sailors, Admiral. It is obvious that not one of them has ever set foot on a boat.
They are mercenaries, scoundrels, and should be boiled in their own juices.
Silence. It would be wise for you to remember who commands this fleet. If you...
This is your mess, Huang. Clean it up at once!
I have already had my fill of crowded ports and foreigners. I crave conquest. I crave glory.
Some men work their whole lives to see such sights, Admiral.
True. Commoners are easily impressed. That is what separates rabble like you from men like me.
Now step aside. Royalty expects to be greeted by their own.
Jinhai may be venomous but he is not capable of betrayal.
The Zamorin wishes you welcome, Admiral. All preparations have been made.
Gulls fill the sky, the sea goddess must watch over us.
I wish I shared your faith, Chen. We have sailed west for weeks with no sign of land.
One cannot sail too far without hitting something, Captain.
It is not the sea I fear. It is the Admiral. He appears to be connected to all our misfortunes.
The Indian raiders did speak of being paid to fight...by one of our crew.
Even now, he leads our fleet off the charts into the unknown.
The Admiral has always plotted his own course.
Yes, Chen, but where is he going?
Wherever he leads us, it appears we will brave a storm before our arrival.
Like the birds, it is an omen. But a bad one.
That is the last time I pray to the sea goddess.
It is pathetic. Even at the edge of the world, men still murder each other for power.
Speaking of pathetic, have you seen the Admiral?
Our commander has vanished. I fear he was captured with the others.
Not to worry. There will always be another admiral where he came from.
Perhaps it is as you said before, and Jinhai has taken his own path. If so, he is now at the mercy of the wilderness.
Can we leave this cursed rock, then?
No. Prepare a rescue party. The hostiles captured many of our companions, and we must find them before nightfall.
I think finding them will be easier than you expect.
Not deserted. The villagers are in hiding.
I never thought you would stoop to something as common as mutiny, Jinhai.
It is not mutiny when you are the Admiral.
You hoped to plunder the riches of the fleet in India. Only you were defeated by a lowly crew of peasants and sailors.
I will not make that mistake twice.
You may not be as cowardly as I predicted, but you are much more foolish. The emperor will hear of your treachery.
In this world, I am the emperor!
Set a course for home, Chen. We sail due east.
Finally! I have been finding sand in many unwanted places.
It is a pity that a man born of such extraordinary means had to die such an ordinary death.
Decisions make a man great, Captain. Not family, not wealth.
Then I am glad you have been there to guide me, Chen.
Give me no credit. I simply follow where the bottle leads me.
Have you done as I asked?
We have scoured the beaches for all evidence of our presence.
Good. It is time the treasure fleet moved on to calmer waters: home.
Hopefully, no one will even know we were here.
