Damages all units in the area and makes all hits critical for a short time.
This injustice must end! The British East India Company takes our treasure, displaces our rulers, and despoils our traditions.
Now it is public humiliation! I tell you, prophecy foretells the end of the Company after one century. That is now.
Be patient, you say? I have seen forty years, and not one of them free of the cursed Company.
Our only option is to work with the foreigners.
Spoken like a true coward. Like a little Englishman.
You know nothing of who I am.
Lieutenant Sahir, I have but one cardinal sin: impatience.
I am sorry, Colonel. The detainees were marched through town and stripped of their uniforms in public.
Such a fate is too good for the likes of them. Execution is the preferable method, one that makes a lasting impression.
Sir, the Company's disrespect of the people fuels an already dangerous fire.
Lieutenant, the British East India Company has ruled India for one hundred years.
I sincerely doubt that a few dyspeptic sepoy are going to change that.
If ever you need reminding of who rules this nation, simply look to the rooftops. Now, chin-up, Lieutenant.
There is a bit of sport in it, isn't there Nanib? I could be hunting fox back home in Norfolk.
If the rebels wish to disrupt our flow of saltpeter, it will take more than a few elephants to do it.
Do you see in these uprisings some common purpose?
They are not as scattered as you would believe. They will come together, and when they do, we will face an army.
Wisely spoken. You may make an effective captain, after all.
Sir! A trading post is under attack to the east.
Come, Lieutenant. Do not lose hope. Where there is tea, there is always hope.
A series of fires have broken out around Calcutta. We are directed there immediately.
How does the damned Company expect me to be everywhere at once?
Perhaps they ask too much of us all.
Bah. This is the rebels' doing. The need to stir up trouble flows in their blood.
The Company has no respect for the Indian people, Sir. That is, and always has been, the reason behind these attacks.
You forget yourself, Nanib. You are beginning to sound like one of the rebels.
If only that were something to regret, Sir.
Tread carefully, Nanib. You have been warned.
Surrender and we will spare your lives!
We will fight to the death. The British have no claim to this kingdom.
If you wish to die, then you had best find somewhere else do it. Put down your weapons. This is not how India will be won.
It will never be won while men like you wear the colors of our enemies.
Cooperation is the key to a modern India.
Cooperation is what has given this Company all of its power.
Leave this place. Leave before I forget compassion.
Well done, Lieutenant. You sent them to the slaughter. I couldn't have arranged it better myself.
The men refuse to use the new Enfield rifles, Colonel.
Then how do they expect to fight the enemy? Find out what all of the chatter is about, Lieutenant.
Colonel, there is pig fat in the rifle cartridges.
It is against the men's beliefs to eat pork in any form, so they cannot tear them open with their teeth.
I don't care what they believe. Tell them to do as I say or they will be executed.
You, Lieutenant, pick up that rifle. Show them how it's done.
Sir, it is also against my beliefs to place this cartridge in my mouth.
I am giving you an order, Lieutenant! Pick up that weapon!
Your first shot will be your last, Nanib. You have my word.
Look at how many have joined us, Nanib. We cannot fail. The war for independence has truly begun.
But we are an army without a leader.
You will be our general now, Nanib.
I never asked to be a general. I am a lieutenant in a nonexistent army, nothing more.
The cry for freedom is spreading. Bahadur Shah of the Mughal Empire has declared himself Supreme Ruler of India.
The Shah is a captive of the Company. How does he expect to lead us from deep within a prison cell?
It is simple. We will turn our rage on Delhi and free him.
If it is the will of the people, then I am at their command.
We have shown that we can defeat a regiment, but what of a whole army?
We will face that challenge when it is necessary to our goal.
And what exactly is our goal, Pravar?
We shall march on the British, and pry them from the landscape.
Perhaps, but our fight is not with the British. It is with the cursed Company.
Then we will engulf it in fire, and make them wish they'd never set foot in this country.
Yes, and I know exactly where we should start.
The Company has treated this country like property and the people like trespassers. But our liberation begins here.
Brave words, Nanib. Is this your army, a band of native thugs and villagers?
You are not firing on unarmed men this time, Colonel.
You, not I, will be leading these fools into a massacre.
No one will come. Not today. Today our fight is with you, Colonel.
We will not rest until you are dead at our feet.
You will never find me at the feet of a traitor, dead or alive.
I am impressed, Nanib. But you are simply ending one man. The Company is bigger than me.
It is bigger than you. It is bigger than this whole forsaken country.
I learned much from you, Colonel. But it is clear that you learned nothing from me.
Your Company may have the ability to set fire to a village, a home, but no company will ever set fire to a man's soul.
You cannot fight such passion. Not with money. Not with guns. Not with men.
Come, Nanib. The prophecy must be fulfilled. There are others like him to be defeated.
Yes. I am afraid there will always be others like him.

Ships a large number of Roger's Rangers (Rangers) and Falconets.
Ships a large number of Prussian Needle Gunners (Skirmishers) and Prussian Uhlans.
Ships a large number of Bashkir Ponies (Hussars) and Culverins.
Ships a large number of Gendarmes (Cuirassiers).
Ships a large number of Blue Guards (Musketeers) and Mortars.
Ships a large number of Garrochistas (Lancers) and Espadachins (Rodeleros).
Ships a large number of Legion Dragoons and Horse Artillery.
Ships a large number of Janissaries and Great Bombards.
Tokugawa's grand ambitions crumble around him. Allying with you was a grave mistake.
The battle may be over, but our relationship is not. Tokugawa will have your head for this.
An army is only as strong as its weakest ally, meaning you. This defeat is on your head.
Our victory was never in doubt. You should be thankful Tokugawa included you in his glory.
This battle is won. Now let us discuss how you can repay Tokugawa for his allegiance.
You must invest in the machinery of war. Bring siege weapons to the gates of our enemy.
Siege forces would help you sow seeds of  destruction.
Take my advice. The pounding of hooves would lift your spirits in battle.
We do not breed horses for their grace and posture, we breed them to trample our enemies.
You are playing games.Train more foot soldiers, overwhelm the enemy and cease this spectacle.
Train more foot soldiers and hurl them at the enemy. They mean nothing.
Mistakes like this are why you need Tokugawa. Your men march right into their graves.
With this attack, you show weakness and stupidity. Remove your men, or they will meet their deaths.
The heavens cloud with arrows and smoke. This day of battle will never be forgotten.
The future of Japan will be decided in this bloody mud. Stand your ground and fight!
I foresaw this victory, as I do all of them. Tokugawa does not know the meaning of defeat.
If Tokugawa marches, Tokugawa finds victory.
Tokugawa has lived to see another day. So is the law of survival.
The outcome was never in doubt. Tokugawa's vision always becomes the reality.
You seem confused at our victory. Did you not realize you had sided with Tokugawa?
Consider this victory further evidence of Tokugawa's superiority.
You may follow Tokugawa on the road to victory. But remember your place.
This battle should be easily won. So do not let your actions prove disastrous.
Have you ever slaughtered a pen of squawking chickens? The coming battle will be very similar.
Are you willing to make sacrifices to achieve victory? If not, it is you who will be the sacrifice.
So, you are good for something after all. Tokugawa never would have guessed.
Your warriors are useful as a distraction. Do not let them get in my way.
The enemy has friends. It is strange they do not side with Tokugawa.
This fight has leapt from Tokugawa's grasp. Other forces are at play.
Yes, but only because it is in Tokugawa's best interest.
It is unnecessary, but Tokugawa will do it.
Tokugawa thought of this long ago.
Tokugawa shall spare some of his finest artillery.
This artillery is Tokugawa's finest. Use it wisely.
Tokugawa's riders are so unrivaled, even one of your limited skills could not make them fail.
You will have riders if you so desire them.
Listen for hoof beats. Tokugawa has sent horses to you...against his better judgment.
Men are like blades of grass. Where one falls, another takes its place. You shall have your warriors.
If more warriors will lead you to victory, then so be it.
Yes. Perhaps your men will finally learn to fight from Tokugawa's warriors.
Let me offer this advice. Greedy hands often lose their fingers.
No. Tokugawa needs every log and every nugget.
Why do you think a treasure is guarded? Waste your own resources.
No. You are on your own.
I am sorry, but our allegiance only goes so far.
No, I do not think so.
Tokugawa will not be party to your mistakes.
Can you not build your own army? Tokugawa has no men to spare.
My warriors fight for one lord only: Tokugawa.
If you wish to fight a war, you must train your own warriors.
A great leader must forge his own destiny. Tokugawa cannot help you.
Only a fool would make such a request.
Tokugawa's men will not be sacrificed so carelessly.
Our forces are too few. Your weakness, as always, is your problem.
Is your army the concern of Tokugawa? I think not.
It seems we have misjudged our opponents. Or, perhaps I have chosen the wrong allies.
Your lack of judgment has cost us a victory. Perhaps you should review your strategy.
Tokugawa knows little about these Aztecs, only that they are not fit to stand before him.
Send the Aztecs back to their homeland. Perhaps there they will find an equally miserable opponent.
The British have always had dreams far greater than their abilities.
The British sustain a barbaric culture. Their demise was expected.
Did Tokugawa really just defeat the Dutch? It felt more like crushing insects.
Tokugawa never understood the Dutch's bravado. They bleed as easily as anyone else.
The Frenchmen are nothing but little boys. It is time for them to take a permanent nap.
The French army will fertilize these lands for many years to come... as corpses.
My theory has proven correct: German soldiers run like frightened children when faced with death.
What is that stench? Of course! It is the smell of a bloody German army.
The Haudenosaunee may lord of their homeland, but this is Tokugawa's domain.
The Haudenosaunee should not have come to this land. They will return home in pieces.
The Ottomans believed they could stand against the might of Tokugawa. They assumed incorrectly.
We have crushed the Ottomans underfoot. The dust of their bones clings to my armor.
If only the Portuguese had lived up to the promise of their fascinating weaponry.
The Portuguese have fallen before Tokugawa, as so many have before them.
Tokugawa has heard many stories of Russian might. It is a pity they were only stories.
The Russians anger easy but die easier.
In the end, all armies submit to Tokugawa. Even the Lakota.
The Spanish put up a pitiful fight. They will be nursing their wounds for generations.
Sleep well, Spanish. Perhaps next time they will steer clear of our shores.
I expected more from the Chinese. Yet, here stands Tokugawa, unchallenged.
The Chinese are like beasts. Several strikes with a heavy stick, and they run yelping for home.
Clearly, the Indians have neither the passion nor the power to march this battlefield.
The screams of the Indians will fill Tokugawa's ears for many nights.
These traitorous Japanese could not stand up to the will of the shogun. They will suffer an eternity's torment.
The traitorous Japanese have been tamed. They will not forget the teaching of their new master...Tokugawa.
The Aztecs show surprising power, but it matters little when they are bleeding to death.
The Aztecs fight like Japanese. But they are not Japanese, which is why they will die.
I fear the British warriors. Their western savagery suggests madness.
If the British might is to be believed, we may wish to reexamine our strategy.
I have never encountered a foe like these Dutch. A single shove will not knock them over.
Do not underestimate the Dutch. Their blank expressions hide a bloodthirsty brutality.
The French have a long history of warfare. Their experience is what guides them in this battle.
If any Europeans are to be feared, it is the French. They have an imperialist's eye.
These Germans will slog through blood and mud to destroy us. Kill first, fear later.
The German war machine should be respected.and then dismantled.
The Haudenosaunee bring a passionate fervor to their warfare. I admire it.
Tokugawa has respect for these Haudenosaunee. They fight as if moved by the spirits.
The Ottomans seem to survive on the blood of their enemies. They should be respected, and feared.
It is as I feared. In the heat of battle, the Ottomans will do almost anything to achieve a victory.
The might of the Portuguese rises like a blood red sun, casting a deathly shadow.
Tokugawa did not expect the Portuguese to have such a ravenous appetite for war.
With every step the Russians take, the earth shudders. They are more powerful than expected.
The ferocity of the Russians is unparalleled. It will take much to stop them.
Tokugawa watches the Lakota warriors with worry. They fight like men with nothing to lose.
The Spanish are well versed in the art of war. Do not dare take your eye off them.
Tokugawa detests the Spanish warlords. For once, an army is actually worthy of his attention.
The Chinese do not suffer defeat lightly. They laugh in the face of our samurai.
Chinese warriors fight like devils. They will always advance, even as their entrails fall behind them.
The Indians have a long history of triumph. We must proceed with caution.
These Indians possess such strange weapons and tactics. They are a surprisingly fierce opponent.
Tokugawa once called these traitorous Japanese his allies. They are men of great skill, and greater treachery.
Tokugawa is surprised at these traitorous Japanese. They are strong, and will fight for nothing short of a victory.
Do not turn our alliance into a competition. Remember. You serve Tokugawa.
Your advances will greatly aid my army. That is the reason you pursue them, is it not?
The enemy enlists the aid of natives. Beware. They hope to turn the whole region against us.
Natives flock to our enemy. They must sense a weakness in our alliance, meaning you.
Farmers will not win this war for Tokugawa. Advance quickly or you will perish.
Tokugawa's samurai will not fight alongside farmers. Why have you not advanced?
Cease hiding in your headquarters and join the battle at hand. The world advances without you.
Your ignorance is appalling. Tokugawa has chosen you as his ally. Advance!
Excellent. Your advanced civilization will greatly aid Tokugawa in his dominance.
Your people as not as backwards as they appear. This advancement is good news.
At last. You are even more ignorant than expected. Tokugawa is ashamed to have you as an ally.
Your civilization advances at last. Your feeble people must still eat their rice uncooked.
Many thanks for rescuing my monk. You have proven your usefulness to Tokugawa.
You have done well. It is bad luck to abandon a holy man.
Tokugawa has dismissed another threat. If only you were so effective.
Fools. Our enemies were fools to believe they had conquered the conqueror.
These native villages burn so brightly. It is beautiful.
One more native enemy has fallen by the wayside.
It is done. Tokugawa marches on, devastation and chaos in his wake.
It is over. A town that once housed the living, now houses the dead.
Sever the ties to wealth, sever the ties to power. A trading post burns before Tokugawa.
Follow Tokugawa's example, and tear the enemy's trade from this land.
The natives fight ferociously. They will regret this resistance.
It is ignorant not to accept the inevitable. Tokugawa will have that village yet.
Destiny has not chosen this time for victory. Next time, perhaps.
Tokugawa thought you were his ally. Where were your men during this disaster?
The enemy's trade route is well defended. Our priorities shift elsewhere.for now.
The enemy passionately defends its trade route. Now we know what he treasures most.
Tokugawa does not worship, but the death of a believer is always cause for reflection.
The death of a monk strikes a dual blow. We lose his blessing, as well as his treasure.
This is why beasts have no soul. They prey on the enlightened.
My poor monk must have angered that beast in a former life.
It grows clear that this battle is not in Tokugawa's interests. For it is not defeat when the fight is meaningless.
Even the strongest commander grows weary of wasting his time. Is this battle finished yet?
The blood of my clan is being spilled. Send your men before it is too late.
Hurry. Tokugawa's men should not die when yours would be a much better substitute.
The servants of Tokugawa scatter! Is this what an alliance means to you? Where are your men?
My fiercest samurai have fallen in this onslaught. Ally, I come to you for help.
Greetings. You must be the newest servant of Tokugawa.
Tokugawa expects great things from you. Do not disappoint him.
If you shut your mouth and open your ears, you may one day be as mighty as Tokugawa.
You choose a challenge. Tokugawa prefers an ally willing to face his fears.
Only with Tokugawa's help will you ever overcome this deadly challenge.
Tokugawa does not like an ally who sets his sights so low.
You choose the simple path. War should inspire a warrior to surpass his expectations, not forget them.
Yes, I remember you. I often dreamt of removing your head and placing it in on a platter.
Last we met, you resorted to deceit and trickery. Those are not the ways of the warrior.
It is good that fate has brought us together again. You proved your worth when last we drew swords together.
Your armies performed admirably during our last alliance. Tokugawa was almost impressed.
Tokugawa thought he had buried your severed head in his garden. Strange. It must have been someone else's.
Once again we face a common enemy. Try to keep up with Tokugawa this time.
Do you remember this place? Last we gazed upon it the sky was black with the smoke of a conquered enemy.
Let us hope this engagement fares better than our last.
Tokugawa expects great things from you, unlike last time.
It is rare for Tokugawa to respect another commander, but you have earned it.
Finally, Tokugawa has an ally in which to place some confidence. Even if it is only a little.
Ransom is fine, but Tokugawa prefers to make his deals on the battlefield.
Tokugawa has paid for his monk's freedom. This will not be a regular occurrence.
No amount of coin is worth more to me than a monk.
It is unjust to hold a holy man against his will. They must always be rescued.
Tokugawa has liberated a monk, both his body and his spirit.
Today, our warriors have shown their faith. They have rescued a monk in need.
String your bows, and sharpen your blades! The enemy has shown us an undefended target!
Only an inexperienced opponent would leave a headquarters undefended. It is time for an education.
Interesting. A town center without a barracks in sight. Like a fruit ripe for the plucking.
Even if the enemy wanted to muster their defenses, they have no barracks to do so. Fate sides with us.
The enemy town center lies alone, with no horses to ride to its aid.
Their headquarters lacks a stable to protect it. This is our time to strike.
Allow Tokugawa to bless you with a shower of gold.
I hope you use your coin more wisely than you use your warriors.
Tokugawa has such wealth that this donation goes without notice.
All good things come from your benevolent master, Tokugawa.
Your men look like skeletons. Take this food to nourish them.
You may have your wood...but do not forget this favor.
Wood is one resource Tokugawa can spare.
Come, Tokugawa's men march on the enemy headquarters. This is no time for indecision.
The time has come to strike. Prepare for battle. This is not a request. It is an order.
Innocent villagers make such easy targets. That is because they are unarmed.
The enemy's villagers do not expect an attack, which is exactly why one is coming.
Tokugawa will crush the enemy's villagers like leaves under his foot.
It is time to pounce, while the enemy's young struggle blindly in its den. Show no mercy.
The armies of Tokugawa march on the enemy capital. Would you like to join him in this butchery?
I begin my attack. The enemy does not expect such a blow, which is why it will be so enjoyable.
A blood wind blows. Tokugawa prepares to clean the country of these traitorous natives.
Natives who side with the enemy are certain to feel Tokugawa's wrath. We march!
After this assault, the enemy's trading post will be but a scar upon the land.
I am advancing on the enemy trade route. Keep an eye open for ambushes.
To battle! Together, our warriors will turn the tide against our enemies.
It was a difficult decision, but Tokugawa has decided to reinforce your army.
Tokugawa's armies march to you. As a united force, we will trample the enemy into dust.
This is a good place for a barracks. Tokugawa's engine of war will turn these skies gray.
This spot will be remembered. Today, a dynasty breaks new ground.
The wrath of Tokugawa shall radiate from this dusty patch of earth. We build!
A ruler must have a castle. Tokugawa will build his here.
With this town center, a dynasty dawns.
Such a beautiful sight. From here I will look out over my dynasty.
This native settlement will belong to Tokugawa. The will of its people begs to be broken.
A village lies in the path of Tokugawa's march. It will be removed.
All who do not bow down, will burn. These natives have made the right choice.
Tokugawa wishes to take a trade site. No one will stand in his way.
It is important to keep our trade flowing. Capturing this trading post will surely help.
A warrior does not leave his palaces undefended. Here, we fight.
The only way this building will be captured, is over the smoking bodies of its garrison.
You may turn and flee, but Tokugawa will never choose retreat.
Learn from my example. True warriors fight to the death to defend their positions.
This native settlement has become vital to our plans. It will be defended.
This settlement will be defended. Tokugawa does not abandon his allies. Unless, of course, they displease him.
People must know that their master watches over them. That is why this village will be defended.
Our men prepare their defenses. The enemy will swat this busy village and find it a beehive.
Pay attention! This trade site must be defended. Your assistance may be required.
Tokugawa would like to see the enemy tear this trade site from his grasp.
Tokugawa will supply coin for as long as you require it. Spend this wealth wisely.
The riches of Tokugawa are abundant. He will support your army, even when you cannot.
Your men will not starve with Tokugawa as a benefactor.
Do not disappoint Tokugawa. Wood will flow only as long as you deserve it.
The warriors of Tokugawa march to rescue their ally. And remember, favors are meant to be repaid.
Tokugawa has too much invested in you. His men rally to your defense.
Do not waver in the winds of your enemy. Tokugawa has sent his men to support you.
No one ignores Tokugawa! Address your allies or lose them!
How can allies plan when allies do not communicate? Open your mouth or Tokugawa will open your belly.
Tokugawa requires coin. Give it to him.
Tokugawa has granted you many favors. It is time to return this goodwill with coin.
Tokugawa's army requires food. You must accommodate or face the consequences.
You must spare some food. Tokugawa's men starve. They will eat anything.
Our villages lie stagnant. A donation of wood would enable their growth.
A gift of wood is needed to keep the fires of war burning.
Do you hear Tokugawa's sigh of relief? Your warriors' assistance is appreciated.
The clouds over this battle lift. Tokugawa expresses his thanks and gratitude.
Thank you. But Tokugawa always had control of the situation.
This coin is a welcome relief.
This gift will not be forgotten.
Your food saved Tokugawa's men from starvation.
The food was a blessing. Men cannot fight with hollow bellies.
Look around you. Our dead lie side by side. This defense will be forever celebrated.
This battle could not have been won without your friendship. Perhaps I underestimated you.
You have helped save Tokugawa's capital. Your warriors will always be heroes in these lands.
Tokugawa favors the loyal. He will not forget your generous donations.
This act proves your worthiness to Tokugawa.
Thank you. Wood is always welcome in a warrior's camp.
Thank you. Archers without wood are like wolves without teeth.
The Aztecs repel our forces. Who would have expected such resistance?
Inspire your warriors, or the Aztec assault will surely swallow us.
The British will claim victory if we do not adapt to their wiles. They are clever killers.
Where do the British find such men? For they fight like demons!
Tokugawa has never seen such a hunger for blood. The Dutch seem to feast on our dead.
We fall before the Dutch tide, like crops to the harvest.
How can this be? The French have their knives to Tokugawa's throat.
Every French arrow finds its target. This nation is stronger than anticipated.
Our blood coats the Germans' blades. We are being driven back at every turn.
Every German warrior is worth three of our men. They do not know the meaning of defeat.
In another life, Tokugawa would stand in awe of the Haudenosaunee. For now, he retreats.
The Haudenosaunee warriors sink their claws into the countryside. They are predators by nature.
The Ottoman armies pick their teeth with the bones of our dead.
Tokugawa fears few things. But he fears the Ottomans. They have given him good reason to.
The Portuguese kill our men by the hundreds. They are a force of nature.
This fight turns against us. Your strange fear of the Portuguese is costing us this war.
These Russians know no fear. They shrug off every one of our blows.
The Russian tide flattens our men. Their thirst for blood is unmatched.
Tokugawa does not know how to stop the Spanish attack. They could march through hell unscathed.
The Spanish are surprisingly skilled in combat. Our men must do more to resist them.
The Chinese turn the knife in Tokugawa's side. Their lack of mercy is their strength.
We are buried under the Chinese avalanche. If we do not act fast, we will suffocate.
The Indians fight like Japanese, which is why Tokugawa finds them so difficult to defeat.
Tokugawa will never kneel to the Indians, not even with a sword at his neck.
We falter in the face of the traitorous Japanese. This day must not end in defeat.
The traitorous Japanese win many victories. But defeat only strengthens Tokugawa's resolve.
Our men may die, but the Aztecs cannot continue at this pace. We must stay alive a little longer.
The British know how to fight, but with every push, they gasp and weaken.
There is a light behind this darkness. In forcing the offensive, the Dutch leave themselves vulnerable.
We are losing, but there is still hope. For every warrior the French slay, we kill two of theirs.
The Germans win, but they also weaken. All is not lost. We must remain strong against this threat.
Hope springs as our blood spills. The Haudenosaunee have wasted their manpower.
Defeat lingers in the shadows, but Tokugawa will never stop fighting. The Ottomans grow weary.
The Portuguese rush over us, but quickly tire. Strike now, while they are out of breath.
The Russians bruise us, but they are too weak for the kill. We will counterattack and finish them.
Our men fall before the Spanish charge. Outlasting them is our only hope of survival.
The Chinese have shown their strength; but even the strongest must rest. Our time for vengeance grows near.
If we must die, then we will do so fighting. The Indians will fall around us in a flurry of blood and metal.
The traitorous Japanese spill our blood, but we spill theirs as well. Soon they will run dry.
Tokugawa's strength has vanished, but yours remains. Lend him aid, or face his fate.
Know this. If Tokugawa falls, he will take you with him. Allies should combine their power, not hoard it.
Do not worry. As long as Tokugawa can raise his sword, the outcome remains a mystery.
The enemy does great damage, but only to the weak. Tokugawa feels nothing.
We tower over our enemies, triumphant.
Our enemies do not stand a chance against the fury of our alliance.
We may dominate, but Tokugawa's weakness shows who has been making the sacrifices in this war.
Even as this battle rages, you turn your lustful eyes to Tokugawa's dynasty. Power like yours is fleeting, my ally.
Our success on the battlefield is a result of Tokugawa's prowess, nothing more.
This battle is evidence of Tokugawa's supreme rule. Everyone, including you, will one day submit.
Tokugawa fears for this alliance. Our soldiers' numbers dwindle, their courage wanes.
You must improve your strategy. Our alliance nears the point of no return.
Tokugawa's might wavers. How has it come to this?
Something must be done. These defeats go beyond humiliation.
This may be the end of the Tokugawa dynasty. If so, the world will mourn.
Under a dark cloud of death, a dynasty fades. Even Tokugawa cannot resist this dark destiny.
Our enemy seeks to claim every inch of this land. We must destroy those chokepoints.
They hope to stall our victory with tricks. This threat must be terminated quickly.
Our enemy poisons the natives with promises of power. They will pay for this betrayal.
The enemy hopes to win the land by winning the people. This cannot happen.
The enemy's men scurry across the map like mice. They must not claim more territory.
Tokugawa is shocked by the audacity of his enemies. You must do something.
We must work faster. Our enemy befriends the natives at a surprising pace.
Every time the enemy seizes a village, we become villains in the eyes of its people.
The enemy grows roots all across the land. Act now, ally, or you will regret it.
A warrior does not nap as the enemy marches over him. Open your eyes, fool, and fight!
You toy with natives? They have little to offer but superstitions.
You have formed a bond with natives. Tokugawa is pleased. He enjoys exploitation.
An eye for trade is wise. Building an army requires the right resources.
You have brought more lands under the banner of Tokugawa. Every inch counts.
Well done. Such swiftness is an asset.
Is your haste meant to intimidate Tokugawa? Be careful not to offend.
Each contribution to the effort is appreciated.
Your strategy does not go unrecognized. This land holds many treasures.
Good fortune finds you. Now yield some of it to Tokugawa.
You find one more treasure...for the chests of Tokugawa.
You find food. Excellent. The stronger the servant, the stronger the master.
This is good. Now Tokugawa knows where to go when his men beg for bread.
Focus your efforts on the fight, not on your coffers. Treasure hunting is for fools.
Tokugawa does not participate in childish races for treasure.
A man does not pick his ally's pocket. If you value your hand, you will keep it on your own property.
Be careful where you search for treasure. Allies can easily become enemies.
You bring more warriors to the fold. Remind them who is the true master of this army...Tokugawa.
These men are not samurai, but they will make nice fodder. Push them to the front.
Villagers are like cattle. Every beast should be put to use.
Villagers are good, but warriors are better.
Leave some wood for Tokugawa. Are we not allies?
You do plan to share that wood with Tokugawa, correct?
Natives are useful. They have a great talent for stopping the arrows of the enemy.
Wise move. Natives are the best resource of all. Obedient and easily replaced.
Thanks to your rapid advance, we command the map's trade route. Well done.
It is wise to pursue trade sites. Tokugawa's doubts about you begin to fade.very slowly.
Tokugawa will not take your walls personally. As long as his men still have access to your domain.
Tokugawa sees your construction. But walls will not protect you from your own stupidity and lack of leadership.
A native province yields to Tokugawa.
These natives will act as our guides in this unknown land.
This trade site appears deserted. Tokugawa shall claim it as his own.
This is a helpful find. Every log, every coin, every loaf, is appreciated.
Our storehouses overflow with an abundance of treasures.
Every coin we gather is a coin stolen from our enemy.
With so many riches, Tokugawa hardly notices the new additions.
The fire to kill requires fuel. This food will do nicely.
Were you planning to gather those riches? Next time you should move more quickly.
Tokugawa will take this small treasure away from you, for safe keeping.
Tokugawa knows that this is not a contest, but still, his riches put yours to shame.
Not only are your men weak, but they are also poor. Gather more treasures.
I have found more warriors. There is no greater treasure than men willing to die for their master.
These native warriors may be wild, but they are warriors nonetheless.
Villagers are always welcome. There is always work to be done.
Villagers are good for many things, all of them for the glory of Tokugawa.
Every log gathered is another hail of arrows.
Tokugawa does not take any blessing of wood for granted.
Despite their bizarre rituals, every native on our side is an ally.
Each trade site brings us closer to total dominance.
We have snatched another trade site. Our eyes remain trained on victory.
I shall build a wall to keep out the unwanted, like my enemies.and you.
My walls are meant to keep out the enemy. So stay in my favor, or else.
This victory has come about too easily, even for a righteous, wise, and all-powerful ruler like Tokugawa.
The advantage is ours. Now we wait for our enemy to panic. Tokugawa enjoys when enemies panic.
How could you possibly have become a worse ally than the last time we fought? It is pathetic.
Not every warrior benefits from experience. It is obvious that some, like you, are cursed to fail.
Tokugawa wonders how many heads had to roll to bring you such status.
Many must have fallen at your feet. Tokugawa respects those who step to greatness on the backs of others.
You have changed. A commander now stands before Tokugawa, when before there was only a whelp.
You have been scarred by your experiences, but emerged stronger from them.
Tokugawa will live on in the hearts of his people. There, you will never claim victory.
This war is far from over. Every night the sun sets, only to rise again in the morning.
Do not let sorrow overtake you. Your defeat is good news, for only death can cure a fool.
Tell me. How does it feel to teeter on the brink of despair?
The bloodier a battle, the better. There is no glory but that which is won in the mud.
This battle should delight you. You will be remembered as a hero. A dead hero, but a hero nonetheless.
Do not celebrate yet. Tokugawa has many more swords with which to slay you.
Strange. You have won a battle. Never did Tokugawa consider such a possibility.
One victory in many battles is like a drop of water in an endless ocean.
This was the obvious outcome. It is a pity you had to waste so many men.
Each step brings Tokugawa closer to his destiny.
Another easy battle. Tell me, what do you hope to accomplish by dying?
Bow to Tokugawa now, and you may be spared.
Do you not see the twilight of your empire? Strange. Tokugawa sees it quite clearly.
Like trained beasts, the allies of Tokugawa arrive on command.
You see, only the strong side with Tokugawa. So it is only natural that you and he are enemies.
There is no honor when two armies descend upon one. It is the strategy of a feeble mind.
With this, your ally assures his death. I will save space by using one grave for both of your bodies.
Knowledge and progress mean nothing if a leader lacks the strength to use them.
Your advanced culture is impressive. But poetry and irrigation will not help you on the field of battle.
You have advanced quickly! Nothing of value ever comes from rushing. That is why I will take my time when killing you.
It will take more than a tribe of listless natives to challenge Tokugawa.
Those natives must see you as a worthy leader. They see Tokugawa as a god.
Such a soft blow. Surely you can do better.
Lucky for Tokugawa, those natives were expendable. However, it is quite unlucky for them.
You may have cut off the head, but the heart of my dynasty remains.
The smoke of this defeat will not cloud Tokugawa's view of victory.
Take it! Stealing one trade site is like spearing one fish in a rushing river.
If you seek to annoy Tokugawa then you have succeeded. You will pay for this treachery.
It would be wise to advance your civilization. Its crawl is becoming somewhat pathetic.
Loggers and miners will not an army make. Advance before Tokugawa grows bored with you.
Your civilization advances slowly. You are well on your way to becoming a footnote in history.
How can you rule such a stunted civilization? Tokugawa is surprised your people are not walking into walls.
Your civilization betrays your priorities. To win a war you must focus on fighting, not advancing.
If you believe that advancements will bring you victory, you are mistaken.
Is is about time. We have all been waiting for you to join the civilized world.
You are still advancing? Tokugawa assumed your primitive people had risen up and eaten you alive.
Your ally is too far away to come to your aid. He can only watch the smoke as you burn.
Tokugawa will drive a wedge between you and your allies. There is plenty of room for it.
Never place your settlements too close together. You line them up for execution.
Tokugawa appreciates that you have placed all of his targets in one convenient location.
Remember, fool. Tokugawa is no village daimyo. He wields the power of the shogun.
Once again, Tokugawa has seized the reins of fate. You cannot win.
Let that be a lesson to you. Do not search for native allies in Tokugawa's lands.
A fitting end to a worthless excuse for a village.
Tokugawa has removed your eye sore from the beautiful horizon.
Tokugawa has razed so many of your buildings that he has lost track.
Remember the sting of this loss. There will be many more like it.
Was that your trade site? Tokugawa torched it  just for his own amusement.
Greetings. Do you realize that no one has ever defeated Tokugawa? Or had you not heard?
You must be Tokugawa's opponent. Strange. I expected someone with a spark of intelligence.
The mark of a true warrior is whether he can rise to a challenge. Can you?
You appear more confident in your abilities. But Tokugawa knows you, and such confidence is premature.
A wise warrior learns from his past mistakes. Strange. Tokugawa never expected to think of you as wise.
Is Tokugawa mistaken, or did you believe yourself more capable the last time we met?
We both know these lands well, but it remains to be seen how you plan to use this knowledge.
Tokugawa sees no future for you. His katana will be swift, and its judgment final.
You should fear this confrontation. It will be painful for you. That is a fact.
Your heart should hang heavy with shame. Violence toward a monk is dishonorable.
Your scouting party walks through my lands. Is there any reason I should not slay them?
Tokugawa hopes this rabble is not your army. Their weakness does you no favors.
Your children appear to be lost. Tokugawa shows no mercy, not even to children.
Wonderful! These moving targets will provide excellent practice for Tokugawa's archers.
Insects should know better than to pester the powerful, lest they be squashed.
Tokugawa lets you think that your scout goes unnoticed. Think again.
Call back your army. Every man, woman, and child in my dynasty will fight to the death for their master.
Only cowards prey on the innocent. You shall pay for your heartlessness.
The larger the army, the longer the road paved with your dead.
Do your warriors know that they march into the jaws of death? No? Then Tokugawa will deliver the message.
Did a litter of mangy runts wander off, or is that a group of your warriors?
Come closer. You are mere moments from entering Tokugawa's trap.
So you have offered sacrifices to Tokugawa. He will be sure to return their heads to you.
Strangers walk our streets! You will pay for this brash action, with your life.
Scavengers nibble at Tokugawa's realm. That is the only warning you will receive.
Your warriors are lost. A general earns no honor in sending his men to meaningless deaths.
Tokugawa has glimpsed your town center. This battle is as good as over.
Your village is exposed to Tokugawa. One precise blow will end you.
A predictable outcome. You should feel lucky to be alive.
The righteous victor has emerged. Perhaps next time you will fare better.
I hope you have not forgotten about Tokugawa. Prepare to be reminded.
A shadow rolls across the horizon. A storm prepares to break. Tokugawa is coming...
I detest silence. Would you mind howling with pain? Think of it as practice for what is to come.
Do not allow the stillness to lull you. Much is happening, you are simply not aware of it.
Since you seem to have a free moment, would you mind choosing how you would like to die: suicide or beheading?
To your eyes, it appears that Tokugawa has fallen on defeat. But appearances can be deceiving.
The battle worsens for Tokugawa. Care to become his ally? Name your price. Think about the future.
This tactic was not part of Tokugawa's greater strategy. Your victory changes nothing.
I hope these natives you seek are worth the trouble. Notice how Tokugawa shows them little interest.
Your trade influence spreads quickly. But speed is a disadvantage when it moves you closer to doom.
Your haste betrays your inexperience. Tokugawa values one prize only: your head.
Tokugawa cares not for such treasures. They are of no help when a sword splits your skull.
You snatch up treasures like a greedy child. You leave me no choice but to discipline you.
Coin may be beautiful, but it will not keep your head from rolling free of your bloody shoulders.
As you fill your face with food, Tokugawa keeps his eye focused on your annihilation.
When Tokugawa finds you, all of that food will spill from your opened belly.
Remember. The fatter you grow with treasure, the more difficult it will be to flee the onslaught.
Did Tokugawa hear something? It sounds like a fly buzzing outside his walls.
If you plan to steal from Tokugawa, the least you can do is cut off your fingers. It will save him the trouble.
Thank you for recruiting natives. They are easier to crush under Tokugawa's feet.
Every man who joins you is one more corpse to decorate the battlefield.
What good are villagers? Can they swing katanas? Can they ride horses?
Wood burns, you fool. I would suggest you stay away from things that go up in smoke.
So, you have chosen to wall your headquarters. Tokugawa knows when he is not wanted.
Do not waste your time. No wall will dam the coming flood.
Tokugawa's influence expands across the countryside. The people crave a master.
Tokugawa will unite the scattered peoples of this land against you.
Tokugawa did not become shogun by ignoring the importance of trade.
This trade site is the foundation on which Tokugawa will build a thriving economy.
Do you see the wealth that awaits you? Now, come and get it. Tokugawa will be waiting.
The treasures of the wilderness are Tokugawa's for the taking.
Rulers deserve treasures. Servants deserve scraps.
The glitter of coin will always bring Tokugawa great pleasure.
Tokugawa will take this food so you do not have to. Your warriors are looking a little soft around the edges.
Tokugawa consumes your crumbs, but grows hungry for the meal.
Tokugawa's servants are weary from loading so many treasures. Strange. Your men look surprisingly fit.
Warriors continue to fall in behind Tokugawa's banner. Can you feel the thunder of their march?
A new villager is a sign that a dynasty is growing. A pity it is not your dynasty.
A wise commander knows better than to waste the gifts of nature.
You have captured a native settlement. Remember, haste does not make a man powerful. It only makes him sloppy.
There are numerous trade sites to be had. One in many is but a snowflake in a storm.
Tokugawa does not pay attention to time. His power is eternal.
The countdown has started. Your remaining heartbeats are linked to the ticking of a clock.
It appears you have suffered many defeats since our last meeting. What is one more?
You have improved your reputation. It is surprising, considering you are such a clumsy commander.
Your status impresses me. But all men, distinguished or not, bow before death.
Additional experience means little when you have the strength of a child.
It is agony to lift a sword, and Tokugawa's generals fall dead around him. A dynasty crumbles.
This victory is especially sweet. I have learned an ally's weaknesses, which I may choose to exploit in the future. Thank you.

Our demise is at hand. Fear not, we will rise to fight another day.
The enemy beats at our gates. Our empire is seconds from crumbling.
Perhaps I have seen one battle too many. Our alliance is doomed, just as we are.
This agreement has proven a good one. Where shall we set our ambitions next?
I am counting the seconds to victory. There are so few it hardly seems worth the trouble.
Swords and arrows break against stone. You need a bigger weapon, one that topples walls.
Your polite tapping will not open the enemy's door. Use artillery to break it down.
Two legs are fast, but four legs are faster. Send riders to lead your army.
Do not saddle your men with defeat. Saddle your horses, and send them into battle.
It may sound heartless, but more foot soldiers will take the brunt of the enemy blow.
Infantry units are always a good addition to any army.
Years of experience have taught me to predict a battle's outcome. Here is yours: Defeat. Retreat now.
I would hate to lose your excellent counsel. Please cease your attack. This fight will win you only regret.
Do you feel it? The earth shakes with the thunder of our combined armies.
Only through cooperation can so many warriors march together. Together we are like gods.
As expected, this fight has fallen into my hands. We should give thanks.
With our steady alliance, such a victory was never in question.
You have inspired me. Do you see the result, an enemy flung ragged across the landscape?
War does not allow for much celebration, but this battle was hard won.
An old man lives to see another day.
Let us appreciate this victory. Next time we may not find such good fortune.
Dawn breaks beautifully across the horizon. This is a day of victory. I can feel it.
With your courage and my wisdom, this war will feel like a holiday.
I pity our enemies. By taking up arms against us they have sealed their fate.
I can see the outcome of this battle already: green fields, peace, victory.
Your men step forward to take the blades meant for mine. Such acts are not forgotten.
Your arrival is like the rising of the sun. Today, you have won my everlasting friendship.
There is nothing we can do but fight our fiercest and hope for mercy.
We may fall today, but there will be other days when the enemy is not so many.
The proper arrangements will be made.
I humbly accept your request, and will see it done.
Excellent. Your wisdom far surpasses your years.
Siege units are my specialty. Consider it done.
Is artillery all you require? My forges are always burning for an ally.
There are horses to spare. I will send riders shortly.
For another, such a request would be an inconvenience. But for you, it is nothing.
It shall be done. Your march will be backed by the thunder of horses.
My warriors are the finest in the world. They will bring you good fortune.
Of course. I will send warriors as soon as I am able.
I trust none but you with my soldiers. They are coming.
Our stores have been depleted. There is nothing for my army, or any other.
The war has taken its toll on my resources. There are none to spare.
If I could gift you with a single coin, or a loaf of bread, I would. But sadly I cannot.
Believe me, it is best if we do not.
No. You may be wise, but you are also inexperienced.
That goes against my better judgment.
My empire has no men to send. You will need to rely on your own people this time.
Your timing could not be worse. Every man in my army is busy at work.
I would satisfy your needs if I could, but now is not the time.
This is not my decision to make. Or yours.
I am not permitted. It would bring me dishonor.
This is not the time for such requests. There are other, more pressing matters.
We have none left but boys and grandfathers. You will need to find warriors elsewhere.
Many of my warriors lie dead. I cannot help you now.
You will need to rely on your own men, not mine, to weather this brutal storm.
The enemy adapts to our every move. We will need to be more creative in our approach.
This is a cold and calculating blow, but we will not allow it to cool our rage.
I have great respect for the Aztecs. They fought admirably.
It is a shame that opponents as fierce as these Aztecs must meet such an end.
The British empire has not lived up to its stalwart reputation. It flounders at my feet.
The British limp towards the rear. I had expected more from them.
The Dutch have given us good practice, but we require more resilient foes.
With every blow, a Dutchman falls. These men are weeds, not warriors.
I had hoped for a greater challenge from these Frenchmen, but it was simply not to be.
Once we claim victory, there will be many French dead to bury. The land is littered with them.
The Germans taunted themselves hoarse, only to roll over and die too easily.
I will always find the Germans a worthy enemy. Just not a victorious one.
All I know of these Haudenosaunee is what today's victory has taught me. They are weaklings.
This strange Haudenosaunee nation has no place on the same battlefield as the Son of Heaven.
I have faced few opponents as passionate as the Ottomans. However, passion alone does not win wars.
The Ottomans mounted a ferocious, yet ultimately pointless, campaign.
The end of the Portuguese grows near. Let us save our strength for the next battle.
The decaying sons of Portugal will fertilize these lands for years to come.
I am pleased to see these Russian soldiers fail. They have no honor, no humanity.
It may have left our men bloodied, but the Russian onslaught is over.
No other army has tested me like the Lakota. Today, the world loses a fierce race.
The Spanish are all but defeated. We have earned our rest this day.
We have done a good thing in crushing the Spanish. If left alive, they may have conquered the world.
The traitorous Chinese met us at every turn, swords drawn, teeth bared. This was not an easy victory.
A primal rage runs in the blood of these traitorous Chinese. They would have made a valuable ally.
It was foolish of the Japanese to take up arms against us. Just one of their many mistakes.
We must thank the spirits for this triumph. The Japanese nearly had our heads on a spear.
It is fortunate this battle is over. One more mistake and the Indians would have been the victors.
The Indians fought a clever campaign, but they were no match for your superior strategy.
No matter how hard we push, these Aztecs seem able to push back. Should I worry?
These Aztecs have shown their worth. Even the Son of Heaven looks down on them with awe.
It is no accident that the British rule a vast empire. Their reach seems to know no bounds.
British soldiers fall all around us. Yet every time I look, there seem to be more of them.
It is clear that the crazed Dutch have honed their skills in many bloody battles.
I have survived impossible odds, only to see death in the eyes of the Dutch.
The French are very strong. I find it hard to believe that they are Europeans.
Whoever leads the French armies instills in them a fiery passion.
The German soldiers slay our men with ease. We must fight as they do, without mercy.
Must I rise every morning to find the Germans marching across the horizon?
The Haudenosaunee may finally do the impossible, and pull the Son of Heaven back to Earth.
Every Haudenosaunee blade finds its target. Such warriors I have never seen.
The Ottomans continue to advance, even in the face of our deadliest warriors. These are men with no fear of death.
Even our combined strength seems too weak to combat this Ottoman threat.
The Portuguese warriors have no claim to humanity. They are beasts, and fight like it.
Much to my surprise, the Portuguese are resisting their extermination.
I see a grim flash in the Russians' eyes. They will not stop at nothing to kill us.
I was foolish to think the Russians could be flattered into defeat. They will not back down.
The Lakota sweep through the mountains like a terrible storm. We must seek safe cover.
I will never again fight the Spanish. They are too powerful.
With every battle, my admiration for the Spanish grows. They have a gift for warfare.
These Chinese fight like murderers, which I should have expected from such traitors.
I should have known not to underestimate these traitorous Chinese. We may die at the hands of our own.
The days grow colder as the Japanese samurai butcher our men like cattle.
Japanese close in on all sides. I doubt they will listen to compromise.
The Indians march across the countryside, leaving a bloody wake behind them.
Entering this war, I believed the Indians to be an inferior race. I made a great mistake.
Congratulations on your many wondrous accomplishments.
Such advancements are not surprising. Your civilization is ahead of its time.
We should watch our enemy carefully, or he will conquer this land one village at a time.
We have failed the natives of this land. They deserve the protection of their emperor.
This lack of momentum is unlike you. Please, for my sake, advance your civilization.
We are at war, and must always strive for knowledge. Advance. Quickly!
Follow my example, and revitalize your civilization. The time for change has come.
You are a wise and clever leader. Now prove it, and lead your people into a new age.
Your advancements benefit us both, my friend. I stand in awe of your accomplishments.
Children will be told stories of the glory of your kingdom. You advance quickly.
At last. I was worried I would need to drag your civilization behind me for the rest of the war.
I cannot weather this storm alone. Please try to keep pace with my advancements.
It means much to me that you honor my monks enough to save them.
Protecting a holy man is the sign of a great commander. Thank you.
Our watchful eye misses nothing. Every time the enemy moves, it is with our say so.
Our enemies are foolish to believe they will find such a simple victory.
The smoke from this village will be a warning that we should not be crossed.
It is a pity, but those villagers should have known better than to live on a battlefield.
We take one more step towards a resounding victory.
The ghosts of the departed shall haunt this place for all time. We had no choice.
If we cannot strike the enemy's heart, we will have to settle for his greedy hand.
Trade is dear to our enemies, and anything dear to them is a target to us.
My armies require more training. They have been repelled by savages.
The natives have fallen for the lies of our enemy. They resist us.
I am ashamed to admit that the enemy's settlement remains. It is a harsh reminder my of weaknesses.
Our invasion was a crushing failure. We will regroup and try again.
This trading post bristles with defenses.
The traders defend their precious money with their lives. They will die before relenting.
The gods abandon me. My monk is dead and can no longer commune with the spirits.
Without a monk, our flow of riches will dry up. This is a dark day.
No man deserves such a horrible death. We will give him a holy burial.
It is right that one so in tune with nature shall be consumed by it.
A withered heart beats beneath these bones. Old men have no place on the battlefield.
You are quite capable. Perhaps it is time you continued on without me.
Send your men to my aid. This war spreads like fire across the land.
My men battle to their last breaths. Will you stand by and let this happen?
The sun will set on my empire unless you reach it in time.
Like flies on a corpse, the enemy buzzes over me. I need reinforcements... and quickly.
Greetings. I have heard much about your skills in battle and mercy towards your people.
You must be the one that the spirits foretold. I am honored to make your acquaintance.
I have no doubt our alliance will throw its shadow across the land.
Do not grow too confident. This challenge will be unlike those you have faced before.
Your skills are great, but this conflict will be greater. It is a war for the ages.
Our last meeting must have dealt your confidence a fatal blow. This will be an easy battle.
You choose the easy path. Glory on the battlefield is won through facing a challenge, not running from it.
We never should have fought as enemies. I always found your leadership exceptional.
Last time we met, you mastered me. Now we stand together as equals.
We have proved a deadly team in the past. This time, however, it is I who will lead our alliance.
I will follow in your footsteps. Last time we fought together, you were clearly the force to be feared.
I extend the hand of friendship to you. Please do not hold an old grudge against a new ally.
Last time, good fortune smiled upon me, but I believe that you will dominate this campaign.
We have a great advantage in this campaign, for every rock and every tree is familiar.
We could have never predicted our last defeat. Let us leave it in the past, and think of the future.
I promise you, our last adventure taught me much. An old dog can in fact learn new tricks.
Our last battle plan proved very successful. I hope we can duplicate the results.
In turbulent times such as these, a solid alliance is invaluable.
Monks are men of great power. They are worth any price.
I have paid a steep ransom for this man, but I believe he will repay his debt with action.
This monk has given his life for our cause. The least we can do is give some coin for his.
I have rescued a monk from the hands of our enemies. They will pay for their cruelty.
My monk will never be the same man he was, but he lives to see another day.
It is a joyous day when one of our own is brought home safely.
A general must always lead with caution, but such an opportunity is a rare thing.
Put your warriors on alert. The enemy does not know what awaits them.
Do you see it? An enemy town lies undefended, like a tiger with its teeth pulled out.
There is no soldier in sight. We must attack.
This town will react slowly without riders to protect it. Our cavalry will trample them into the dirt.
A town without a stable is a town without hope. We should take advantage.
I am always willing to share my wealth with a friend.
How you spend this coin is none of my concern. I ask no questions.
Take this. There is always more coin here if you need it.
My men will halve their rations so yours may eat.
We fight for the same cause. Therefore we should share the same bread.
Take this gift of wood. I am sure you would do the same for me.
How can my ally build without the proper resources? Please, take this wood.
It is time to march on the enemy settlement.
I wish to end this war before it can grow bloodier. Watch over me as I journey into battle.
To kill a weed, you must remove its roots. To kill a ruler, you must remove his villagers.
A master's greatest assets are his servants. Without villagers, our enemy will flounder.
Every fallen villager weakens our enemy.
All of the conditions are right for a massive assault. The Son of Heaven has his eye on the enemy stronghold.
I march towards what I hope will be the final battle. If I do not return, remember me fondly.
Our attack has begun. The enemy will rest peaceful this night. They will sleep the sleep of the dead.
The natives do not know they are pawns. We will have to win them to our side by force.
Every village we claim is one fewer rock for the enemy to hide under.
My men move to snatch a trading post from the enemy's grasp.
Before this day is over, a trading post will burn to the ground.
You no longer need to peer over your shoulder, my warriors make haste to your position.
Hold your ground for a few moments more. The Son of Heaven closes the distance between us.
This spot looks fertile for a growing army.
Many a warrior will find his purpose here, where I break this ground.
With this building, I claim this land for the Son of Heaven.
This shall be the beating heart of a new Chinese empire.
On this piece of dirt, an empire is born. You will always be welcome here, ally.
It is a pity we must wage war. This town center seems to sit in paradise itself.
Every village that does not submit to me could submit to my enemy. I must prevent this.
This native village will wake to find itself subject to a new ruler.
Claiming this village will bring us one step closer to victory.
This trade site belongs to the Son of Heaven.
The sooner we establish trade dominance, the harder it will be for our enemy to resist our influence.
My men will not be forced from this building. They will come out only as corpses.
I will not abandon my people. We will defend this building at all costs.
This piece of land is dear to us. If my men fall here, it will be their last act.
Stay alert. My warriors will defend this patch of land, but may need your aid.
It is right for a ruler to defend those in his domain. I will defend this village to the death.
You will not win the respect of your subjects with weakness. This village must be defended.
It may be unwise, but I will not give up this town. An emperor rules by example.
Subjects of the Qing Dynasty will fight back against any invader.
This trade site will be defended, against all odds.
We have fought bravely for this trade site. It will not fall easily into the hands of our enemy.
A steady trickle of wealth is yours for the spending.
Whenever you have the need for coin, I will satisfy it.
As an emperor, I am a provider. Your people will never want for food.
I have no shortage of wood in my empire. Take what you need, and save the rest for later.
I have never abandoned an ally. My men rush to your aid, I only hope they reach you in time.
I feel every one of your wounds. I am coming. Hold on for as long as you can.
The enemy will see an example of true solidarity. I have sent warriors to join you.
Is there anything I can do for you as we prepare for our next attack?
I would like once again to express my gratitude for your friendship. It has served my people quite well.
As one ruler to another, could I ask for a loan of coin?
It pains me to ask, but can you spare some coin for a fading emperor?
It has been a lean time in my empire. My people look to you for nourishment.
My friend, a small gift of wood is needed. Can you oblige?
Could an ally spare several logs from his fire? My villages need wood.
I will never forget this heroic act. Your men will go down as legends in my empire.
So it is true. Together, we can overcome any obstacle.
You have once again earned my trust. Thank you for joining me.
My advisors were beginning to worry. The coin is appreciated.
Even an emperor can use additional coin. Many thanks.
I have never been unable to provide for my people. This food helps.
We are at war. Starvation should not be claiming our people. Thank you.
You are more than an ally, you are a friend. Your act has saved my people.
This is a moment when I have few words. Thank you. I thought my empire was surely doomed.
Your warriors will always have a home in this town they have defended.
I realize how much these resources mean to you. They will not be wasted.
Thank you. These come just in time.
Your donation of wood could not have come at a better time.
An old man often forgets the essentials. Thank you for the wood.
The Aztecs tighten their grip on our throats. Soon we will be unable to breathe.
Our armies stumble in their efforts, weakened by the superior Aztec enemy.
The British have beaten our men bloody. Is there any way for us to recover?
I knew the British were strong, but not this strong.
Losing to the Dutch would be a disaster, yet I cannot find their weakness.
This old man cannot stomach one more defeat, whether its the Dutch or anyone else.
Our weak defense betrays us. Even if we survive, the French will be as strong as ever.
The French do not even notice our resistance, as if we were insects to be ignored.
Germans stampede across the landscape. I am getting too old for this.
I have seen much in my time, but never an enemy as terrifying as the Germans.
I thought our alliance supreme, but the Haudenosaunee shatter it with one blow.
Even if we live to see another day, the Haudenosaunee will be there to greet us when we wake.
Killing is a sport to these Ottomans. I have nothing left to offer them but my death.
Is this the death of our empire? I only hope we showed these Ottomans the meaning of honor.
They may crush us easily, but I will never, ever submit to the Portuguese.
My fortunes never suggested such abuse at the hands of the Portuguese.
Every time a warrior falls, I expect the Russian assault to cease. But it never does.
The Russians thrive on our anguish. There is no diplomacy when you deal with animals.
I am at a loss for ideas, my friend. The Spanish test us in ways I never imagined.
This is no longer a battlefield. Thanks to the Spanish, it has become a graveyard.
I fear that these traitorous Chinese will defeat the very emperor that they betrayed: Me.
I am ashamed to admit that the Chinese traitors mistreat us. They have made a fool of me.
Where is our honor? Where is our courage? Our warriors retreat from the Japanese.
When a Japanese warrior falls it is only after killing five our men. We must do something.
The Indians have marched back with renewed strength.
I look into the future and see an Indian dawn. Unless we act now, our time is over.
We must survive long enough to strike back with a ferocity the Aztecs have never seen.
The British have wasted their greatest warriors in gaining the advantage. Now it is our turn.
The Dutch fight back fiercely, but they cannot do so for long.
The French pour their strongest into this offensive, but leave little reserves to continue.
Even as we feel the tips of their blades, they weaken. The Germans will not last.
Our men may die, but the Haudenosaunee weaken. Soon we will have our revenge.
Ottomans think not of the future. They may weaken us, but our vengeance will be final.
It is wrong of the Portuguese to show such cruelty, especially when they are so weak.
We will lie in wait, taking the Russians' damage, but preparing for retaliation.
Every blow costs the Spanish morale and energy. When they are depleted, we strike.
All we have to do is stay alive long enough to slaughter the traitorous Chinese.
Once we pull out of harm's way, we will strike, and finish these Japanese for good.
We may be losing, but the Indians have little left to give. One more attack will be their undoing.
It is up to you to lead us to victory, my friend. The sun has set on the Qing Dynasty.
One more time I come to you on my knees, ally. Pull this battle from the flames of defeat.
I will not give up until the enemy is vanquished and you have been returned to your former glory.
We may weaken, but I still have the strength to bring this battle to the enemy.
They are wilting. We must stoke the fire and increase the heat.
We must keep up this pace, striking the enemy while we have them cornered.
The enemy falls, the war comes to a close, and the student becomes the master.
The enemy dries up like a husk. You have taken my teachings and improved upon them.
It is normal to fear, even in the face of certain victory. I will watch over you, like a grandfather to a child.
The battle goes well, but the war is far from over. I will get us through this deadly storm.
Every old man learns to live with death. Yet I did not expect it so soon.
I do not know if I have the energy for such a campaign. Our enemy is simply too strong.
All this death has left me weary. These old bones break under the weight of our enemy.
Shadows of defeat darken our futures. Enjoy the sunset. It may be our last.
I have ordered my men to begin digging. The tomb of an emperor takes time, and there is little of it left.
Our partnership has been one of legendary courage. Perhaps we shall meet again in the next life.
The enemy wishes to end this campaign quickly, but we must resist.
Little does the enemy know that their bid for victory will lead only to defeat. Now is the time to strike.
The enemy claims more native lands. We must hurry, a ruler is nothing without subjects.
I must admit, the enemy has charisma. The natives rally behind them.
Our enemy has laid the foundation for a trade empire, but we cannot lose hope.
That trade site should have been ours. What is an alliance if we do not work together?
We watch helplessly as the people of this land fall in behind the enemy banner. It is a grim omen.
This cannot continue. The native people turn against us in droves.
A wise commander would have seen this coming. Our opponents will use their vast trade to break us.
Our strong start has slowed to a crawl. The enemy flaunts its trade empire in our faces.
You strike like lightning! The enemy will regret not seeking your allegiance.
Natives can be  the key to victory or defeat. You will not regret this act.
Yours is a remarkable achievement. I am proud to call you my ally.
It seems you have an eye for commerce, as well as an eye for war.
Such a treasure will aid us both, my friend.
In war, resources are as important as weapons.
You have a keen eye for treasure. This is good, as every contribution counts.
It is wise to keep the supply line flowing swiftly.
The sweet chime of coin is music to the ears of any man.
Greed is not greed when it benefits a righteous cause such as ours.
Warriors deserve the finest food, especially if for some it is their last meal.
Do not allow your men to grow too plump in their feasting.
It is a good thing we are allies, otherwise there would be no treasures left for me to discover.
Never have I met a commander with a such a taste for treasure. You put me to shame.
I will allow you to take what is mine this once but please look elsewhere in the future.
Do you wish to offend me, my friend? Save some riches for the rest of us.
It delights me to see a fresh warrior for our cause.
You summon warriors to you. The powerful recognize one of their own.
More subjects join you. Remember. How you treat your servants is how you treat your empire.
Every man who sees you in battle wishes to pledge you his allegiance.
Use this precious resource with care. Trees grow scarce rapidly.
In the heat of battle, your archers will thank you for this wood.
Our empire stretches in every direction, a product of your cunning strategies.
You have shown that despite the enemy's strength, the people of this land are on our side.
A sly move, my friend. You have put us in a very advantageous position.
I see now that your steady pace has all been part of a larger plot. Well done.
A wall is only effective when paired with an aggressive strategy.
You make a wise choice. An enemy can only harm those within his reach.
I have learned that natives must be bought with gifts and protection. I have made the first move.
One can only win over the people of his empire if he holds out a hand in peace.
As usual, I have chosen to set an example. This trade site will contribute much to our alliance.
The land will always provide for the Son of Heaven.
I gather riches easily, like a child at play.
The glint of gold has given me hope for this campaign.
The battle will rage on, thanks to the addition of coin to my coffers.
My men will rejoice at this discovery of food.
I only collect these riches because we are allies. Normally, I would have left them to you.
This treasure lies close to your headquarters. I will share it, if you so desire.
You are a steadfast warrior but a terrible treasure hunter. How do you expect to fund this war?
I have tried to stay silent, but one emperor cannot support two empires. Search for treasure.
I have come upon warriors willing to fight beside our men.
These warriors have seen much bloodshed and will make a fine addition to our army.
These villagers are the foundation of our army. Every last one of them is an asset.
This is good. Strong villagers are needed to help our empire grow beyond its borders.
Wood serves us better tucked in quivers than lying on the forest floor.
Any veteran commander will tell you, wood fuels the fire of victory.
More natives hurry to join us.
Ambition has its rewards. Our empire grows, surpassing the blight of our enemy.
One more trade site has fallen under our influence, putting us in the lead.
I would like to see our enemies reach me now.
Even with these impassable barriers, my gates are always open to you.
Victory is within sight, but the enemy slithers in the grass, waiting for a time to strike.
We have worked hard for this fortunate position. I only hope we can maintain it.
Forget past tragedies and focus on the battle ahead. It is an opportunity to reclaim lost glory.
You have ventured into the world and found defeat. Do not worry, for every failure teaches us a lesson.
You return to me a seasoned warrior, with the blood of many victories on your hands.
Fresh scars mark you, my friend. Your enemies did not stand a chance.
I look forward to benefiting from your experience. Together we will prove unstoppable.
Much has changed since our last encounter. You have grown into a masterful commander.
I fought my hardest, but in the end the better warrior won the day.
It has been an honor knowing you, but it appears my time on this Earth is finished.
You have only seconds left. Enjoy them.
Take one last look at the beauty surrounding you. Your end is near.
So many men, so much death. Come morning, many mothers will weep for their lost sons.
It is as if the spirits themselves fight for our fates. I have never witnessed such a conflict.
No ruler wins the greater war without losing one or two of the smaller battles.
Next time, I will be better prepared. You learn quickly. It is duly noted.
Some battles do not end as you expected. To dwell on defeat is a fool's game.
It appears that this day belongs to me. Do not lose faith. Tomorrow is another day.
I hope you learn something from this defeat and improve your skills for our next meeting.
The predator always devours its prey. It is the law of nature.
With your passion for victory and my long history of it, this will be a battle for the ages.
Stories of your exploits are well known to me. You have my respect and my admiration.
My allies' men fight for me as they would for their own commanders. This is true allegiance.
Do you see? My ally is loyal even as the blood flows. Can you say the same of your allies?
This battle turns, but without the aid of your ally you would have been mine. Remember that.
There must be something about you that I do not see. Your ally rushes to your aid like a man possessed.
Your advancement means little to me. I have more important things to do than gaze upon your every development.
An empire that advances hastily very rarely stands the test of time. Such is my philosophy.
Patience is the sign of a lasting ruler. I will advance when it serves my purpose.
Your seizure of this village does not bother me. If I had wanted it, I would have taken it.
Those poor natives. They do not understand to whom they have pledged their loyalty.
The blood of those innocents is on your hands. Murder is a tool of the weak.
You can kill those who serve me, but you will never kill their devotion.
My headquarters may fall into shadow, but the sun has not yet set on my empire.
This is not a final blow against my army. No. It is simply one more excuse to destroy you.
Congratulations. But cutting down one tree will not remove the forest.
I will not worry. When one trade site falls, another takes its place.
I do not wish to lay waste to your empire without a fight. Please advance, and make yourself a more worthy opponent.
Your villagers outnumber your soldiers three to one. Are you building an army or a pig farm?
Have I disrupted your plans so much as to keep you from advancing?
This behavior is not in keeping with your wisdom. Why does your civilization languish?
Such a beautiful civilization. It is a shame I will soon leave it in ruins.
You deserve all praise given. Your civilization is indeed magnificent.
My subjects have been asking the gods for your advancement. They felt guilty fighting such a shiftless people.
Welcome to this age of wonder. Unfortunately, we cannot share our discoveries with you.
You try to surround me with your towns. But remember. Scattered towns are weakened towns.
Your dying shouts will not be heard, for your friends are too far away.
It is too easy. I could crush all of you at once, like a line of ants beneath my foot.
A single blow could wipe your kind from the map. You and your allies might wish to relocate.
Your victory rises to the sky as smoke. You do not have the might to win this fight.
A dog that bites his master must be reminded of his place. Do not try to win that way again.
I deplore such acts of destruction, but I have no choice other than to destroy this site.
These natives have paid the price for their misguided allegiance.
From this point on, the battle turns for the Son of Heaven. It is over.
As this town center collapses, so do your dreams of glory.
What a pity. That trade site could have aided my army.
You practically begged for me to destroy that site. I hope you have learned a lesson.
You look well. Let us hope something good comes from this unfortunate conflict.
If there is a way to avoid this barbaric affair, please tell me now. I detest unnecessary death.
You have grown bolder and braver since our last encounter. It does not go unnoticed.
Is this a joke? Do you truly wish to face such steep and bloody challenges?
Our last engagement must have tormented you. This lack of confidence is not in your character.
A warrior never fights with half his heart, and no battle is easier than the last.
I have not been able to rid my mind of this setting. Too many of my men have died here.
There is no such thing as an easy battle. Despite the odds, you will suffer greatly before defeat.
Be warned, you will face many obstacles on the path to victory. More than you are used to.
Once again, my monk is safe. That was no way to treat a man of peace.
Your men tour my dominion. Surrender now and they will not be harmed.
I have your warriors in sight. Please, this is your last chance to give up and claim defeat.
I see warriors in the distance. They make an easy target for my archers.
Any man can field an army, but it takes a leader to wield it. Which one are you?
I see our respect is not mutual. Why have you sent men to my town?
Your warriors flirt with disaster. Call them back before it is too late.
