What a heinous act. I expected more from you than this brand of cowardice.
It is mercy, not murder, that makes a ruler great.
That shaking is not the earth but the army marching over it. You should be feared.
I hope you do not plan to use your army for an attack. There must another solution.
I had hoped to find friendly faces in my territory, not the harsh gazes of warriors.
Please, disband your army before I do it for you.
There is no honor in striking a man at home, burning his farms, killing his families.
You have wandered too far from your own domain. Turn back now or face the consequences.
I hope this tiny band is not representative of your military might.
My empire is not a public garden. Have your men stroll elsewhere.
I stare into the exposed heart of your empire.
I have found you. Now we can begin the negotiations for your surrender.
This has been a fierce competition, but the victor was never in doubt.
I am impressed with your tenacity, but the victory is still mine.
This chapter in our relationship must end. Draw your sword, the time has come.
That is not thunder, my friend. That is the sound of marching feet, the sound of your destruction.
I can only imagine the strategies you must be devising.
Do not be offended by my silence. I am simply looking after the needs of my people.
Will you not reconsider this foolish war? My warriors crave your blood.
There is no place left for this old warrior. I must admit defeat in the eyes of my enemy.
I will not allow my people to suffer any longer. Will you accept my surrender?
I should be outraged by this act, but I would have done the same thing myself.
You rush to make this land your own, but I believe its natives will have an opinion on this matter.
Many factors contribute to victory. Your number of trade sites impresses, but ultimately means nothing.
I see you have won the race for resources. Everything in battle is a race.
You should set your sights on the battlefield and not on scattered treasures.
You have worked hard to hoard these riches. I hope you can hold onto them.
Gold, not steel, is the weapon of war. You are smart to seek it.
Enjoy the food. Your men have fought bravely, and earned it.
A great man provides for those in need. Your people will be thankful for the food.
I could learn much from such an aggressive gatherer.
Do not venture too close, my friend. It is best not to poke a sleeping tiger.
Strong rulers obtain their own treasures. They do not steal them from another.
Your new warriors will fight fiercely. I will have to call up extra soldiers.
The more men that join you, the more you seem worthy of their allegiance.
Villagers have pledged their lives to you. Perhaps you are mightier than I thought.
You wisely take what the forest provides.
A wall will not resist my armies. Do not waste time on it.
A wall is a good defense. But will it hold?
Other villages will see this example and bow down to the Son of Heaven.
It has begun. Soon all peoples will be absorbed into my empire.
In your hands, these trade sites would become corrupted. It is best if I take them.
So starts the Qing's trade dominance over these lands.
Do not make me feel selfish. Please, find some treasure for yourself.
This land is ripe with wealth. You should take advantage before everything has vanished.
An army is only as powerful as its supplies are abundant. You should know this.
I do not need more riches, but I will gladly deprive you of them.
Would you like to share this food with me? Your men look thin and sickly.
I cannot believe you left this unattended for so long.
A poor opponent is a weak opponent. Do not make me share my wealth with my enemy.
The greatest warriors fight for the Qing. Others fight for whoever will take them.
More servants join my cause. A ruler knows he is beloved when men flock to him.
This wood will contribute nicely to your funeral pyre.
Despite your best efforts, you will not turn the natives of this land against me.
A wise move, yes, but one you will pay for in the end.
I have noticed your bid for victory. Did you think I would not try to stop you?
Time passes swiftly. Now, all I have to do is wait.
Do not worry. Every warrior suffers a defeat from time to time.
You have been a formidable opponent to lesser foes than I.
Your previous battles have earned you a reputation. Unfortunately, it means little to a veteran like me.
You are an enemy with a wealth of experience. Unfortunately it looks paltry compared to mine.
This appears to be the end, but it is not. There are many other things worth living for.
The dark skies clear for the Son of Heaven. Victory is at hand.
Upgrades this Trade Route to use Trains, which deliver resources faster and provide greater line of sight.
Upgrades this Trade Route to use Trade Carts, which can deliver resources, move faster, and provide greater line of sight.
Villager that gathers resources and a Fattened Goat to eat.
Mercenary siege infantry, good against infantry and buildings
Mercenary siege infantry that is good against infantry. Throws fire bombs to destroy buildings.
A pet monkey that likes bananas and is good against guardians.
Ships a number of Indian Arsonist mercenaries that are good against infantry and buildings, +1 Villager.
Uesugi's army is on the march. He will receive reinforcements at each standing village. When this is done, he will make a final assault on your base.
Uesugi has shown himself at last. Swallow your fear, men. Today is a good day to die! Attack!
The gods are against us. They have chosen a path for us other than victory.
With a heavy heart, I bid you farewell.
This is the end. The gods have willed it.
I have seen this conclusion in my dreams.
It is our unwavering faith that has led us here.
The gods commune with the animals, as should you. Train more horses.
Cavalry will help to reduce your bloodshed, but you must hurry.
The swiftness of cavalry might speed your victory.
All of nature is connected. Train cavalry, for horses and men should ride together as one.
You must send in additional infantry, the gods have willed it.
Foot soldiers would best exploit this situation. The gods have willed it.
Your future is cloudy, and the clouds grow ever darker. Order a retreat.
There is nothing shameful in defeat if it is done with confidence. End this battle.
This clash is monumental. The gods roar their approval.
The earth shakes. The blood spills. We stand on the threshold of immortality.
The gods watch over our cause. All who rise against us will fall.
Once again, I have been blessed for my devotion.
For this reason, a man has faith. He wins battles he believes he shall win.
I emerge victorious in the face if adversity, faith unshaken.
It is good to hold your faith before you, and let it guide you to victory.
Blessings shower down upon us, as we claim victory.
War is the result of an unenlightened society. I will make quick work of this enemy.
Violence brings me no pleasure. Nevertheless, it is work that must be done.
Do not worry. I have faith that I will leave this conflict unscathed.
The strongest men enter battle scarred but not shaken. I will win this fight.
I bow to you, ally. You bring the greatest blessing of all - friendship.
A more welcome sight I have never seen. You presence here changes everything.
I am trapped between two raging rivers, soon to be drowned in their currents.
I am wise enough to know that one army versus two, always equals tragedy.
Of course, if it is the wish of the divine.
Yes, I have seen it foretold.
It will be done. Our forges will roar, and then our cannon will fire.
It will be done. Walls will crumble before us.
It will be done. We will harness the beasts to do our bidding.
It will be done. Our people have close kinship with the wild.
It will be done. There is no greater soldier than a horse and rider.
It will be done. Our path to victory will be trod by infantry.
It will be done. Every man willing to fight for his kingdom is a warrior.
It will be done. Even the most ordinary men can be heroes.
I am sorry, the gods have not willed it.
No, such a donation is not in the stars.
I am sorry. There is no way my people can do without.
This is not the will of the divine.
Such a thing is not possible.
Perhaps next time, when the request is blessed.
Forgive me, but such an act has not been prophesized.
I have no spare soldiers for this mission.
There are no extra warriors wandering our streets. I cannot help.
My people are praying for warriors of their own, for all of our men lie dead or dying.
This is not the gods' plan for you, my friend.
I am afraid there is nothing that can be done.
I must deny this request out of respect for my beliefs.
Sadly, no. I was about to ask you the same question. We, too, need able men to fight.
My ranks have thinned to nothing. Every man is needed.
You will need to pray for more soldiers, not come to me.
There will be other opportunities to end this madness. I have foreseen it.
We did not find victory today, but the gods still watch over us in their infinite wisdom.
Not even the Aztec warriors can withstand the divine winds of victory.
British domination was not foretold to me, therefore it will not come to pass.
The Dutch cower like beaten beasts. We should show them mercy.
With time, the tamed French will realize the foolishness of their actions.
A German army can be broken like any other, and today we have done it.
We have left the Haudenosaunee in pieces. They have no fight left in them.
The Ottoman army should have heeded my call for cooperation, instead of choosing warfare.
The Portuguese have few breaths left, but still enough to save their souls.
If they were not my enemy, I would rescue these dying Russians. Alas, it is not to be.
The Spanish must have angered the sacred, for their bodies litter the battlefield.
I always thought the Chinese had a stronger army than what lies crushed before me.
The Japanese will only survive if they stumble upon a miracle.
Rejoice, for our traitorous Indian brothers are weakening.
Crushing these rebels, these brothers, has been like seizing my own heart in a death grip.
The Aztecs are mighty and should be respected.
They may not share our beliefs, but the Aztec share our conviction. They will fight relentlessly.
The British are mighty and should be respected.
I fear the British only because they seem willing to fight on when others would surrender.
The Dutch are mighty and should be respected.
I have been warned of the Dutch. One misstep and they will finish us without hesitation.
The French are mighty and should be respected.
Despite their strange customs, the French are no stranger to warfare. Watch them carefully.
The Germans are mighty and should be respected.
Many nations have fallen victim to the Germans, as will we if we do not proceed with caution.
The Haudenosaunee are mighty and should be respected.
The stars foretell a bloody battle ahead. The Haudenosaunee are much stronger than I expected.
The Ottomans are mighty and should be respected.
I had hoped we could avoid fighting the Ottomans. They have a reputation...a frightening one.
The Portuguese are mighty and should be respected.
Where we have faith, the Portuguese soldiers lust for blood and battle.
The Russians are mighty and should be respected.
The Lakota are mighty and should be respected.
The Spanish are mighty and should be respected.
If only we were not fighting the Spanish. They are known for their unbreakable spirit.
I kneel before you. Such a wondrous and advanced society deserves recognition.
You are very wise to develop new tactics and technology. I will follow your example to the best of my ability.
Every camp the enemy captures hurts us. We must prevent further acts like this one.
The natives find something they like in our enemy's offer. We have to offer them something better.
Do not settle for such a lowly fate, my ally. You wallow in an early age when you could be reaching for the heavens.
Please advance for the sake of our alliance. Do you not crave an enlightened age?
Everyone waits for you, my ally. Your people deserve to benefit from a greater age than this one.
I wait, arms outstretched, for you to join me in this distant age. It is time.
You are well on your way to building the greatest empire the world has ever seen.
I stand in awe of your wonders. The gods have great deeds in store for you.
Have faith, my ally. You have reached this late, but you still have much to offer.
With every advancement you become a stronger, more confident ruler. Welcome to this fascinating age.
You have blessed me, ally. Thank you for rescuing my Brahmin.
The gods have guided you in your actions, and brought my Brahmin back to me.
The threat vanishes into thin air, and once again faith sustains us in our twilight hour.
The gods have weighted my hand and crushed the enemy threat. Rejoice!
This was an unavoidable act. Tolerance only extends so far.
I tried to accept these natives into the fold, but they resisted. Such a fate was unavoidable.
I hope the destruction of this town serves as an example to all those who oppose the gods.
If a town does not welcome our rule, then it has no place in our empire.
The trading post has been destroyed, as ordered by the gods.
Thanks to the gods, this trading post has fallen.
This native village was too strong. They must still have a greater role to play in this conflict.
The destruction of that village was not meant to be.
The enemy town still stands. This time, the gods have shown them mercy.
The destruction of that town was not meant to be.
Perhaps I misunderstood my purpose. That trading post was never meant to burn.
The destruction of that trading post was not meant to be.
The death of a Brahmin holds ill portent. Many treasures will now be left unattended.
You will need to gather riches for me, my ally. My Brahmin has passed on, and with him his duties.
A beast has killed my Brahmin. Perhaps it was a vengeful soul from another life.
My Brahmin has met a tragic end, but he will be remembered for all he has done.
I have lost all but my faith, dear ally. Even that I clutch close for fear of losing it.
As a man, I can only take so much punishment. If it were the will of the gods, I would surrender now.
If the gods will it, please send men to support my army. They fare badly.
The enemy put up a passionate fight. I may require reinforcements.
The enemy seeks to defy the gods and overrun my town. Help us. Help us now!
Everywhere I turn, I see strange faces. My empire burns. I plead for your help, ally.
I look forward to the wonderful things we will do as allies, if the gods will it.
The heavens open up to bless our alliance. We will do great things together.
My heart warms like the sun to see your face. Welcome.
Much has changed since our last battle. You have chosen a more difficult path. I respect that.
I like this confidence. You should seek to face more difficult challenges. Know no fear when the gods are on your side.
I do not understand the need to set your sights so low. Together with the Mughal, you will find the victory you seek.
You underestimate yourself by choosing this battle, my ally. With the divine supporting us, we could stare down any adversary.
When last we fought, I secretly admired your prowess. Now having you as an ally, I have been blessed with it.
I remember you. We were enemies once, but the past must be put behind us now.
Last time you proved an incredible force on the battlefield. Like me, you are one of the chosen ones.
I have been meditating on our last alliance. I hope to acquire some of the lessons that led you to such dominance.
It appears you have returned educated from our last encounter. I hope you put harsh lessons to good use.
It is not important that I dominated our last alliance. The gods have given you a new opportunity for glory.
We have been blessed with a great advantage. If I am not mistaken, we have fought on these lands before.
The gods grant all of us second chances. That is why life is long.
Do not worry. Our past failures will serve to remind us of what is at stake in these battles.
My ally, I am pleased to see you again. It is clear we are destined for greatness.
The gods are good. Once again they have blessed me with your presence.
I would have paid any price for the safe return of my Brahmin.
There is no substitute for the life of a holy man. Brahmin are priceless to me.
I had to pay for the return of my Brahmin, but it was money well spent.
The rescue of my Brahmin is proof of the enemy's weakness.
I have saved my Brahmin. He reveals to me many secrets of the enemy's lair.
My Brahmin are dear to me. Their mistreatment begs the wrath of the gods.
A town center stands before me, naked. Not a single soldier waits to defend it.
The gods have blessed me with knowledge. I see the enemy, and he has no army.
Give thanks to the heavens. A vision reveals to me the enemy's lack of barracks.
Nothing can be hidden from the gods. They have shown me the enemy town, and there is no barracks.
I see clearly the enemy's mistakes. A town without a stable is a town that can be conquered.
Divine sight grants me witness to the enemy town center. No stable stands there.
Take this as a sign of my good faith.
You have been good to me. This shows my appreciation.
Please, find use for this gold. It is yours.
It may come from my hand, but this food is a gift from the gods.
Feed your hungry men with this.
We use what nature provides, but sometimes you must rely on your friends. Take this wood.
I have no doubt you will find a good place for this wood.
The gods send me to strike the enemy headquarters. Tell me, how can an empire survive without its beating heart?
As the sun rises, I glimpse my future. Through smoke and fire, I see the enemy base burning.
I am not proud of my decision, but it needed to be made. I have launched a raid on enemy villagers.
A nation is only as strong as its weakest citizen. I have ordered my men to strike the enemy's villagers.
It chills my blood to do it, but I must go and cut down the enemy's gatherers.
Our partnership has been a good one, but my faith is my own. I march towards the enemy capital.
I order my armies on the enemy town. If I do not return, my empire lies in your hands.
The time has come. The prophecies ring true. The gods send me forth to glory in the enemy capital.
Every enemy settlement is a settlement we cannot leave standing.
The converts of the enemy must learn the consequences of their choice. We will destroy this native village.
We must wipe that trading post from the map. It is an affront to our cause.
This trade site stands as a blemish on Mughal land. It cannot remain.
The army of the Mughal marches to open a second front. It is our destiny.
I have been given a sign to aid you in this endeavor. We will drive the enemy into a panic.
My soldiers move in for the kill. Sometimes tolerance must give way to force.
On this spot I will build the finest army the world has ever seen. It is the will of the gods.
From here, my generals will have a telling view of the battlefield.
This geography lends itself well to the thinking of a military mind. My barracks will go here.
I will build my town center here, where I can see the dawn break over every inch of my empire.
I have chosen a place for my town center. This piece of paradise will be my second home.
There is no doubt in my heart; this is a holy land, the perfect place to plant an empire.
I advance on this small village in peace, with hopes we can work together with its people.
The gods have instructed me to make a pact with these villagers, to bring them under our influence.
I plan to approach these natives and extend the hand of friendship.
I believe this site will make a good trade hub. The gods will it so.
With your blessing, I will claim this trade site for my empire.
If you cannot find me, you might look for my body here, where it fell in defense of the empire.
This building must not be lost. Without it, our kingdom moves one step closer to doom.
I declare this holy ground. No man will move me from it.
The moment my men stepped on this ground, it became consecrated and will be defended.
We have fought hard to win the friendship of these natives. We must fight harder to keep it.
Our native brothers will not be forced from their lands. We must resist this attack.
Why would anyone wish to burn paradise? My men will defend this town to their deaths.
No enemy shall set foot in this town and live. I have declared it.
This trade site cannot fall, not while the Mughal flag flies over it.
It is the will of the divine that I defend this trade site. No man shall pass.
A rich man should care for his impoverished brothers and sisters. Take this gold.
Take this offering of gold for as long as you require it.
Take this offering of food for as long as you require it.
Take this offering of wood for as long as you require it.
You never fight alone, my ally. You have the Mughal and the gods at your back.
Reassure your embattled soldiers. Mughal armies are on the way.
I have sent men to reinforce your defense. They fly like angels to your rescue.
I am enjoying the quiet. Silence is a blessing, and peaceful prayer should be the goal of the soul.
I am sorry if I have said little. I have been deep in meditation, praying for a decisive victory.
An emperor never wants to beg for riches. But I need gold desperately.
On my knees, I ask for a tribute of gold.
I swallow my pride and beg you, my ally, for food.
On my knees, I ask for a tribute of food.
I have foolishly consumed all of my wood. Could you spare some for an ally?
On my knees, I ask for a tribute of wood.
Your coming was revealed to me in a dream. The gods bless our alliance.
Thank you. Together, our armies will bring light to the darkness.
Thank you for your aid. We shall press our enemy until he can longer breathe.
Many blessings upon you. Your generosity is an example for others.
No man gives his gold without some regret. Thank you for taking the generous path.
Nourishment is always welcome. Many blessings upon you.
This food falls into waiting hands. Thank you.
Your warriors have worked miracles today. Their great sacrifice will not be forgotten.
I thank you, and my people thank you. The great society lives on.
The gods must have sent you. This gracious act reveals your soul's kindness.
Many blessings upon you. Your gifts are very generous.
These are like blessings from heaven. Thank you.
You continue to earn my trust. This wood is needed.
The Aztecs fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
The divine look down on us with disfavor. The Aztec offer greater resistance than anticipated.
The British fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
The British dominate us, and rightly so. Their aim is true, and their blows are mighty.
The Dutch fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
I am confused. The Dutch duel as if the gods were on their side. I must not let this shake my faith.
The French fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
The spirits must seek to challenge us, for the French armies appear to be unstoppable.
The German fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
If we are to dominate these Germans, we will need to start fighting like men of faith, not men of fear.
The Haudenosaunee fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
Even in my clearest visions, no army has clashed with as much conviction as these Haudenosaunee.
The Ottomans fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
We must do something soon, or this land will be one more jewel in the Ottoman Empire.
The Portuguese fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
I grow weary fighting these tireless Portuguese. They are obsessed with ending our empire.
The Russians fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
Our destiny has been obscured by these vicious Russians. We must reclaim it.
The Spanish fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
Every time I look up from my dying men, the Spanish smile down at me. Where is my hope?
The Chinese fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
We cannot let the powerful Chinese exert their influence over us. Their victories mean nothing.
The Japanese fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
I did not see such an epic battle ahead of us. The Japanese have proved me wrong in every way.
These traitorous Indians fight with a glorious passion. What have we done to displease the gods?
If the traitorous Indians continue to fight so bitterly, our cause is surely lost.
We will triumph over these rampaging Aztecs in the end. Our faith will sustain us in these, our darkest hours.
We must hold our faith before us in the face of the British charge. We will emerge stronger.
Our blood stains the boots of the Dutch, but it is all part of our greater strategy. They have used up all of their fire.
I have seen no signs of a French victory. They overextend themselves to our advantage.
The Germans are about to declare this war in their favor, but they do so with tired men and dulled blades. It is time to strike.
I know it appears we have lost this battle, but we cannot lose hope. We will defeat these Haudenosaunee.
Trust me. The Ottomans cannot maintain this pace. Defeat will not be our destiny.
The Portuguese overrun us, but their supply of soldiers will soon run out. Then, our time will come.
The endurance of the Russians is great, but so is our faith. We will strike back with a decisive blow.
We are not destined for defeat this day. The Spanish will still suffer greatly.
Fear not. This Chinese might is deceiving. Each of our blows chips away at their resolve.
The Japanese believe they have finished us, but all of their ambition has left them weak.
We may be slow but our footing is sure. The Indian betrayers have not yet won this war.
You must strengthen your fight. My failures are dragging us down to defeat.
You will need to battle for both of us, as my forces dwindle and lead us to despair.
We survive by the grace of the gods. You must find strength in that.
Defeat looms large, but there is still time. Follow my example, and fight!
We should not grow to accustomed to this advantage. The enemy is cunning.
The gods may bless us, but fate is a fickle thing. At any moment, fortunes could change.
We must continue the attack with your sword out front. I am at your command.
I have great faith in your allegiance. It has brought us this far.
The battle turns in our favor, yet there is still time for mistakes. Stay near me, and learn.
The gods grant us continuing strength and wisdom. We must remain obedient.
We must have done something to incur this wrath. The heavens have abandoned us.
A man can only fight alone for so long. Without the gods behind us, we fail.
Can nothing be done? Our men fight tirelessly to what end?
A shadow passes over the battlefield. It blots out the sun of our victory.
We have seen our end, and it is nearly upon us.
All of my faith has fallen from me. I do not know where to turn in the face of defeat.
I know my destiny, and it does not end like this. We will stall this enemy drive.
Our enemy seeks to defy the gods and finish this war without a fight.
We must offer these natives a better alternative. Hurry to their villages.
Our enemy comes to villages as conquerors. We must come as friends and liberators.
This move to seize the trade route must be prevented.
We must work harder to capture trade sites. In this battle, every inch of land counts.
If the enemy follows this path, we will have the whole of the native population against us.
Natives continue to flock to our enemy's cause. We must do something, quickly.
A strong trade empire is born, but not within our borders. The enemy strengthens.
We must subvert the enemy's trade ambitions if we are to claim victory.
Befriending the natives is a proper course for success; the gods have willed it so.
Your exhibition of tolerance and understanding has brought more to our cause.
The seizure of that trade site shows you are wise in handling the weapons of war.
The gods have granted you a trade site. It is cause for much thanks.
Always be appreciative of the blessings given you.
The gods have provided, now you must show your faith.
When in doubt, the divine will lend the aid you seek.
The hand of the holy ones will always be outstretched to you, oh ally.
Coin is the tool of man, but in the right hands it can work miracles.
You have been gifted with gold to do the divine's bidding.
Your men will never starve when they are in the arms of the gods.
That bread will feed your body, but it is faith that will feed your soul.
Never forget from whom your blessings flow. You must always give thanks for your good fortune.
Save some of nature's treasures for me, my ally. My mind is focused on other tasks.
What is mine is yours. Take that offering and use it well.
All who I call "friend" are welcome to the fruits of my kingdom.
Your army swells with new warriors. The gods fill our ranks.
I am glad you have won these fierce warriors to our side. I would not want to face them in battle.
You have found settlers. Put them to work. There is no time for idle hands.
More have joined us. Treat them well, and they will follow anywhere.
Do you realize that this gift of wood has come from above?
Does this blessing of wood not convince you that we are protected by the divine?
Another native site has been added to our domain. Spirits must aid you in your work.
The natives flock to you. Whatever you are doing to win them over, keep doing it.
You have done well. Without a trade route, our enemies flow of resources will dry up.
You have quite a rapport with the people of this region. Continue reaching out to them.
A wall is but a temporary solution, whether around your heart or your headquarters.
Do not allow yourself to succumb to fear. A wall will only hide your enemy, not make him disappear.
I do not wish to conquer, only to explore and understand. These natives will enrich our kingdoms with their culture.
I am the first to make contact with the people of these lands. Our alliance grows.
With this trading post, a new chapter in the history of my empire will be written.
When I need food, I find food. When I need wood, I find wood. And when I need coin, a glint of gold catches my eye. I am blessed.
Are you beginning to see the logic in my faith? Everywhere I turn, my needs are met.
All I acquire passes through me to my people. What you see in my hands, flows into theirs.
My need for wealth is always met. The name of my empire must be written in the stars.
My need for food is always met. Someone watches over me.
I am taking this treasure, but only with your blessing.
We have been given so much. It is right that one of us take advantage of such riches.
I hope your disinterest in treasure will not result in a request for loans.
You must think my ambitions grand. You have hardly searched the land for any riches.
Let us welcome these warriors to our ranks. No one fights harder than a man defending his homeland.
Every man has a right to defend the land of his birth, especially the natives who have joined us.
These new settlers wish to join us, and we both know that a kingdom is built by its people.
New settlers wish to join my society. They will not be disappointed.
I fall to my knees in appreciation for this gift of wood.
I raise my hands to the heavens, giving thanks for this wood.
The Mughals give these natives refuge, and they give us their lands. It is a good arrangement.
We must continue to steal these sites. Our enemy will wither without trade.
Every trade route is another vein through which the blood of our army flows.
It is sad that I must enclose my open society within hardened stone.
As my heart is a barrier from fear, let this wall be a barrier from evil.
With one blessed blow we have ended our enemy's tyranny. The clock is ticking.
It is done. Our enemy writhes beneath us in a panic. This is a good day.
You have suffered greatly in your recent confrontations. Come. You are with friends now.
Every man reaches for goals that exceed his grasp. Do not worry. Your recent defeats will not plague you here.
You have braved many battles in our time apart. Your face is a picture of pain, but of pride, as well.
I know that expression. You have defeated many foes since last we spoke, and you crave my approval. You have it.
The gods have sent me an ally with great experience. You have my sword, as I have yours.
I am pleased that you have seen the world and faced its trials. Now it is time to put that experience into action.
In one minute, a bright and brilliant light will fade from this world. I hope you are proud.
Perhaps you have a larger role in our destinies than I realized, for it looks as if you are the victor.
As the final seconds of this terrible war pass, hope springs forth renewed.
Rays of goodness and enlightenment shine forth on the eve of victory.
This hallowed ground has been chosen by the gods. Here, I will cleanse the earth of your evils.
The future is predetermined. You can throw as many men into this war as you choose, but it will be for nothing.
Remember this day and this battle. It will be your last taste of victory.
This battle was rightfully mine. Please try not to stab me in the back as I retreat.
Corruption and villainy may win you one skirmish, but goodness will always prevail.
The blood spilled today was not spilled in vain. I have once again kept you from achieving your goals.
This victory came to me in a dream. I have known of it for weeks.
All in this war happens as it should. My faith was never tested, the battle never in doubt.
I will tell you this, one ruler to another. There is no hope for you in this battle. The gods have spoken.
My sword blazes with the righteous flame. Before this day is finished, you will kneel before me.
The blessings, and the allies, rain down upon me. My grip tightens on your throat.
You see, this is why you treat others with respect. They will always come to your aid, swords drawn.
Enjoy this good fortune. I will find other opportunities for victory. The gods will it.
Your ally brings you a victory. It is a dark day.
The gods have blessed you with wisdom and progress.
Your civilization is an example for the whole world. It is a pity I must destroy it.
People the world over rejoice at the arrival of a new age, regardless of the kingdom.
Each day brings new villages to your empire. Treat them with respect.
Your hollow promises will fail to satisfy these natives, and when they do, I will be waiting.
If you have cause for harm against me, do not take it out on the people of my empire.
This is a great tragedy. These natives will be avenged. The gods will it.
I am not afraid. An empire is not based in a building, but in the hearts of its people.
You may have destroyed our capital, but our empire fights on.
The loss of a trading post is nothing to mourn. The gods will provide for us.
You waste time attacking my trade route. My men are busy elsewhere, with more important matters.
A weak empire is the sign of a weak ruler. Your civilization lags behind the rest of us.
I do not wish to attack a defenseless foe. You must advance to train soldiers.
The divine has given all of us the potential for great things. Use it, or remain ignorant.
You are holding back your society with this focus on warfare. Advance or perish.
You have set an example for the rest of us. I have great respect for an advanced empire.
The gods watch over you. I do not understand it, but I know better than to question it.
If you had waited any longer to advance, I would have questioned your right to participate in this battle.
You have much to prove, advancing so late. Your society should be shunned.
Your distance from your allies betrays you. The relationship is not as close as you claim.
It is not a good sign that your allies settle so far from you. Have you offended them?
With enemies clustered so closely together, I fear a confrontation of epic proportions.
It is good for you to be located near your allies, but, alas, it is bad for me.
I have extinguished your threat. Your clever tricks will not work against me.
It does not bring me pleasure to defeat you. I  do it only to show you the error of your ways.
You should know better than to lead these innocent people to their doom.
An unavoidable tragedy. In my society, this would not have happened.
You will learn to forgive me in time. I had little choice.
Your town center represented all that was wrong with your civilization.
The pursuit of wealth brings with it only greed. That trade site was a bad influence.
This site would have been better utilized under my control.
I have foreseen a future without war. Until that day is here I will fight to preserve my empire.
War is for the unenlightened. I am furious that you have driven me to take such action.
Confident, are we? Perhaps you expect too much from this adventure. War should never be taken lightly.
You have chosen a very difficult battle. You may be mighty, but you have not yet learned humility.
It is wise of you to confront a lesser challenge this time. You have not yet shown your worth.
It seems you have come to your senses and realized that your men are not lions, but mice.
Do you remember this holy land? It has been chosen as the site of my greatest victory.
You are wise to face a lesser challenge. It is for the best...I have seen you fight.
By battling such odds, you must assume to have the support of the divine.
We have rescued our Brahmin. There is nothing you can do to dampen his faith.
Your men hope to spread their influence where it is not wanted. Leave these lands.
Soldiers trample the grass around us. Surrender now, before more blood is shed.
Your warriors look drained of courage. Send them to me, and I will show them mercy.
I have glimpsed your men, and seen a future filled only with death. Turn back.
If your men dare attack me, you will be meddling with the work of the gods.
I see your movements and suggest keeping this war on the battlefield. Do not involve families and farmers.
Such barbarism! You ask for the gods' wrath, and they shall answer you in kind.
For every act of murder committed today, I will visit them back upon you twofold.
Such a sea of men is only good for one thing. Have you come to finish this dance?
An army of this size is only meant to terrify. With the gods strength, I will not be intimidated.
Your men, like you, seem lost and without direction. Perhaps they should join my great society.
Are your men hoping to see what an enlightened kingdom looks like? They are welcome to.
Only the ignorant seek to destroy the enlightened. You know not what you do.
You have caught me by surprise, but my faith will save me. I will not forsake it.
If we were at peace I could let your men walk these lands unmolested. But, we are not.
Is this a small band of migrants wishing to join my cause?
I have seen the capital of your empire, and I am very disappointed.
Tell me. Do you really believe that this lowly town can be the heart of a great empire?
It brings me no pleasure to steal riches from one who needs them.
The truth is obvious. The gods side with me in every battle.
I never wished for conquest, but it has come to that. My men are nearly upon you.
You have resisted our calls for cooperation for the last time. Prepare to meet your fate.
I am curious. Why do you wish to see the great society destroyed?
The fronts lie silent. Is this a message? Do you wish to end this war?
It is the sad reality that you bring no faith to this battlefield. The gods are on my side.
I cannot bear to see this empire burn. I beg of you. Spare my people.
Today is as good as any to see my empire fall, if the gods so desire it.
The divine have ended my threat and given you another day of life. Cherish it.
Your civilization absorbs many in its quest for glory. Is this to please your people...or yourself?
A trade empire is a sign of a healthy economy, and in your case, probably a corrupt one.
Predictable. You value treasure first, human life second.
No amount of resources will prevent your inevitable downfall.
You should be thankful, as the gods provide for you.
A poor man thinks before spending, but a rich man spends before thinking. Which are you?
Your people should be down on bended knees, thanking the heavens for this food.
Ration every morsel to the fullest, for it is truly a gift from above.
I hope your race for treasures is for the good of your society, and not for yourself.
I expected you to conduct yourself as a ruler, not a thief. You test my patience.
It is dishonorable to steal from another when your storehouses are so full.
These men pledge themselves to you. I hope you appreciate this honorable sacrifice.
You are wrong to recruit followers only to order them to their deaths. You should be ashamed.
I do not understand how you continue to win new villagers.
Without the skill to craft it, that wood will do you little good.
A closed society has nothing to offer the rest of humanity. Tear down your walls.
If you do not remove your walls, the gods will remove them on my behalf.
I welcome all into my fold, even these lost and savage villagers.
Great men open their arms to embrace all peoples, as I embrace these natives.
I am blessed. This trade site will provide great things for my empire.
This trade site will benefit my great society, not yours.
I will use all of creation to end your empire.
I will use whatever the gods provide to stop the madness of war.
I will thank the heavens for every gift, every weapon I may use against you.
I will use the gold of the earth to purchase your destruction.
I will use the food of the fields to fatten my armies.
I consider this gift an offering to the poor of my empire. They thank you.
Take my advice. Trust in the gods, and you will find open the gates to a kingdom of riches.
These holy warriors will live to see paradise. The gods have willed it.
The gods have provided villagers to walk the enlightened path.
I will use the wood of the forests to set your villages aflame.
As you claim that village, remember that a great empire shows tolerance to all peoples.
You seek commerce when you should seek salvation.
My armies stand poised to end your victory. The gods have willed it.
I have prayed many days for this victory, and now it comes to pass.
You have suffered humbling defeats since last we met. The gods have willed it.
You return from battle victorious. It is true. Only in the heat of battle is a leader forged.
It seems the gods have granted you many victories since our last encounter.
You are a ruler of great experience, but do you have the wisdom to match?
This dark ending was not the destiny shown to me.
A grand society lives on because of our efforts. We are truly blessed.

Bonus: +7% Land Unit Attack

Trains: Yamabushi, Ninja, Shinobi, Ronin

Shipments: Military enhancements
Come out of your isolation so that you can choose a new ally.
Daimyo Otani is dead and his men flock to us. We must not delay, and continue our march north.
Japanese assassin. Highly effective against mercenaries, Explorers, War Chiefs, and Monks.
Heals injured units. Can build Field Hospitals.
Ranged cavalry mercenary, good against cavalry
Heavily armed Japanese mercenary cavalry armed with a bow. Good against cavalry.
Archaic heavy infantry. Good against cavalry and buildings.
Stealthy archer, good against heavy infantry
Stealthy ranged infantry. Good against infantry.
Hand infantry; good against cavalry and buildings
Japanese Monk armed with a large two-handed club. Good against cavalry and buildings.
An army of 3 Shinobi and 2 Ninja.
An army of 3 Ronin and 3 Yojimbo.
Powerful heavy artillery from the foundries of Europe.
European ranged cavalry. Good against cavalry.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Gain all Village upgrades for free.
Town Center attack increased, and you can call out Irregulars two more times.
For the rest of the game, a medium trickle of Wood enriches you, +1 Villager.
When this Shipment arrives, all of your current Export is exchanged for a greater amount of Coin.
Red Seal Ship Shipment has arrived.
Japanese leadership enables all military units to be trained more quickly. Daimyo and Shoguns train units faster than buildings. Daimyo and Shoguns move faster and have a greater line of sight.
Ships a Dojo Rickshaw, allowing you to construct a powerful Dojo to produce your choice of military units.
Seize and hold the Tokaido Road.
Defend Fushimi Castle and evacuate the villagers.
An army of 5 Sohei Naginatas and 1 Yamabushi.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Military units can train in larger blocks.
Threshold used on Snap to Unit
Daimyo of the Fushimi Castle garrison.
It is not an admiral's place to be knee-deep in scum. Finish the fleet so I can take my rightful place at the head of the flagship.
The fleet is under attack! We must hurry and finish building the flagship before we can sail.
Captain, I have more bad news. The pirates have captured our docks to the west. Something must be done.
Thank you, Captain. The pirates are based in a village east of here. Drive them out or our work will never end.
Not only do the pirates raid our ships, but now they kidnap our laborers. We cannot finish the flagship unless every hand has work.
We should build a consulate and hire some bloodthirsty mercenaries. I can give you the names of a few good ones.
We have recaptured the docks but our stores have been emptied. They must have been moved to a safer location.
Send me to deal with this. You can check my pockets afterwards.
I am impressed, Captain. You execute pirates like a seasoned sailor.
I find no pleasure in it. Now come, we must finish the fleet and set out to sea.
Captain, the ship is coming along nicely. You must work to maintain the flow of resources.
Our men do not take their eyes from their work. If all goes as planned, the ship will be completed by nightfall.
Captain, this would be a good place to establish a trade route. We must give our workers the right materials to finish this task.
Each Village and Town Center will do a one-time muster of Pigs.
Finish the imperial flagship by completing Secondary Objectives.

Pirates have interrupted construction of the fleet by terrorizing the shipyards and kidnapping your laborers. You can only set sail by finding the proper resources to finish the fleet, and by ending the pirate threat. This is done by completing the four Secondary Objectives.
Destroy the Castle overlooking the captured Dock.
A band of pirates has descended upon your western Dock and captured it, as well as its vital supplies. You must recapture your property and destroy the Castle that guards it.
The pirates have stolen critical construction materials and transported them south to a nearby island. Use your Heroes to recover this material. Without it, the flagship will not sail.
The pirates have taken captive some of your shipbuilders. Paying ransom is out of the question. You will need to free them by using force. They are being held in stockades to the east.
Destroy the pirate lair and end the threat to your fleet.
The pirate village lies to the east. To end the constant attacks on your ships and laborers, you will need to find and destroy this threat.
Leader among the Knights of St. John on Malta.
Locate the lost Treasure Ships and any survivors.
Find and secure your beached Treasure Ships.
The recent storm has beached three of your Treasure Ships along the coastline of this mysterious country. You must hurry and secure them, saving any surviving crew from the dangers of the wilderness.

You may have accidentally invaded their territory, but you cannot establish a settlement in this land without dealing with its locals. The hostile natives strike you at every turn. Eliminate this threat at its source: The native's village Temple.
Build a Town Center and a Dock.

An unexpected betrayal by the Zamorin of Kozhikode has left your ships damaged, and your fleet leaderless. You must build a Dock in order to build ships. Only then will you be able to rescue the Admiral and take your revenge.
Jinhai is most likely been held captive in the Zamorin's stronghold. You must build a strong enough army to invade the mainland and save your superior officer.
It is time for vengeance! The Middle Kingdom will not accept such treachery. Destroy the Zamorin Town Center to the east, and send a clear message.
Build a Castle on the beach.
To secure your position on the enemy beach you will need to build a Castle. This will enable you to train artillery and resist the tide of enemy warriors.
Hand infantry, good against cavalry / rifle infantry, good against heavy infantry
An elite offensive army of swordsmen and ranged infantry.\n3 Changdao: Heavy swordsmen that are good against infantry.\n3 Arquebusier: Riflemen that are good against infantry.
Archers, good against heavy infantry / raiding cavalry, good against villagers and buildings
A flexible army of archers and hand cavalry.\n3 Chu Ko Nu: Archaic archers good against infantry.\n2 Steppe Riders: Hand cavalry good against villagers and buildings.
Heavy hand cavalry, good against archers, skirmishers, and artillery / heavy ranged cavalry, good against archers, skirmishers, and artillery

An army composed of two types of heavy cavalry.\n2 Iron Flail: Heavy hand cavalry good against archers, skirmishers, and artillery.\n2 Meteor Hammer: Heavy ranged cavalry good against archers, skirmishers, and artillery.
Hand infantry, good against cavalry / ranged cavalry, good against cavalry
Anti-cavalry army of pikemen and ranged cavalry.\n2 Qiang Pikemen: Archaic hand infantry good against cavalry and buildings.\n3 Keshik: Ranged cavalry good against cavalry.
Archers, good against heavy infantry / hand infantry, good against cavalry
Cheap, well-rounded army of archers and pikemen.\n3 Chu Ko Nu: Archaic archers good against infantry.\n3 Qiang Pikemen: Archaic hand infantry good against cavalry.
Rifle infantry, good against heavy infantry / heavy cavalry, good against archers, skirmishers, and artillery

An anti-infantry army of rifle infantry and heavy cavalry.\n3 Arquebusier: Skirmisher with a long range and low hitpoints, good against infantry.\n2 Iron Flail: Heavy cavalry good against archers, skirmishers, and artillery.
Trains and upgrades infantry units as well as defends an area with a ranged attack.
A powerful temple that provides an excellent defense and trains elite Aztec units.
Configure the Summer Palace to produce the Standard Army.\n3 Chu Ko Nus\n2 Steppe Riders
The Summer Palace is producing the Standard Army.\n3 Chu Ko Nus\n2 Steppe Riders
Configure the Summer Palace to produce the Ming Army.\n2 Qiang Pikemen\n3 Keshiks
The Summer Palace is producing the Ming Army.\n2 Qiang Pikemen\n3 Keshiks
Stop the prisoner convoy before it reaches its destination.

The hostiles are attempting to transport their prisoners. You must vanquish the convoy and rescue your men before they reach the enemy settlement. Try using Captain Huang's explosive new ability to blast a path through the trees and get a drop on the convoy.
Find and free your captured shipmates.
The treasure fleet does not leave anyone behind. Use every method at your disposal to carve a path through the jungle and free your scattered sailors.
An explosive attack that only damages trees.
A grove of mango trees that can be harvested for Wood.
Transforms into a Mango Grove for Wood production.
Move to the northern beaches and recover your crew.
Use the caves to move through the region and avoid the mutineer patrols. Sneak around the Aztec settlement and rejoin your shipmates.
Fight your way past the defenses and into the Aztec city. Then destroy the Town Centers that Jinhai and his mutineers have constructed as the heart of their new empire.
Dig through the cave wall to reach the Mines.
Use your villagers to excavate the cave wall and gain entrance to the Gold Mines. There may be another reason for exploring these caverns, one you did not expect to find.
Error joining: You need the WarChiefs expansion to play in this game.
Villager that constructs buildings and gathers resources.
Villager that constructs buildings and gathers resources.
Villager that constructs buildings and gathers resources.
Villager that constructs buildings and gathers resources.
Villager that constructs buildings and gathers resources.
Villager that constructs buildings and gathers resources.
Villager that constructs buildings and gathers resources.
Chinese Monk, who has a chance to do double damage in combat
Religious leader who trains Disciples, stuns Guardians, and has a chance to inflict a Critical Strike in combat. Explores, fights, and builds Town Centers and Trading Posts.
Ships siege weapons, ships, and mercenaries from Europe.
Advances player to the next age.
Ships a second Chinese Monk and enables him for the rest of the game.
Another Shaolin Master Shipment has arrived!

string.@comment: objective: build a town center and a dock
string.#text: By betraying us, the Zamorin has sealed his fate. Prepare the ships for a raid on the northern beach. Vengeance will be ours.
We must hurry! All this time on land is making me seasick.
There is little time. Who knows what the Zamorin is doing to the Admiral. Now is the time to launch a rescue.

string.@comment: there are zamorins on the island
string.#text: We are not alone on this island, Captain. It is a good thing. I was becoming bored with all of this peace and quiet.
The only way to hold this beach is to build a castle. Hurry, before the whole mainland is alerted to our presence.
This is strange. There are Chinese among the enemy dead. It seems that some of our crew chose to fight with the raiders.
This news does not sit well in my stomach. Come. Smoke rises in the east. Where there is smoke, there are devils.
I'm surprised to see you, Huang. I did not believe you had the intelligence to mount a successful rescue.
Now finish this little escapade so the fleet can sail on. I will leave the Zamorin to you.
That will teach the Zamorin to take what does not belong to him.
Let us get back out to sea before our good fortune turns.
I have spotted our captured companions, but the enemy are too many.
This is not the time for cowardice. Our companions depend on us to rescue them before they reach the hostiles' camp.
The forest is too thick. We will never reach the convoy in time to attack.
Put some of the fleet's explosives to good use. Try taking down some of these trees with a bang.
Ships a Rice Paddy Rickshaw and increases Villagers' gather rate from Rice Paddies, Mills, Farms, and Estates for Food and Coin.
Ships a Rice Paddy Rickshaw and increases Villagers' gather rate from Rice Paddies, Mills, Farms, and Estates for Food and Coin.
Captain, another tribe of natives lives in these lands. Perhaps we should gain their trust, become allies.
Ships a Rice Paddy Rickshaw and increased villagers' gather rate from Rice Paddies, Mills, Farms, and Estates for Food and Coin, +1 Villager.
The sun falls in the west, we must move faster. Every second lost could mean the life of one of our shipmates.
The convoy is on the move. Pick up your feet, men. Lives are at stake!
The convoy has been defeated, but our work is not yet done. There will be no rest while the enemy holds our friends.
We should find another entrance into their village, one that is less...painful.
The village is under our control and the hostiles have disbanded, but I still see no sign of the admiral.
Daimyo, trains troops and receives shipments
Extremely powerful Japanese lord who can train troops and receive Shipments.
A powerful Castle that provides an excellent defense.
Those gates are too strong. We should stay in the jungle, where the shadows hide our movements.
We cannot help our friends while lying dead at the foot of these gates. Find another way.
There is the prisoner convoy! Attack! Free our friends!
Interesting. I did not expect that to actually work.
Captain, your crew is scattered all over this jungle. You must hurry. Our friends face a grim fate at the hands of these natives.
Thank you, Captain. Let us join you. These hostiles are fierce, you will need our help.
Configure the Treasure Ship to produce Food crates.
The Treasure Ship is producing Food crates.
Configure the Treasure Ship to produce Wood crates.
The Treasure Ship is producing Wood crates.
Configure the Treasure Ship to produce Coin crates.
The Treasure Ship is producing Coin crates.
Kick out your ally so that you can choose a new one.
Fall back into the caves. We will not last long against these betrayers.
I said it from the beginning. That traitorous admiral gives sailors a bad name.
We will move undetected through these caves. Once we reach the northern beaches, we can begin to rebuild our army.
Proceed carefully. If we are spotted, we will have to fight our way to freedom.
Jinhai uses the native village as his own. Keep moving across the valley. We are too few to fight.
Up ahead. Sunlight. We've reached the cave's end at last.
I have never been happier to smell the stink of the sea.
How odd. This cave opens directly into the enemy stronghold, and it gives me a dastardly idea.
Go back to your village, Captain Huang. You do not have the spine to do what needs to be done.
You do not belong in this strange land, Captain Huang. The longer you stay, the more innocent blood will stain your hands.
No one will mourn you, Captain Huang. You will die a peasant's death on this lost rock.
You think you have defeated me, but you are mistaken. This is only the beginning of my reign.
In the next life, perhaps, but not in this one.
I relieve you of your command, Admiral.
Captain, I noticed glints of gold as we escaped through the caverns. We should investigate.
We should be safe in the shadows, but only if we keep moving.
Trees from below the snowline, such as hemlock and spruce. Harvest for Wood.
Robust Mongolian trees such as fir and the saxual. Harvest for Wood.

Villagers gather all natural resources faster.

Kick out your ally so that you can choose a new one.
A trapped macaque that may join the cause of a rescuer.

A collection of roots and tubers worth %1d %2s.
%1s recovered a collection of roots and tubers worth %2d %3s.
A stockpile of coriander seeds worth %1d %2s.
%1s recovered a stockpile of coriander seeds worth %2d %3s.
A family of monkeys, caged and destined for points unknown.
%1s has rescued a family of monkeys, who join the cause.
Hand cavalry inflict increased damage against Villagers.
Transforms into a Stable for training and upgrading cavalry.
El Pollo Guapo's long lost feed bag, which reduces cavalry training time by 5%.
%1s has recovered El Pollo Guapo's feed bag, which reduces cavalry training time by 5%%.
El Pollo Guapo's golden stirrups, which increase cavalry speed by 5%.
%1s has recovered El Pollo Guapo's golden stirrup, which increases cavalry speed by 5%%.

%1s has recovered El Pollo Guapo's cavalry saber, which increases cavalry siege damage by 10%%.
The barbed spear of El Pollo Guapo, which increases hand cavalry damage against Villagers.

%1s has rescued a trapped construction team able to build War Huts and Stables.
Villager cost changed from Wood to Food, +1 Villager.
Villager cost changed from Food to a lesser amount of Wood.
An army of 24 Rattan Shields and 8 Repentant Monks.
An army of 2 Ronin and 2 Ninja.
Chakram / Tiger Claw / War Elephant Army
An army of 15 Chakram, 12 Tiger Claws, and 1 War Elephant
An army of 12 Ninja and 24 Sohei Naginatas.
Build a Consulate and choose an ally nation.
Build a Consulate and then use it to choose an ally nation. You will be able to use your acquired Export to import powerful mercenary armies. This objective does not affect the ship's progress.
TEAM Churches, Mosques, Meeting Houses and Field Hospitals are much cheaper and their non-advanced improvements are also cheaper. Monasteries are somewhat cheaper. The Community Plaza becomes free.
TEAM improved Barracks, Blockhouse, War Hut, and Nobles' Hut hitpoints.
Build a Wonder so your army can Age up.
Use a Villager's "Advance to the Next Age" button to build one of the Chinese Wonders and advance to the next Age.
Ships a number of Rattan Shield Mercenaries, fast-moving hand infantry.
Ships a number of Rattan Shield Mercenaries, fast-moving hand infantry.
Ships a number of Rattan Shield Mercenaries, fast-moving hand infantry.

Ships a number of Sohei Mercenaries that are good against cavalry.
TEAM Ships a number of Sohei Mercenaries that are good against cavalry.
Instead of a Villager, get 2 free Sepoys with every Shipment after this one, +2 Sepoys.
Rifle infantry, good against heavy infantry / artillery, good against infantry

Rifle infantry, good against heavy infantry / artillery, good against infantry

An anti-infantry army of rifle infantry and artillery.\n3 Arquebusier: Skimisher with a long-range attack and low hitpoints, good against infantry.\n1 Flamethrower: Light artillery better against infantry than buildings.

Increases trade generation by 20% for all tax levels, +1 Villager.
Unlock a new level of trade taxes - 20%, +1 Villager.
Unlocks experience point generation from Shrines. Increases build bounty for constructing Shrines.
Rice Paddy, Mill and Hacienda Hotkeys

Configure to have a 5% Export rate. Gather resources 5% slower but generate Export 35% faster.
Configure to have a 10% Export rate. Gather resources 10% slower but generate Export 60% faster.

We are training too many soldiers. Build a village to house our growing numbers.
Let us build a great wonder in honor of the Emperor. It will raise morale and strengthen our army.
Otherwise, we will not stand a chance, and our dead will litter the beaches.
Configure all Shrines to produce experience points.
All Shrines are producing experience points.

For the rest of the game, a tiny trickle of all resources enriches you (less Export and fewer experience points than other resources).
Mongolian reconnaissance unit with good line of sight but weak attack.
TEAM Dutch player sent everyone an Envoy.
TEAM Chinese player sent everyone Mongol Scouts.
TEAM Ships 1 Castle Rickshaw that can transform into a Castle.
TEAM Rice Paddies, Farms, Mills, Livestock Pens, Villages, and Estates are cheaper, and build much more quickly.
TEAM Land Grab Shipment has arrived.
Rice Paddies, Farms, Mills, Livestock Pens, Sacred Fields, Villages, and Estates are cheaper, and build much more quickly, +1 Villager.
Samurai, Daimyo, and Shogun attack and hitpoints increased.
Train Gurkhas from the Consulate, +1 Villager.
Town Center attack increased, and you can call out Irregulars two more times.
Gurkhas deal more damage to Heavy Infantry. Each tech at the Consulate grants additional Gurkhas for free, +1 Villager.
TEAM Engineering School Shipment has arrived.
TEAM War Academies, Barracks, Stables, Corrals, and Caravanserais are much cheaper. Blockhouses, Nobles Huts, and War Huts are somewhat cheaper.
Now you can train Villagers from Villages.
TEAM For the rest of the game, a tiny trickle of all resources enriches you (less Export, Influence and XP than other resources).
TEAM Rainbow Trickle Shipment has arrived.
TEAM Rainbow Trickle Shipment has arrived.
TEAM Cheaper Unit Upgrades Shipment has arrived.
Artillery will auto limber if told to move large distances
All my life, I have had the same dream. A beach. Palms in the morning light. Waves on the sand.
I do not know this place, or where to find it, only that my destiny waits beyond the tide.
Standard Army Reforms Shipment has arrived.
Ming Army Hitpoints Shipment has arrived.
Qiang Pikeman, Changdao, Keshik, and Meteor Hammer attack and hitpoints increased.
Ming Army Hitpoints Shipment has arrived.
Chu Ko Nu and Arquebusier attack increased and do extra damage to light cavalry and heavy infantry.
Territorial Army Advanced Combat Shipment has arrived.
Han Anti-Cavalry Attack Shipment has arrived.
Old Han Anti-Heavy Infantry Attack Shipment has arrived.
A beachy mix of palms in the sand. Harvest for Wood.
Captain, it is you. We worried you had forgotten about us.
Greetings, Captain. It is good to see you again.
Many thanks, Captain. We could not have survived long without you.
We are at your command, Captain.
It has been too long since we received news from the Admiral. I am growing worried.
You should be worried about us, Captain. Those approaching warriors have murder in their eyes.
Run, Chen! We have been betrayed. Our only hope is to escape with the ships.

At last! After many years of selfless service, I have finally been given the rank of captain. I am to command one of the ships in the Emperor's grand treasure fleet, an undertaking like none other. The glories of the Middle Kingdom will touch every shore.

We prepare to sail with more than 300 ships, and a crew of nearly 20,000. However, my good fortune has come at a price. I must serve under the Emperor's nephew, Admiral Jinhai, a notoriously spoiled child of a man.

The fleet stops in the port city of Calicut, realm of the Zamorin of Kozhikode. The crew's hatred of the Admiral has reached a fevered pitch. My own patience would be strained if not for Chen, a strange old barnacle that has fastened himself to my side.

Familiar waters are far behind us. We sail forever west, long after our companions have turned back. It appears that our fates are linked to the whims of a madman, a child with delusions of grandeur. Yet, what choice do I have? I serve the Emperor.

Never did I expect to discover an undiscovered wilderness. How many hours of my youth did I spend gazing over the Jinhsa Jiang, hoping to see a destiny such as this in the rushing waters? But there is no time left for dreams. The lives of my crew depend on me.

I miss my home, the sight of the rain falling over the mountains, the peace of an evening's rest. I worry about the Admiral. Perhaps I misjudged him, for he is only a boy. At this moment he may be cowering in the jungle, wishing only to glimpse a friendly face.

The natives of this region wish to rise up and claimed our saltpeter sites, which we require for gunpowder. We must act, and act now.
That is all. The men are yours, Lieutenant.
We will not let the enemy have one handful of saltpeter, Sir. You have my word.
Establish a headquarters here. And hurry. The natives are eager to win back their homeland.
The natives rush to seize the Company's saltpeter route. We must stop their progress by destroying the trading posts.
This is no time for celebration, Lieutenant. There are two other trading posts that require your attention. Now get on with it!
The Sikhs have compromised our interests here. We must claim the sites to the east to reinvigorate the flow of saltpeter.
You should establish a field for grazing animals. I've seen such spaces work wonders for the natives in this region.
The Sikh stockades overflow with those too smart to participate in this insurrection. Free them, and put them to work.
Wonderful. Our interests in the Punjab have been maintained. You may make something of yourself after all, Lieutenant.
Just our luck, natives have settled on my saltpeter sites. No matter. Relocate them, Lieutenant.
Don't let these elephants startle you, Nanib. Aim for the eyes.
Our men are with you, Lieutenant Nanib, but our meager force is no match for the Company vanguard.
Then we must proceed carefully and avoid the patrols until we can find a way into the city. We must free the Shah.
A sudden noise might spook those elephants. If we are lucky, they will be our battering rams.
The freedom fighters have come. We are with you, Lieutenant!
Do you hear something? A rumble?
Look for more elephants. By harnessing their strength, we can break any wall that stands in our way.
You have freed us, stranger. We will repay you with our lives. Tell us what to do.
Many of the sepoys are siding with us. The more men we find or free, the stronger our rebellion will become.
The only way through that wall is to have an elephant knock it down for us. After that, we will march right in.
Shoot it! Shoot it! It's headed right for the gates!
This is a city, not a circus! Move more troops into the streets, and end this uprising.
India will be ruled by Indians!
We must act now, while the guards try to subdue that rampaging elephant. Free the Shah and set fire to the stockades.
Fighting between sepoys and the British has broken out inside the fort. We must get through the gates and turn the tide.
The Shah is free, and the citizens of Delhi are rising up against their oppressors.
Like the cowards that they are, the Company vanguard has retreated to the opposite side of the river. We must destroy them before they can regroup.
We must escort the Shah to greet his subjects. When the people see him, they will rise up with us, and fight.
The Shah is free, just as they said. Take back Delhi! Take back India!
The Company brings in ships to reinforce from the sea. We have to stop this before we are overrun.
The Company has weapons scattered across the city. If we wish to uproot the tree, we must dig up every poisonous root.
Let us see the Company shoot us without bullets, slay without swords.
Delhi is ours. This day will be remembered, for this is the day we set our nation free.

I will live again, if only as a butterfly.
My last thoughts are of compassion...and unbearable pain.
Defeat all of the Company soldiers in the town.

The Weapon Caches are connected to the Arsenals that lie above. Destroying them will cause a chain reaction that will bring the entire Fort crashing down around the British.
Destroy the Trading Posts on the saltpeter sites.
Edwardson's army needs to be drawn out and destroyed. Build up experience points by destroying Trading Posts and other Company buildings. When you earn enough XP, Edwardson will come after you.
Prepare your defenses and destroy Edwardson's incoming army.
Edwardson is sending out his army, and it is up to you to defend against his waves of troops. Each wave will feature different enemy units, so try to counter them with the best defenders.
Now that the Fort has been emptied of its wealth of defenders, it is time to strike. Fight through the multiple keeps to reach the Command Post in the Fort's heart.
One of the Fort's most powerful defenses is the pair of Fixed Guns mounted behind the eastern and western walls. If you capture these enormous weapons, you will be able to use them to your advantage.
Clear the Company's vital Trade Route.
Destroying Edwardson's Trading Posts will shatter his Trade Route and cut him off from his allies. When this is done, you can build your own Trade Route to gain additional resources.
Destroy the Company Docks in the northeast.
The Company keeps an active navy at its Docks in the northeast. Destroy the Docks before Edwardson sends his navy against you.
Not all of the Sepoys have rebelled. They need to be defeated along with the Company.

He was just a boy from Nagwa. It is said that before killing his commanding officer, he declared it was his Dharma to resist the British. He was a sepoy, like me. He worked for the Company, like me. He was also a hero, but I'm not a hero. It would do me good to stop listening to rumors.

The Company sends us to protect our interests in the Punjab. I feel the bitter gazes of the sepoys upon me, but collaboration is the only way to keep the peace. Today that sepoy who killed his commander was hanged. Heroes never live for long.

Once again, we emerge from battle victorious. The Company proves time and again that it is unstoppable. It does not give me confidence. On the contrary, every time I lift my sword I do not know whom to strike: my people, or my employer.

How much blood can stain one man's hands? There is nowhere to run as long as I wear this red coat. I am beginning to understand what that boy who was executed must have felt. When you have nowhere to run, you must create a new path.

It is a new morning. Men and women stream into the streets to join us, and every face is a joyous one. Is this what I have been fighting, what I have been hoping to stamp down into the dirt? No more. Today, I lead a new army - an Indian army.

Delhi has fallen, but the fires still burn, and they will keep burning. My brothers and I make for Shimla to lay our cause at the feet of Colonel Edwardson himself. I no longer fear the inevitable end, for the path leading me there is my own.
One minute until end of Cease Fire!

Rebels have plagued the Company around Calcutta. They have holed up in the villages like rats in a wall.
Find them, and teach them that strikes against the Company will not go unpunished.
We are under attack! The audacity of these vermin!
That will teach them to defy the Company!
You can take my last breath, but you will never take my country.
Good show, Nanib! Burn that bloody village to the ground.
We may fall, but others will fight on.
Take that, you fools! This is good shooting.
Visit the consulate. We will use established methods from the Empire to counter our enemy's trickery.
We have quelled the rebellion. But at what price?
These are dangerous lands. March east to the village across the river. The Company will direct us from there.
We have reached the safety of the village just in time.
Look at these villagers. My own people gaze on me with such distrust. I will never get used to it.
Units and Buildings give more bonus xp
That does not mean they will stop trying.
Kill the garrison commander before he can call for reinforcements!
We have defeated the Company garrison and seized the town. I never thought a victory was possible.
Our rebellion will not last long if we confront the Company fort directly. We must destroy its arsenals to disarm its men.
Fall back! Retreat! The gates are too well guarded.
Edwardson hopes to outlast us. He hides behind his walls and artillery.
Edwardson hopes to outlast us. He hides behind his walls and artillery.
He thinks reinforcements will come, but he is mistaken.
The Company still moves freely. Destroy the docks and make Edwardson's fort an island.
We need supplies desperately. Send men to raid the Company's stores to the west. Take back what is rightfully ours.
If we cannot reach Edwardson's heart, then we will cut away at his limbs. Attacking his trading posts will leave him helpless.
Edwardson mistakes cowardice for patience. We must do more than we anticipated to force his hand.
That does it! He is coming out! Prepare yourselves, men. This is no time for weakness.
Enemy soldiers charge our headquarters. The Company is as ruthless as ever.
Not even his precious Company could help Edwardson in the end. I fear this battle is the beginning of a long and costly war.
I will take that as a compliment.
Our private war has only just begun, Nanib. We will finish this on my terms.
Is that you, Nanib? Your men buzz around me like flies on a bull. I hardly feel a thing.
I have had enough of these annoyances, Nanib. I am going to reach out and smash you like an insect.
Did you honestly believe you could challenge the Company, Nanib? Must I remind you that we execute traitors?
I will accept your defeat any time you are ready. There is no hurry, however. I am thoroughly enjoying this.
Don't slink away now, Nanib. That was only a mere fraction of my forces.
You drive your men to suicide. They die for nothing.
How many of you must I kill before you realize the futility of your actions?
No. I will not die at the feet of a traitor.
Look! Other sepoys have joined us! Fight, brothers, fight for your freedom!
Listen, Nanib. The Company has a mining operation to the east, with access to the fort.
Instead of marching through the front, we will slip in through the back.
Look! The Company thought its gunpowder would be safe underground. One spark and the whole fort will go up in flames.
It worked, the fire is spreading.
We have taught the Company a grave lesson today. One it will not soon forget.
If all goes as planned, that fort will become his tomb.
These soldiers fight with our enemy. The time for negotiations has passed. Death to collaborators!
Colonel Edwardson's doom is a foregone conclusion. Send us a wagon of gold, and we will help you throw the Company into the sea.
I foresee a long and fruitful relationship between your people and mine, Lieutenant.
We fight with you, Nanib! It is time for the Company to take our orders!
A flying kick that can be used to disable guardians or enemy military units.
An explosive attack that does heavy damage to buildings and ships.
We cannot let the rebels gain the upper hand. Protect the Company establishment at all costs.
The rebels see the Company's local headquarters as a symbol of British tyranny, and they will stop at nothing to burn it to the ground. You must not let this happen.
Destroy the native Trade Route and secure the region's saltpeter.
Protect the Company's Command Post and destroy the resistance.
Resist your oppressors, and then fight to sabotage their Arsenal.
Rescue the Shah and lead him to freedom.
End Edwardson's reign of terror by destroying his Command Post.
Our headquarters is under attack! Fight on! We can never give up!

That does not mean they will stop trying.
"This is not our war, but if you build a Trading Post here perhaps we can work together."
Outlaw-type units (Wildwest, Wokou, Maratha, etc) are recruited much faster and gain more attack and hitpoints with each Age-up.
The Chinese are mighty and should be respected.
My heart trembles. When the Chinese army marches, every heart trembles.
The Japanese are mighty and should be respected.
Never have I seen a people as graceful at killing as the Japanese. Tread cautiously.
The traitorous Indians are mighty and should be respected.
I know my own people, and they will never stop fighting until they have reached their objective.
Destroy the Weapon Caches to cause an elephant stampede.
Attacking the Weapon Caches will cause an impressive explosion, and most likely spook the nearby elephants. The walls of Delhi cannot stand up against the force of a rampaging herd.
Raze the Agra Fort Wonder to free the Shah.
The Shah is being held captive by the Company. Destroy the Agra Fort overlooking the Shah's prison yard and you will win his freedom.
Safely escort the Shah out of the city.
Move the Shah through the city and help him to escape. You must protect him. If he falls in combat, your mission has failed.
Free imprisoned Sepoys from the Stockades.

The Sepoys of Delhi have risen up against their Company commanders. As a result, they have been thrown into prison and are awaiting execution. Rescue these soldiers to make your army a force to be reckoned with.
Inspire the citizens of Delhi by moving the Shah to each flagged area.
Bring the Shah to the flagged areas to inspire the citizens of the city and convince them to join your army. This is the only way to receive reinforcements.

To reach Edwardson we will need to cease the fire of his great cannon. Focus your attacks on the eastern and western walls.
The mills in the west are Edwardson's most precious resource. If we burn them down, he will starve behind the safety of his walls.
So, the traitors have rediscovered their hearts and returned to their people.
Your people and ours will fight side by side. Use our fire to leave the enemy in ruins.
