Their assault stalled after the victory at Monte de las Cruces, however. For reasons unknown, the commanders decided to march north to take Guadalajara rather than besiege Mexico City. The soldiers contested this decision, resulting in mass desertions until only a token force remained.

The Spanish followed the revolutionary army to Calderón Bridge, where the professional Spanish soldiers defeated the undisciplined and poorly-equipped remnants of the rebel militia. Not long afterwards, many of its leaders – the old, charismatic priest among them – were captured and executed.

The priest's actions left a remarkable imprint in the hearts of the citizens of New Spain. His legacy continued to stir up resistance against the Spanish until Mexico finally became an independent nation.

At the beginning of the War of 1812, the Americans launched an invasion across the Niagara River into British Canada. To halt this offensive and defend Canada, the British called upon the militias of York and Lincoln as well as their Mohawk, Lenape, and Haudenosaunee allies.

In a courageous and valiant effort, British General Isaac Brock led his troops to prevent the Americans from crossing the Niagara. However, after he was shot by an American sharpshooter and the Americans took the high ground, the British lines started to collapse and defeat seemed imminent.

Despite numerical disadvantages and failing morale, the Canadian militias and their Native American allies stood their ground against the onrushing Americans. The Mohawk, Lenape, and Haudenosaunee warriors played a vital role, bravely repulsing the American attacks and frightening incoming reinforcements with their infamous war cries.

Brock's death prevented the British from capitalizing on the momentum gained from this triumph, but the outcome was still significant. The Canadians had entered the war with doubt and little experience, but the victory at Queenston Heights strengthened their resolve and ignited a sense of Canadian nationalism.
We are in quite the predicament, Brother. The Spanish are at our throats!

Do not worry, Hizir. The Spanish may have surrounded the city, but I have a plan! I have sent men to the Ottoman sultan to ask for help. Inshallah, the sultan will send an army. We must hold on until that help arrives!
The Spanish have constructed siege camps outside of the city gates! As long as they stand, we cannot venture out into the countryside.
We lack the men to go on the offensive, but with Ottoman help we can destroy the four Spanish forts around the city, forcing them to abandon the siege!
Brother! Word comes from the Ottoman Sultan. He is eager to help, but fears that our cause is doomed. Prove to him that the city's defense is not hopeless, and he will send his army and fleet!
The Spanish have occupied all of the farmland around the city. We should retake it to feed the population of Algiers!
A large silver mine lies to the north. If we retake it, we can extract much coin from it!
The Spanish are using the local trade route to supply their forces. We should destroy their Trading Posts and use the trade route to supply our men instead!
As long as the Spanish blockade the harbor, we will be unable to receive shipments from our pirate base in Cherchell!
The seas are ours again! Now our corsair brethren in Cherchell can send us shipments of goods and reinforcements!
The Spanish have stored large amounts of gunpowder close to the city. Let us blast them to pieces and deprive the Spanish of their firepower!
Selamun aleykum, brothers! Our sultan is a man of his word and sends us to fight by your side. Let us drive these cursed infidels out of Algeria!
The first Spanish fort lies in ruins! Only three more stand!
A second Spanish fort has fallen into our hands! We are halfway there!
That makes three forts, Hizir. Push on, my Barbary brethren! We are almost there!
The last Spanish fort is in our grasp! With Algiers secure, now we can continue our raids on the European coasts with impunity. No town or village will be too small to raid!
This city belongs to the Spanish crown!
Haha excellent! We will see how long these Spanish forts will last without gunpowder!
Why not go back to your peaceful lives as goat herders? The life of a sea dog yields only a gruesome demise.
There is no honor in being a pirate! Give up now, and we may spare some of you.
Burn the camp to the ground! We will drive these Spanish besiegers from Algiers!
Defend Algiers and crush the Spanish invaders.
Do not lose your Town Center.
Do not allow the Spanish to destroy your Town Center. You will lose if they do.
Destroy the three Spanish camps surrounding Algiers.
The Spanish camps form a stranglehold around Algiers, preventing you from gaining access to the resources outside of the city walls.
The Spanish command a powerful position from four nearby forts. Only destroying them will dislodge the besiegers.
Earn 15,000 XP to obtain Ottoman help.
The Ottomans will send you reinforcements if you can accumulate a total of 15,000 Experience Points.
The production from the additional Mills and Estates will allow you to feed your population and train more soldiers.
The silver mine can provide you with additional coin revenue.
The local trade route provides the Spanish forts with critical supplies. Seize it, and it will supply Algiers instead.
Destroy the blockade (Reward: Home City access).
The Spanish naval blockade prevents you from using your Home City. Destroy the blockade to regain access to it.
Without their Weapon Caches, the Spanish will be unable to equip as many cannons as they could before.
Tatars are everywhere! Do not disembark here. We must sail on!
The Watch tower on that island will fill us full of holes if we do not move fast. Hold your fire and rush past it!
We cannot continue by boat! Rugged rocks block the river! We will have to disembark here and continue on foot!
The Tatars set fire to our home village and drove us out! We will help you set up a camp—just avenge our fallen brothers and sisters, Yermak!
The Tatars raid Russian villages. If you men want warm fire and hot food in your bellies, come and burn the Tatar camps and their cursed fortress!
Argh! Vot blin! We were not fast enough. The Tatars burned the village. If you want hot food, the only place you will find it is in the Tatar camp. Onwards, Cossacks! We come for dinner!
I had begun to worry that I had recruited some weak farm boys crying for their babushkas—but you men are strong Russians, indeed! The Tatar camp lies in ruins!
We need your help immediately! The Tatars are besieging our settlement!
Help! The Tatars are attacking our settlement!
These Tatar attacks on Russian homes will not end until we burn their camp to the ground!
The Tatar fortress is formidable, da, but do not be disheartened, men! Fight well, and tonight you will sing songs in the hall of the Tatar khan!
The Tatar fortress lies in ruins! We have conquered Siberia for Mother Russia!
Bread and wood for our protectors!
Find a safe location to unload your boats.
You will only be able to establish a camp if you can find a suitable spot out of sight of the Tatars.
Travel towards the safe location marked on the map.
Unnoticed by the Tatars for now, this location is the only safe place for you to build a camp.
Build a Town Center to establish your camp.
Use the Covered Wagon to quickly construct a Town Center and start building your camp.
Destroy the Tatar fortress of Qashliq.
Without their fortress, the Tatars will no longer be able to control the region.
Protect the Russian village to the north.
The allied village will provide you with resources, making it easier for you to train and equip additional soldiers.
Destroy the Tatar camp to end their raids.
Destroy the Tatar field camp so that you can concentrate on besieging Qashliq.
Lads, we come here to raid these Spanish devils and plunder their riches for our beloved England and our Good Queen Bess!
El Draque, I presume? Leave these Spanish waters or we will blow your ships to the bottom of the sea! Already, my king prepares an armada to take your little island!
Get aboard, privateers! There are many spoils for us to take!
You hate the Spanish? Aye, you have found good company in us!
Hoy! Come along with us and we shall part the Spanish devils from their bloody doubloons!
We rob and pillage the Spanish of their ill-gotten gains for Queen and Country! Join us, eh?
I care not for your crimes committed against the hated Spanish. You fight hard and Her Majesty's fleet will gladly have you!
An Englishman cavorting with pirates and heathens. How typical...
Spanish treasure galleon sighted! Brimmin' with gold!
Ransack the colony! Check the officers' quarters for the soldiers' pay!
¡Dios mío! Stop El Draque before he ruins our colonies!
Open every chest and overturn every bed, lads! We will find the Spanish gold!
Spaniards, do not make a fool of me before the king! Stop El Draque or I will put you all on half rations!
These Spanish are no match for us Englishmen! Let us return to dear old England with stories to make the lads jealous and many doubloons in our pockets!
Word of our exploits has reached Plymouth! Her Majesty sends more men eager for adventure!
Slow down, boys! That Spanish cannon will blast our ships into a thousand little splinters. We must find another way into the colony!
Excellent! That Spanish coastal gun will give us no more trouble.
Destroy 5 Spanish colonies in the Caribbean by killing the soldiers defending them.
Use the resources gained from destroying colonies to train units at your Galleon.
Capture the moored Spanish Treasure Ship.
A Spanish Treasure Ship can be captured for additional gold income.
Find English Pirates to join Drake's expedition.
You will encounter friendly pirates if you explore the islands and coasts.
The Spanish colony of Cartagena is protected by a large coastal gun. You should disable it before it can sink any of your ships.
The British control the river fork with this little fort that they call "Fort Prince George." When we conquer it, we will be able to protect New France from these encroaching British colonials!

The British forces are too many to be defeated without the help of allies. Our scouts report that the British oppress three local native settlements. If we drive out the occupiers, the natives will surely join us!
Sacre bleu! We should not be marching towards the British camps! We have a fort to conquer first!
I have spoken to the Seneca chief and he will fight alongside his French brothers. He hopes that the French tribe will not forget his people's friendship.

The Lenni Lenape chief says that no man can claim ownership of the lands granted by the Creator. He says that he will resist the British because they are hungry for the land that belongs to the wolf and the turtle.
My Shawnee brothers and sisters are much too proud to bow to the British. Their chief says that just as day and night cannot live together, they cannot live with the British.
The fort now belongs to New France, but George Washington and his dirty colonials will not wait long to challenge us! We will show les rosbifs our French courage!
The British are using boats to land soldiers behind our fort! Vite! Push them back into the river!
Another British landing party! Do not let them destroy our town!
We have held the British at bay thus far, but now they are sending their main force! To the ramparts! Protect the fort! Vive la France! Vive le Roi!
Your Seneca allies have been defeated by the British. Their chief expresses hope that one day there will be a lasting peace between the French and British peoples.
The Lenni Lenape chief says that the losses of his men are too great. Fathers, brothers, and sons are needed for the harvests or his people will wither like flowers cut from the Earth Mother.
My Shawnee brothers fought bravely, but the British were stronger. Their chief says that the natives of this land must learn to unite if they are to drive the British from here.
The redcoats are running! They are no match for the French spirit...but I fear that they will return again.
Seize the British fort and defend it.
Capture the British fort by defeating the garrison defending it.
Use cannons to blast your way into the fort and kill the British Garrison.
Defend the fortress against the British.
You will lose if the British manage to destroy the fort's Command Post. Victory will be achieved If you can defend it until the enemy runs out of supplies and reinforcements.
Liberate the Seneca from the British occupying forces.
The Seneca will aid you if you free them from the British.
Liberate the Lenni Lenape from the British occupying forces.
The Lenni Lenape will aid you if you free them from the British.
Liberate the Shawnee from the British occupying forces.
The Shawnee will aid you if you free them from the British.
The Seneca will supplement your forces with Tomahawks and Kanya Horsemen.
The Lenni Lenape will supplement your forces with Aennas and Forest Prowlers.
The Shawnee will supplement your forces with Musket Riders and Warriors.
Time left to defend the fort
General, militia from Louisiana, Tennessee, Kentucky, and Mississippi report for duty! The men are ready for inspection.
Quick! Let me in! I bring news and demand to see the general!
General! The British are preparing for battle! They will soon launch their attack!
Then we will give 'em an explosive American reception! Lieutenant, form up the men and unlimber the cannons! Let's get to it, boys!
One hand washes the other, Monsieur. If you help me build a Trading Post for my... "business ventures," I will help you get supplies past the British, mon ami.
I don't cotton to makin' friends with pirates and scoundrels like this Lafitte. But if we're to hold the line against these British, I'm not one to be picky.
A promise is a promise, Général. My... "business associates" will help you, but don't forget our friendship, mon ami! I look forward to having such an influential friend in the American government.
The Choctaw Nation does not bow to the British. We will fight alongside the Americans, General, but we need muskets!

General, we can produce a Black Powder Wagon at our Town Center ourselves, but it is costly. Another option is to retrieve a Black Powder Wagon left on the battlefield, but the area is crawling with redcoats.
We gave the Choctaw the muskets and boy were they pleased! They had me grinnin' like a possum eatin' a sweet 'tater! I think we'll be all right with them fightin' alongside us!
The enemy has destroyed a cart with muskets collected for the Choctaw! All that work won't amount to a hill of beans now! We'll have to try again!
We have lost too many of our warriors! The Choctaw can no longer participate in this fight.
General! The British are comin'! I hope we're ready or we'll be hanging on like a hair in a biscuit!
The British have seized the artillery position on the other side of the Mississippi. They will be sailing their war vessels up the river at any moment. I need men now to go and retake that position!
The artillery position is now operational. When the British ships arrive, we will show them some American fireworks!
The British ships have been spotted entering the Mississippi Delta! Get goin', men! Secure that fixed gun position or their ships will sail through with impunity!
The British war boats have been spotted in the Mississippi Delta! They will be here soon! Get that cannon ready!
The British are sendin' their war boats! Use our fixed gun position to blast them before they reach New Orleans!

We've failed to repair the artillery position and the British ships are now on their way to New Orleans! Get off your backsides and protect the city! You will have to use your muskets now that we don't have that fixed gun to help us.
Hold the line, men! The British don't have as much fight in them as we do! Hold on a little longer and they're sure to break!
The British are awfully near to New Orleans and we're moving slower than molasses in winter! Let's get going before they take the city and we lose this battle!
We’ve got the British runnin' scared! Keep after them, men! Let's go to their camps and show 'em a little American spirit!
The British are in New Orleans! How could we allow this to happen?
Huzzay! New Orleans is saved and we’ve taught these British a lesson in American gumption!
Drive off the British marching on New Orleans.
Prepare the defense of New Orleans.
Use the time left until the British attack to fortify your camp and find yourself some allies.
Fend off the British until their supplies run out.
The British must not reach New Orleans.
Not a single British soldier must reach the outskirts of New Orleans.
To achieve victory, defeat the British by destroying their camp.
Build a Trading Post in Jean Lafitte's camp (Reward: three free shipments).
If you earn Jean Lafitte's support, he will provide you with some free shipments and you will be able to train mercenaries at his Saloon.
Arm the Choctaw with gunpowder weaponry by bringing one Black Powder Wagon to their settlement.
If you supply the Choctaw with gunpowder, they will train warriors to assist you.
Eliminate the enemy troops guarding the broken Fixed Gun on the Mississippi riverbank.
If you manage to capture and fix the destroyed artillery piece in time, you will be able to fend off the British warships.
Time left until the first British attack
The enemy are too many! Fall back to the Ethiopians or we will be captured and tortured like da Gama!
Why do you run? The Adal Sultanate is that way. Now, where is your captain, Christopher da Gama? I will address your cowardice with him personally!
Your majesty, our captain has been murdered by the Adal warlord Ahmed Gragn. We came to join you so that we can recover da Gama's body and have our vengeance on his murderer.
Then you will listen to my commands. Liberate the highland villages. Tell the people that their emperor lives and you will strengthen my armies as they push through the valleys.
You may use my town to receive reinforcements from Portugal. If my son and I are to defeat Ahmed Gragn, we will need more than a few cowardly Portuguese who let their captain be murdered.
The Viceroy of India sends reinforcements. He demands that we bring the head of Gragn as payment for his brother's death.
My armies will be attacking in the direction of the Adal camp. Travel to the villages so that more warriors join our forces!
Attack, my warriors! Reclaim the land that is rightfully yours!
Portuguese! The enemy is in our camp! Come quickly!
My dear children, these Portuguese have swept the Adal forces from your village. Join the imperial armies to free all of our lands from the invaders!
You Portuguese are like flies on a buffalo's back. Know this: your captain did not die well. Surrender now, or you can expect the same fate.
Children of Ethiopia, your emperor is descended from King Solomon. Show that we are worthy of our ancestors!
Rise, Ethiopians! Throw the foreign invaders from our borders!
These villages mean nothing to me. I will turn Ethiopia into a wasteland before I suffer a defeat.
The great Emperor Galawdewos, my son, has returned to command our armies. Adal will be no match for his skill in battle!
We have nearly driven the Adal armies from our lands. Push into their camp and we will free our people!

Portuguese, you have done your duty to your slain captain. Return to Portugal and tell your king that Ethiopia appreciates good and loyal friends…but let him know how hard we fight to defend our lands.
Help the Ethiopians defeat the Adal Sultanate.
Escape the Adal forces and reach the Ethiopians.
Christopher da Gama is dead and so you must flee to safety. Try to avoid fighting the Adal soldiers until your men are safe.
Help the Ethiopians defeat the Adal Sultanate.
The Ethiopians and Adal are constantly fighting each other in the valleys. Support the Ethiopians and help them gain the upper hand over their enemies.
You will lose if the Ethiopian town is destroyed, so be sure to keep some soldiers in reserve near your allies in case things start to look bad.
Drive the Adal forces from the Ethiopian villages to strengthen the Ethiopian army.
The villages will send some warriors to attack the Adal and place others under your command as well.
You have been banned from sending messages.
You have been blocked from sending messages.
Your account is unable to send text chat.
You are already a member of a this chat
The Hausa nobles have forgotten our traditions! They live decadent lives of greed and unjustly banish whoever dares to criticize them. I refuse to let this go on!
We will be at your side whatever happens, dan Fodio – but what do you suggest that we do?

I say this, my friends – the whipped and banished shall rally and pry this land from their greedy hands. We are not alone, for the Fulani on this side of the river loathe the Hausa. They will help us in our uprising!
We will join you in your battle, Usman dan Fodio, commander of the faithful.
Hausa soldiers have come to raid our settlements! Our archers can protect us for now, but it will not be long before the city-states attack us in greater numbers. We must be prepared to face them.
Gobir, Katsina and Kano have unified to fight us. We must defeat all three cities to claim victory. Each one will surrender to us if we destroy their town center.
We must build a university in order to properly educate our people. Doing so will also increase our influence.
Mistreated peasants work the fields outside of the city walls. If we were to free them from their bonds, they would be willing to take up arms with us.
Peasants that we free will split up to join both Usman and our Fula allies.
We have freed more workers from the Hausa!
Come, brothers and sisters. Rise up against our oppressors!
Another group of workers has been set free!
We have freed all of the workers!
We have done it! The other city-states will learn of our victory and lay down their weapons. No longer shall we be subject to ruthless kings and queens!
Only through manual labor will we keep our cause strong. When we are not fighting, we can chop wood from trees.
Destroy the Town Centers of Gobir, Katsina and Kano.
The enemy city-states have allied together to defeat you. Destroying each one's Town Center will cause that enemy to surrender.

The University is a Fortress Age building that provides a greater trickle of influence and can be used to research powerful improvements. This objective will be completed if either player builds a University.

The Hausa nobles force peasants outside of Gobir to work for them. Each group is guarded by a small cohort of warriors. When freed, they will provide both players with villagers and grant a small amount of influence.
The warlords fight over the remains of Ethiopia like Simien jackals fight over a carcass. Yet the people suffer and starve! Kassa, please help us lest we perish!
I cannot bear to watch my people suffer. I will restore to the people their rightful possessions and end the reign of the corrupt warlords who devastate this land to line their own pockets!
We can boost our economy by capturing livestock from our enemies. The livestock can be used to feed our armies or sold at the livestock market for wood or coin.
Well done, people of Ethiopia! Now on to the next granaries!
The warlord of Shewa is still hoarding supplies. Let us relieve him of this burden.
The enemy is upon us! Get back to the villages!
Kassa! We will follow you to the end!
Look out! A battle rages ahead! We should sneak past if we are to live to see another day.
Our faith compels us to side with the poor and defenseless. If you walk this path as well, we will help you.
You are a virtuous man, Kassa. Our monastery is yours.
I had a dream where a light shone through the dark clouds upon the highlands of Ethiopia. Perhaps it was a prophecy of your coming?
You have the support of the Oromo people, Kassa.
The Oromo will join a righteous cause.
You should be our emperor, Kassa, not these vile warlords. Allow us to build you a palace so that you can claim what is yours!
We have had enough of these Shifta—bandits looting our goods! Let us bury the hatchet, my brothers, and get rid of this pest!
No, not my palace! Who is this nobody to take away my fortune!
The warlord of Gojjam will no longer terrorize these lands!
People of Shewa! Your lord is no more! Join me!
All of the provinces have been united once more. A new age dawns on Ethiopia!
Hold up! We will be crushed if we attack the cities with our current force!
Reunite Ethiopia by helping its people and defeating all of the enemy warlords.
The inhabitants of this Ethiopian village may be able to help you.
Destroy the stockpiles (Granaries) of each warlord.
Your force is too small to face any of the enemy armies, so you should sneak behind the enemy lines and loot the stockpiles as quickly as possible.
The warlords have joined together. They are too mighty for you to face alone, so you should retreat and seek refuge.
Tigray (Red) will surrender if you destroy their Palace.
Gojjam (Yellow) will surrender if you destroy their Palace.
Shewa (Purple) will surrender if you destroy their Palace.
Defeat the Tigrayan forces guarding the livestock and Livestock Market between you and your ally to capture them.
Livestock are a crucial asset for African civilizations. They generate influence and can be sold for wood or coin.
With the support of the clergy, you will earn additional gold and experience points.
Building a Palace will give you access to new technologies and units.
Look at that, Youssef! The Portuguese have transported their army over from Iberia and are preparing to march south!
We have been spotted! Let us ride quickly to warn the sultan of the imminent danger!
Our esteemed Sultan! King Sebastian and his army have arrived. They will be here soon!
We will be ready for them! Tell my brother to alert the tribes.
Your brother calls upon you, Ahmad al-Mansur. You must lead the mounted forces of Morocco against these invaders!
Brothers, join me so that we can push these crusaders out of our lands!
I call on the faithful. Help me fight the invaders!
Mount your horses, tribesmen. Morocco needs you!
Sidi! It is your brother! He has fallen ill and might not live out the day!
Do not tell a soul of this! If the soldiers hear this news, they might lose heart and flee. I will lead our army and drive out King Sebastian and his crusaders myself.
This is the last of the tribes. Our cavalry will ride down the Portuguese invaders!
Brother, I need your aid! The Portuguese are in my camp!
Sidi, the Portuguese are stockpiling loot from their raids in outposts throughout the region. We should take back what is ours!
We have reclaimed what the Portuguese stole from us!
King Sebastian uses these coastal towns to supply his army. Seize the ports so that they can no longer send supplies from Iberia!
Another port has fallen to our armies. Inshallah, Sebastian will have nothing left to feed his army.
This is the last port. Attack the enemy now that they are weak!
Sebastian is using a puppet sultan to justify his war. If we capture him, the Portuguese will lose support among the local inhabitants.
Please do not hurt me! All I ever wanted was to regain my throne! I will share all of the information that I have if you spare me!
The Portuguese army has been crushed and their king lies dead on the field of battle. We are victorious!
If the Portuguese destroy the town center of the Moroccan army camp, all will be lost!
The Saadis are attacking my city! Protect me, Portuguese soldiers!
The Portuguese guard this pass well. We should seek out another route.
The Battle of the Three Kings
Repel the Portuguese invasion of Morocco and kill King Sebastian.
Convince four of the tribes to join the fight.
Many local tribes are eager to cast out the invaders, but they will need your guidance. Defeat the Portuguese soldiers occupying their lands.
Defend Sultan al-Malik's camp. You will lose if his Town Center is destroyed.
Your brother leads the main Moroccan army. Ensure that he is not defeated, or you will lose the battle.
Defend your camp. You will lose if your Town Center is destroyed.
Your brother is dying, but all is not lost. Ensure that your Town Center is not destroyed, and you might still win the battle.

The Portuguese army is strong. Focus on doing side quests before facing them head on. To access the city occupied by the Portuguese you will need to capture the puppet sultan for the local Moroccans to open the main gates, or try to arrive by sea.
Capture coastal towns to cut off the Portuguese supplies.
The Portuguese are receiving shipments from their homeland through the Moroccan ports that they have conquered.
Destroy Outposts to recapture Moroccan loot.
The Portuguese army has looted the region to supply their army. You can weaken the enemy army by retaking their loot.
The Portuguese use a puppet sultan to justify their invasion of Morocco. Capturing him will invalidate his claim to the throne and force him to divulge information about his Iberian allies.
The Battle of the Three Kings (1578)
The United States cannot allow its mighty vessels to be captured by filthy pirates! The low tide prevents us from sailing the USS Philadelphia out of the harbor, so our only option is to destroy it!
To enter the harbor unnoticed, we need a corsair ship that flies the Tripoli colors. Our scouts say that one will sail past us soon. We must capture it!
Hurry! Soon the corsair ship will be beyond our grasp!
Our failure to capture the ship in time has alerted Tripoli to our presence. Abort the mission!
Well done, Marines! Now, capture the harbor entrance!
To keep the enemy unaware of our presence, our larger warships must avoid the harbor. We can still use our frigates to build more rowboats and recruit more volunteers, however.
Now we can sail into the harbor with the rowboats and the captured corsair ship – but we must be stealthy lest the enemy detect us. This day shall belong to us, US Marines!
Steer away from those outposts! They can discover our stealth units!
Darn it! The pirates spotted us!
Prepare the gunpowder to blow up the USS Philadelphia! The pirates will soon be upon us from all directions, so defend our position at all costs!
Al'amrikiuwn are trying to take back the frigate! Sound the alarm!
Sharpen your scimitars! Load the cannons! No Amrikiin shall leave this harbor alive!
No! Do not allow these Yanks to escape! Yalla! Stop them, you lazy bums!
That fixed gun will turn our boats into bonfires. We must find a way to capture it!
Use the fixed gun to destroy the passage so that our rowboats can pass through!
The Barbary corsairs moor their raiding fleet here in the harbor. Destroying it would stall their operations!
The pirates hold the crew of the USS Philadelphia in stockades within the city. We will leave no Americans behind!
You Marines are a sight for sore eyes!
We never thought that we would make it out of here alive!
We will show these pirates the might of the United States!
Take up arms, crewmen of the USS Philadelphia! That frigate will not remain in pirate hands!
The USS Philadelphia has been destroyed! Escape this hellhole now before we are overrun by pirates!
One of our frigates was destroyed! We must return home burdened with the shame of failure.
The captured corsair ship has sunk. We can no longer complete our mission!
Watch out! One of our frigates is about to be sunk!
Rally, men! The captured corsair ship is almost destroyed! If we lose it, we will not be able to blow up the USS Philadelphia!
The Burning of the USS Philadelphia
Capture the corsair ship Mastico by destroying its escort.
The Mastico participated in the capture of the USS Philadelphia. Seizing it is the only way to infiltrate the corsair harbor.
Seize the Outpost at the entrance to the harbor by killing all of its guards.
Capturing the Outpost will allow you to take control of the harbor entrance.
Bring the Captured Corsair Ship to the USS Philadelphia and kill its guards.
Use the abilities of the captured corsair ship and your Rowboats to reach the USS Philadelphia unnoticed. Your ships' stealth ability has a limited duration, so time your actions well.
Defend the Captured Corsair Ship while the USS Philadelphia is loaded with explosives.
Preparing the detonation of the ship will take time. Be sure to send in additional reinforcements.
The Captured Corsair Ship must reach your Frigates at the entrance to the harbor.
The USS Philadelphia is gone! Now escape!
The Captured Corsair Ship must not be destroyed.
All of your warships are essential. Losing any will result in defeat.
Capture the Fixed Gun to open a swifter route to the USS Philadelphia.
The Fixed Gun is a danger to your ships. Capturing it will allow you to destroy the barrier that blocks a swifter route to the USS Philadelphia.
Destroy the docked Barbary fleet to the East.
Destroying their raiding fleet will deal the pirates a severe setback.
Rescue the crew of the USS Philadelphia.
The crew of the USS Philadelphia are held prisoner in Stockades all over Tripoli. Rescue them so that they can join the fight.
The Burning of the USS Philadelphia (1803)
My children… the Spanish have treated us unjustly, and govern our very lives. We must act at once. To defend our rights, we must oust the Spanish from our lands!
Take up arms! We will bring death to our enemies.
Men of your vigor are just what we need! Lead your people to free the towns north of the Laja River, and I shall free those to the south.
The people of this town know how to handle rifles, but we will need more than just foot soldiers to drive out the Spanish.
There are ranches further downriver that keep horses, and beyond are artillery foundries. We will need these to assault the Spanish base in the mountains.
Thank you! With the Spanish gone, we may once again farm freely.
We are free of the Spanish here. We will join this revolution!
The fires of revolution will burn the Spanish to ash!
The Spanish do not stand a chance!
The Spanish force us to buy grapes and olives from their food stores instead of letting us grow them ourselves. Those stores are nearby. We should take whatever food they keep there for ourselves.
All of the people in this region support us! Now it is time to take the fight to the Spanish in the mountains.
These Spanish are defeated. What do you say – shall we move on to Mexico City?
Rally the people of Mexico and revolt against the Spanish government.
Liberate a town to gain control of its buildings.

The revolutionary armies are separated, but each is strong enough to liberate the towns closest to them. All towns north of the river will side with the northern army upon being liberated, while all towns south of the river will join the southern army.
Liberate all other towns in the region.

Liberating a town will unlock new units such as cavalry and artillery. Remember: towns north of the river will side with the northern army, while the towns south will join the southern army. upon being liberated. Both of your forces may cross the river to support each other.
Destroy both Spanish bases in the southeast mountains.
The Spanish army is well entrenched in the mountains. You will need to capture all local towns and train artillery if you are to besiege both of their main camps.
The Spanish keep large stashes of food on each side of the river. Both must be raided in order to complete this objective.
The Americans are crossing the Niagara River! Sound the alarm and alert Major General Brock!
Push on, brave York volunteers! We will not let these Yanks take Canada!
The Americans have shot General Brock! Fall back! Fall back, I tell you!
The Redcoats may have fled, but this fight is not yet over! Together with our fierce Haudenosaunee allies, we will show our enemies true valor!
The Lenape are willing to join the battle if we build a trading post in their settlement.
We send you our bravest warriors. The Americans will learn to fear our war cries!
Let us help you expel these American attackers!
We should retake Queenston Heights, my friend. The terrain is treacherous, but offers great strategic value against the Americans.
We have expelled the Americans from Queenston Heights. We should use the cover of nature to surprise the remaining Americans in Queenston!
These Yanks have us surrounded from all sides, but do not despair! Our allies will not leave us here to die!
We were wrong to think that the battle was over! Charge the Yank lines, for king and country!
The Americans are ferrying troops across the river to outflank us. Quick, construct some defenses to repel their boats!
Drive the American forces out of Queenston.
The Americans are trying to seize Queenston from the British. Send the British aid to prevent this from happening.
Defeat the Americans to retake Queenston.
The Americans have entrenched themselves in Queenston. Drive them out before they grow powerful enough to seize Canada.
Build a Trading Post in the Lenape settlement.
The Lenape are allies of the British and will provide you with powerful units if convinced to join the fight.
The Americans have taken the strategically important outpost at Queenston Heights. Retaking it could turn the tide of the battle.
Build two Outposts in the flagged areas near the riverbank.
The Americans are using boats to cross the Niagara River. Build two Outposts in the flagged areas to prevent further crossings.
Reach the trapped British regulars before they are overrun.
The Americans have trapped retreating British regulars. Free them so that they can rejoin the battle.
The Spanish naval blockade prevents the Barbary Pirates from using their Home City. Destroy the blockade to regain access to it.
Do not lose the Town Center in Algiers.
Defeat the Tatar river guards that are attacking the Russian village.
Yermak can quickly produce an army strong enough to come to the village's aid, but keep an eye out for Tatar patrols.
Capture the moored Spanish Treasure Ships.
The Spanish Treasure Ships can be captured for additional gold income.
Use Cannons to blast your way into the fort and kill the British garrison. Remember to protect your soldiers from enemy musket fire with Haudenosaunee Mantlets.
The Seneca will join the Haudenosaunee War Party if you free them from the British.
The Lenni Lenape will join the Haudenosaunee War Party if you free them from the British.
The Shawnee will join the Haudenosaunee War Party if you free them from the British.
%ls = Golden Pavilion increasing attack of ranged units
%ls = Golden Pavilion increasing attack of hand units
%ls = Golden Pavilion increasing hitpoints of military units
%ls = Golden Pavilion increasing speed of military units
Spreading like wildfire until they covered the land.
After the war my father went home, he would never be a wealthy man for he'd spend a considerable inheritance outfitting his militia volunteers and supplying the troops at Valley Forge.
He was a patriot, a good father and one of the best my family ever produced.
If Nathaniel had a flaw it was that his legacy was a difficult one to live up to.
Especially his grandson, my only child Chayton Black.
Whatever the truth, in the end he made the choice he had to make. Whether he made the right choice...well history will be the judge of that.
Dock warship improvements cost and research time significantly reduced.
Find House, Longhouse, Teepee, Shrine, Village or Torp
Find Mill, Farm, Rice Paddy, Field or Hacienda
Find Church, Mosque, Community Plaza, Monastery, Mountain Monastery or University
Find Barracks, Blockhouse, War Hut, War Academy, War Camp or Hospital
Find Stables, Corral, Nobles Hut, Caravanserai, Kallanka or Commandery
Find Artillery Foundry, Siege Workshop or Castle

Settlers gather more quickly instead of becoming Revolutionaries and can garrison in Trek Wagons for transport and protection. Houses become Trek Wagons.
Enables Huguenots (Coureur des Bois) to be trained from Town Centers. Permits you to train 30 Coureurs in addition to the usual Villager build limit.
Ships 1 Prospector Wagon looking for a Diamond Mine.
All Settlers and Wagons move faster and all units have more hitpoints.
Delivers 900 Food, 3 Cows, 3 Goats, 3 Sheep and 1 Homestead Wagon.
Can be garrisoned by Villagers for transport and protection. Becomes faster and stronger the more units are garrisoned.
Voluntarios da Patria rally to your cause! \n\nWeaker, but more numerous revolutionaries that are produced for free from Town Centers.
Delivers %1!d! %2!s! for each %3!s! present on the map.
Revolutionaries have less hitpoints, but are cheaper and get more range.\n\nTown Centers and Taverns spawn pirates for free. Privateers can be hired at Docks.
A dangerous outlaw on horseback armed with a rifle. Effective against Heavy Cavalry and Heavy Infantry.
Ships 8 semi-fattened Cows, 1 Jagunço and 1 Homestead Wagon
Ships 7 dangerous Grizzly Bears. O Canada!
10 Jagunços and 10 Cows. Allows recruitment of Jagunços at Taverns, Stables, Forts and Galleons.
Enables Citizens at the Town Center and grants a steady trickle of Coin.
Dragoons upgrade to Independence Dragoons who have a powerful lance attack at close range.
Ships 6 Settlers and enables Settlers at the Town Center.
Allows Settler training at the Town Center and grants a steady trickle of Food.
3 Native Embassy Travois. Allows the recruitment of Comanche Horse Archers, Cheyenne Riders, Sharktooth Bowmen and Klamath Riflemen at Native Embassies.
Militiamen become Minutemen who no longer lose hit points and can now be called at Forts. Delivers 16 Minutemen.
Ships 1 Mortar and upgrades Mortars to Imperial Howitzers.
All Blockhouses spawn a Hungarian Grenadier and every shipment delivers an extra Outpost Wagon. Settlers become Grenzers - Revolutionaries with more range but less hitpoints.
All existing Outposts and Blockhouses spawn a Magyar Hussar.
All Blockhouses spawn a Roșior Dragoon and every shipment delivers an extra Blockhouse Wagon. Settlers become Dorobants, who trade range for more hitpoints
Solid general-purpose infantry which trades range for hitpoints. Good against cavalry.
All existing Outposts and Blockhouses spawn a Roșior Dragoon.
3 Native Embassy Travois. Allows the recruitment of Cree Coureurs, Cree Trackers, Huron Mantlets and Nootka Clubmen at Native Embassies.
3 Native Embassy Travois. Allows the recruitment of Zapotec Lightning Warriors, Mayan Holcan Javelineers, Navajo Riflemen and Apache Cavalry at Native Embassies.
Ships 1 Frigate and 1 Monitor. Instead of a Mameluke you get an extra Privateer.
You will receive a bonus Elephant with all future shipments, starting with this one. Enables the training of War Elephants.
TEAM Ships 10 Bison and improves gathering rate from hunted animals
Ships 8 semi-fattened Cows, 1 Gaucho, and 1 Homestead Wagon.
Conscription: Call an army of Minutemen to defend this fort!
Levy: Call a handful of Minutemen to defend this fort!
Supports 12 population and produces food and wood.
Inca House that supports 12 population and produces food and wood.

Exiled from the Hausa city-state of Gobir for criticizing the greed and immorality of the city's elites, the scholar, writer, and military leader Usman dan Fodio united Fulani nomads, Hausa peasants, and escaped slaves to spark a revolution on West Africa's Sahel.

For over a century, Ethiopia struggled as local warlords vied for power in the declining old empire. There seemed to be no way out of the conflict until a man named Kassa Hailu stepped in. Kassa, a veteran of the Ethiopian-Egyptian wars, could no longer bear to watch as his country was torn asunder. He would fight the warlords and gift the loot to the impoverished Ethiopian peasants.
The Battle of the Three Kings (1578)

Sebastian of Portugal, a young and jealous king, has launched an invasion into Morocco under the pretense of a crusade. The Saadis, however, are not impressed and gather their army to meet the invaders. The Iberians may have superior technology, mercenaries, and the help of a local puppet sultan, but the sultan's forces are fighting to protect their homes.
The Battle of the Three Kings (aftermath)
The Burning of the USS Philadelphia (1803)

Determined to put an end to predatory raids on merchant vessels, the United States has declared war on the Barbary pirates in North Africa. An auspicious start to the conflict quickly turned into disaster and disgrace when the frigate USS Philadelphia was captured intact by Barbary pirates. However, one brave young American lieutenant was unwilling to let the vessel remain in enemy hands. Assembling a group of volunteers, Stephen Decatur set sail to destroy the frigate and salvage the US Navy's reputation.
The Burning of the USS Philadelphia (aftermath)

As the Bourbon Reforms granted the Spanish elite more power and diminished that of the church, resentment grew among the rural Mexican population. When news of Napoleon Bonaparte’s conquest of Spain reached the Americas, the words of a Catholic priest ignited the sparks of revolution.

At the beginning of the War of 1812, the Americans launched an invasion across the Niagara River into British Canada. To halt this offensive and defend Canada, the British called upon the militias of York and Lincoln as well as their Mohawk, Lenape, and Haudenosaunee allies.
Randomly selects from among all Competitive Maps.

It's autumn in Korea - players will find themselves nestled between flowers, falling leaves and all shades of red and orange. This picturesque, peninsular region gently touches the coast to the north where there are fishing opportunities; though no whales this far inland. Find a trading route to the south which passes through each team's side of the map.

Korea: a peninsular region that touches the ocean in the north with a trading route to the south.

Settlements: Jesuit
Outlaws: Wokou Horseman, Wokou Monk

In this beautiful northern wilderness, players begin surrounded by forests, mountains and cliffs overlooking the ocean. This mineral-rich region sports plenty of silver mines, as well as gold mines deposited directly below the mountains. There are no trading routes, but a few fishing boats will prove economically valuable.

Alaska: a beautiful, coastal wilderness with plenty of mines - find gold deposits near the mountains.

Settlements: Nootka
Outlaws: Comanchero, Renegado

Players will find no shortage of resources on the open Punjabi plains. Water buffalo graze nearby the fordabable river to the north, across which lies fertile grassland, berry bushes, and two Udasi temples. The south sports a trading route which gently borders the Thar Desert. With densly packed forests and a starting mango grove rickshaw, there will be absolutely no shortage of wood.

Punjab: a trading route and fordable river flow through the open Punjabi plains.

Settlements: Udasi
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Marathan Thuggee

This coastal peninsular region sees players begin on opposing shorelines divided by a mountain range. Teams must control the wide central pass, or sneak through narrower chokes as they vie for control of a winding trade route and the surrounding resource. Keep an eye out for enemy docks on your side!

Baja California: two opposing shorelines are divided by a mountain range with several chokepoints.

Settlements: Navajo
Outlaws: Comanchero, Renegado

Situated in the Sundarbans of the Bay of Bengal, players initially begin on dry land. Teams share a modest starting plateau with limited space and resources - but both run out quickly and expansion will be necessary! Though, due to seasonal flooding; beyond lies vast swampland and dense mangrove forest where land is premium and walls are difficult to build.

Bengal: vast swampland and dense mangrove forest lie beyond a spacious starting area.

Settlements: Bhakti
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Marathan Thuggee

Players begin on opposite sides of a valley, nestled within the Cascade Range. There are only small tin mines and not many animals to hunt. A smattering of berries surround the lakes - which can be fished - though neither will be particularly bountiful. Be quick to collect the many unguarded muskrat treasures, because you won’t find much else...

Cascade Range: A snowy valley with very limited resources and treasures.

Settlements: Klamath, Nootka
Outlaws: Pistolero, Renegado

The Fertile Crescent is divided into three regions by rivers with shallow crossings. Teams begin on the central plain where there are fewer resources compared to the surrounding east and west. Maintaining control of each region and its trading posts is tough - you can’t be everywhere! Form an alliance with the Sufi for some powerful late-game upgrades.

Fertile Crescent: a pair of rivers divide the region into three - being everywhere can be challenging!

Settlements: Sufi
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Marathan Thuggee

The Floridian coast boasts sandy beaches, a starting market, and a trading route which passes through every player's town. Food is exceptionally abundant here -- players will find plenty of turkeys and deer to hunt; as well as sheep and fish to gather. Native Seminole and Carib tribes offer some incredibly powerful archer technologies - beware!

Florida: players begin on the coast with a market and spawn on top of the trading route.

Settlements: Seminoles, Caribs
Outlaws: Pirate

Players find themselves in a hot, semi-arid lowland with no access to trading routes. Instead, players must fight to control the center of the map where there are plenty of Rhea and Guanco to hunt as well as llamas to tame. The Chaco Plain is very open! Only a few small ponds break up the landscape - be prepared for raiding on all sides...

Gran Chaco: wild llamas and plenty of wildlife roam the South American Chaco Plain.

Settlements: Mapuche, Quechua, Tupi
Outlaws: Pistolero, Pirate

The Central Plain is the most populous region of China, home to many Shaolin settlements and wildlife aplenty. An extensive trading route spans across the fertile, open grassland - controlling this is a surefire way to a powerful economic victory. Fierce competition over each post is essential!

Central Plain: a long trading route spans across the open plains of central China.

Settlements: Shaolin
Outlaws: Wokou Horseman, Wokou Monk

Summer or winter, there is no shortage of resources here. Constructing defenses on the islands in the sea, or nearby the Cree and Huron settlements will help control the ocean. Forming an alliance with either of these natives will unlock some fantastic economic options. The position of the trading route varies but is always in the middle of the map.

Saguenay: a coastal region with plenty of resources. It may be summer or winter.

Settlements: Cree, Huron
Outlaws: Pistolero, Comanchero

A watercourse divides the region and forks in the center to form an island. Shallow crossings offer passage but only in predictable locations -- a keen awareness of your opponent will be rewarded as they can only approach you from limited angles. There are no natives here, but a friendly macaque awaiting rescue next to your town will help you scout for goats.

Kamchatka: A watercourse divides the region and forks in the center to form an island.

Settlements: -
Outlaws: Wokou Monk, Wokou Horseman

Players find themselves on the Manchurian coast where cliffs and rock overlook sizable fish-stocks. Yaks and trees are sparcely littered across this harsh, open landscape - whilst the wood supply may be limited, controlling a few trading posts should more than make up for it. Teams will find an easily defendable route behind their base... or maybe it will be out in the open towards the northwest - either is possible.

Manchuria: a coastal region sparcely littered with trees and yaks. The trading route position varies.

Settlements: Shaolin, Tengri
Outlaws: Wokou Horseman, Wokou Monk

Teams find themselves on opposite sides of an enormous, but beautiful mountain peppered with flowers, ferns and red maples. South of it lies the ocean, and north of it lie two valuable trading routes, as well as Zen devotees. Players will do battle on these two fronts - you won’t find other ways around the mountain!

Hokkaido: players do battle around the foot of a beautiful Japanese volcano.

Settlements: Zen
Outlaws: Wokou Horseman, Wokou Ronin

Wild llamas roam the western Pampian mountains, and players must choose whether to invest into the wealth of livestock, or take their chances picking out the first treasures in the lowlands. This semi-arid region offers no trading routes, though Mapuche settlements populate the landscape -- player should watch out for potential alliances that can offer a variety of early aggressive options as well as valuable lategame technologies.

Pampas Sierras: Wild llamas roam the mountains to the West - there are many settlements but no trading routes.

Settlements: Mapuche, Quechua, Tupi
Outlaws: Comanchero, Pistolero

Divided by a rockface, teams begin on opposites sides of this frosty, mountainous region. Three fairly open passages permit movement between each side -- though trading routes meander through each, making them difficult to fully wall. Researching Stagecoach or Ironhorse here will upgrade both traderoutes - be careful not to aid your opponents.

Colorado: a frosty mountainous region with a trading route that meanders through chokepoints.

Settlements: Comanche, Cheyenne, Navajo
Outlaws: Pistolero, Renegado

In pursuit of the Northwest Passage, players find themselves lost in the Arctic archipelago, confined to a windy and desolate island. The sheer ice cliffs make it completely inaccessible by ship - docks cannot be constructed. Resources are limited, especially coin, though a trading route can be found to the southeast.

Arctic Territories: a desolate land in the Arctic archipelago - wind, snow and ice aplenty.

Settlements: -
Outlaws: Pistolero, Comanchero

Teams begin on opposite sides of the Malaysian peninsula next to separate, easily defendable oceans. Two trading posts can be found in the far corners of the map, not so far away from a Sufi or Jesuit settlement, tucked behind the wallable treelines. Each player's starting tin mines won’t supply much coin; look to the whales, or silver deposits scattered around the map for more, where you will also find water buffalo to tame.

Malaysia: a peninsular region with separate, defendable oceans on each side.

Settlements: Jesuit, Sufi
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Wokou Pirate

Players will find wide-open prairies peppered with flowers, ponds and forests. Two red mesas restrict movement through the middle of the map -- but also create lots of defendable positions! Form an early alliance with the natives for some powerful economic options; the Cree will supply coureur des bois and the Comanche can reduce the coin cost of all technologies and wonders. Researching stagecoach or Ironhorse here will upgrade both traderoutes - be careful not to aid your opponents.

Dakota: two dusty red mesas occupy the center of wide-open prairies.

Settlements: Cheyenne, Cree
Outlaws: Renegado, Pistolero

With scorching rays and dried-up ponds, this particular region of Mexico is hot and dry - but certainly not barren. Plenty of pronghorn, and even a few bison, roam this semi-arid landscape. Veins of copper will supply adequate coin, but there are very limited trees. A large mesa occupies the center of the map through which a lengthy trading route passes by. Surrounding it are several native settlements; players will sometimes find the Apache and Navajo, but at other times the Zapotec and Maya.

Mexico: a lengthy trading route passes through a large central mesa.

Settlements: Navajo, Apache, Zapotec, Maya
Outlaws: Comanchero, Pistolero

Teams begin exceptionally close to each other and are surrounded by plenty of resources - walling up and playing defensively will be easier than usual. There are no rivers in this region of the Andes, only a trading route and wide-open mountains where many native Quechua settlements occupy the chokepoints.

Andes-Upper: Teams begin exceptionally close to each other - perfect for the Treaty game mode.

Settlements: Quechua
Outlaws: Pistolero, Renegado

Players begin in a southerly position, nestled between three parallel rivers. This scenic region boasts many treasures and plenty of natural resources - though all of them upstream. There are no trading routes here, so teams must push northward towards the mountains. There, goats roam freely - though will need to be escorted home... it’s a long journey back.

Parallel Rivers: wade upstream in pursuit of treasures, goats and resources. The rivers can be crossed on foot.

Settlements: Zen
Outlaws: Wokou Horseman, Wokou Monk

Teams find themselves situated on a large, bountiful island, surrounded by smaller ones, amidst the Indonesian archipelago. There are no trading routes here, meaning that a fishing economy and naval presence is absolutely necessary! Wild water buffalo roam all of the islands; use your starting catamaran to bring them back to your town where you begin with an extra coin crate and saloon or equivalent building.

Indonesia: a large island surrounded by smaller ones amidst an enormous, fish-laden archipelago.

Settlements: Jesuit, Sufi
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Wokou Pirate
Randomly selects from a tailored pool of maps that welcome strategic diversity and civilization variety.
Randomly selects from among all Asian maps, among both competitive and casual sets.

Northwest Territory: a green and rainy region divided by rivers with shallow crossings.

Settlements: Nootka, Klamath, Cree
Outlaws: Comanchero, Renegado
Randomly selects from a tailored pool of maps which are ideal for Team Games.
Randomly selects from a tailored pool of Land Maps.
Randomly selects from a tailored pool of Water Maps.
Randomly selects from among all American maps, among both competitive and casual sets.
Upgrades this Trade Route to use Traveling Merchants, which can deliver resources, move faster, and provide greater line of sight.

Generates a passive income of Fool's Gold over time. Can only be constructed by the Unknown Miner.

A team of miners stuck in a mine in need of rescue.

The secret formula for Greek Fire that boosts the attack of all your warships.
%1s has discovered the secret formula for Greek Fire which grants all warships greater attack.
An ancient Byzantine manual on the construction of warships reducing the cost of all your warships.

An ancient scroll on Byzantine naval tactics granting all your warships a higher attack speed.
%1s has discovered an ancient scroll on Byzantine naval tactics which improves the attack speed of all warships.
Increases the attack of all warships.

A wrecked Italian merchant ship carrying riches worth %1d %2s.
