An ancient Trireme sunk in battle carrying %1d %2s and %3d %4s.
%1s has discovered an ancient Trireme carrying %2d %3s and %4d %5s.
A majestic bull that drives the market.
A Golden Cattle that can transport units and be harvested for coin.
Wooden Cattle that can transport units and be harvested for wood. This model has been disarmed.
The Moroccans allow you to train their warriors at some of your military buildings like regular units.
The Haudenosaunee increase the number of Tomahawks and Mantlets you can train.
The Nootka Potlatch ceremony allows you to train hand infantry more quickly and for less cost.
The story of Seminole invincibility improves archer hitpoints and allows them to slowly regenerate hitpoints.
Grants a steady Food trickle which grants more resources the more coin and wood you have stockpiled.
Hero attack and hitpoints increased. Heroes also get greater resource rewards from Treasures.
Exports of contraband provide you with 1 Crate of Coin per 2 minutes of game length (up to a maximum of 30 minutes).
Send more of our young men into battle! We cannot let the enemy achieve such a cowardly victory.
Inti shines his light upon Huayna Capac's warriors! He will grant us a glorious victory!
We do not have such weapons. Perhaps you are willing to share your knowledge of this 'artillery' with my people?
The Inca have no need for large dogs. Huayna Capac can fill whole valleys with his warriors.
Agreed, Inca warriors will bring victory.
It is you who should pay tribute to the Sapa Inca, not the other way around!
The Inca warriors are harvesting the crops! You will need to wait before they can take up arms again.
Nothing is impossible for the Sapa Inca—except for this.
Huayna Capac needs time to gather his vast army from the four corners of the world.
These people dare to destroy our Trading Posts! May my stone mace smash their weak skulls!
Our Aztec neighbors cannot wait to become Inca subjects. Huayna Capac will fulfill their wish!
The British tried to trade hot water for coca. For this, Huayna Capac will push them into the sea!
The Dutch asked for too many discounts. Now they will have to pay for everything!
Huayna Capac will show no mercy unless the French submit to him now!
These Germans have already lost to Huayna Capac, they just do not realize it.
Huayna Capac defeated the Haudenosaunee horses and gunpowder with slings and stones! That is pure skill.
The Ottomans always sent the same warriors. That was their downfall.
The Portuguese will perish at the hands of the Inca warriors!
The Russians think that they have many warriors. Huayna Capac will show them otherwise!
The large dogs of the Lakota did not enjoy dancing the Boleadoras with us. Too bad, it's so much fun!
The Spanish are as weak as their constructions. They will tremble before the Inca Empire!
There can only be one Sapa Inca! Death to the traitor!
These British have become powerful. The Inca warriors must fight even more fiercely if they wish to gain the favor of their emperor.
The Dutch continue to be a thorn in my side. Huayna Capac demands that their threat to his authority end now!
Did the gods not accept our lavish offerings? Why do they let the French continue with impunity?
Huayna Capac expected the Germans to have succumbed to their fermented drinks by now—yet they continue to defy the Sapa Inca!
Huayna Capac has much respect for a warrior people like the Haudenosaunee.
The Ottomans have an empire on par with that of the Sapa Inca. Huayna Capac respects that.
The Portuguese have a strong force. It will require many more Inca warriors to turn the tide.
These Russians flood the battlefield with their soldiers. They are not to be underestimated.
Perhaps the Lakota were right to adopt the large dogs. The Inca should do so as well.
The Spanish thunder weapons and shiny metal swords have proven to be quite effective against my Inca warriors.
This false Sapa Inca has much support. In the end, however, only Huayna Capac will remain standing.
While my people worship me, they forget to innovate like your people do.
Your technological advantage is impressive, use it well to gain the edge on the battlefield.
Do not linger in the first age. Our enemies only respect strength, which comes with a large army.
Huayna Capac demands that you advance to the next age!
You advance quickly, but can your military match Huayna Capac's?
Huayna Capac hopes that you are faster at fighting than you are at researching technologies.
Huayna Capac has lost interest in this battle. He has more important matters to attend to elsewhere.
Assist me, lest you prefer to continue the fight on your own.
My people are weak and my empire lies in ruins. Send your warriors before it is too late!
I am Huayna Capac, Sapa Inca of the mighty Inca Empire, god among men, ruler of many.
Huayna Capac accepts your support. May we crush those who oppose us with ease.
I see that you have become stronger since last we met. So have I.
The weaker the enemies, the easier it will be to crush their spirits.
Huayna Capac remembers how you defeated his warriors in battle last time. Now we will unleash that fury on the enemy.
Huayna Capac is nothing if not gracious. You will have a place at his side at the next banquet.
Huayna Capac hopes that you will put up a better fight this time around.
The Inca tend to put wounded animals out of their misery. Do not force Huayna Capac's hand.
These lands are known to the Sapa Inca.
The Inca people have suffered enough. Huayna Capac demands that you bring him victory!
The sounds of victory still resonate to this day! Another dawn, and another victory is upon us!
My War Chief has returned to my court. After he is done crawling through the dirt, asking for my forgiveness, he will resume his duties.
Huayna Capac grants you this generous gift of gold.
Here is some gold, use it wisely.
The Inca know over 4,000 different types of staple food. Have some.
My people gathered an excess of food. Huayna Capac lets you have some of it.
Take this wood. Huayna Capac no longer desires it.
Huayna Capac can spare this wood for you.
My priests consulted the Huaca and we are told that we must march to war.
Huayna Capac's warriors are upon the enemy's town. They will spare no one!
Enough! Huayna Capac will no longer allow this minor tribe to side with his enemies.
Trade can only benefit the Inca Empire. Burn it down!
Huayna Capac was already planning to go to battle. You may join him.
Huayna Capac has called for new blood to join his mighty army.
Huayna Capac's empire needs to expand. This is a good place for a new city.
There is no end to the riches of Huayna Capac's empire. You can have a fraction of them.
Our stores are bursting with food. Of course Huayna Capac will share with his ally.
Huayna Capac's people have cut down many forests. Appreciate their hard work and do not waste the wood.
The messengers have delivered the quipus. Huayna Capac's warriors rush to your aid!
You are invited as an honored guest at the next festival of Inti. Be amazed as you witness a month of dancing, feasting, and lavish gifts.
May I interest you in a visit to Huayna Capac's royal palace at Machu Picchu? The view from its terraces is breathtaking.
Huayna Capac demands tribute! Send him your coin!
Huayna Capac needs to feed his people! Share what food you have.
The gods demand that you give Huayna Capac wood so that he might build a large bonfire for sacrificial offerings.
The Sapa Inca appreciates this gift of coin.
Our storage houses are full of food once again. Huayna Capac thanks you.
The Sapa Inca will not forget your good deeds.
Huayna Capac, Emperor of the fearsome Inca, thanks you for your fitting tribute.
This wood will not go to waste.
The Aztecs seem to have bested Huayna Capac. We will give them the sacrifices that they demand.
These British...that "tea" that they drink must be a magical potion of strength!
No wonder the Dutch have amassed a larger army than Huayna Capac—they trade with all these shiny metals!
Huayna Capac will have to surrender to the French. Do they know of surrender?
The Germans invade Huayna Capac's trails with their wanderlust. We are being overrun!
The adoption of gunpowder and horses pays off too well for the Haudenosaunee.
Ottoman artillery makes Huayna Capac's mighty walls shake. This is a bad omen.
The Portuguese flag is waving strongly in the wind. It is going to blow Huayna Capac away!
Are the Russians playing by the rules? Huayna Capac does not seem to have a chance.
Huayna Capac loves his llamas, but he finds Lakota horses superior. We may need a horse god now.
The Spanish come for Huayna Capac's gold. Give them some trinkets and send them back on their way before they destroy Huayna Capac's empire.
This treacherous Sapa Inca seems to have Inti's blessing. What did Huayna Capac do to make the gods forsake him!
The feathered serpent of the Aztecs has poisoned our gods. They fooled Huayna Capac!
These British are like a tiny dog. All bark, no bite.
It seems that the Dutch came to make a bargain—and a bargain they found.
The French chased away Huayna Capac's llamas. What will Huayna Capac eat now?
These Germans drank all of our beverages. Huayna Capac is close to dying of thirst!
Huayna Capac's warriors flee the din of Haudenosaunee horses and muskets.
It seems that the Ottomans were only interested in llama meat and we just got in their way.
The Portuguese did not even put up a fight. They just founded more towns than us—and won.
Huayna Capac's warriors would have won the battle if they had not lost the drinking contest against the Russians.
Our bolas cannot snare the smooth legs of Lakota horses. It is hopeless.
Those bearded Spanish may be few but their fighting tactics were...unexpected.
What is this treachery! Only Huayna Capac can be the true Sapa Inca!
Huayna Capac's warriors have lost the favor of the gods. We are losing.
You must start proving yourself a worthy ally or Huayna Capac will turn you into one of his subjects.
Huayna Capac's warriors cut through the enemy like maize on a harvest day. The Sapa Inca is pleased with his subjects.
Huayna Capac does not do the dirty work himself—he makes others do it for him.
Once again, the Inca have won the day! Huayna Capac hopes that you will at least try next time.
Huayna Capac has seen enough bloodshed. He wishes to retire to his palace.
Huayna Capac recognizes that he has lost this battle. He will have to try his luck at another, more opportune time.
Emperor Huayna Capac yearns for his home in Machu Picchu. It is time to end this war.
The enemy is afraid of Huayna Capac's armies. Let us make them confront their fears!
The enemy managed to persuade the natives to join their side, let us convince them otherwise.
You have found your first treasure. May many more follow.
You will share your treasures, no? Huayna Capac expects lavish gifts.
Huayna Capac sees that you appreciate shiny metals as well.
You should use that food to feed your people.
Send Huayna Capac some of those treasures. He loves surprises.
Huayna Capac does not appreciate you stealing what belongs to him.
You may borrow Huayna Capac's subject for a short amount of time.
Huayna Capac knows the value of good servants.
May you spend that wood wisely.
Huayna Capac has claimed a treasure. This will aid us in our plans.
More food for Huayna Capac's granaries!
Huayna Capac can use this tribute well. He thanks you for sending it to him.
Even more tributes! Huayna Capac is pleased.
The natives are eager to follow Huayna Capac into battle.
These villagers will help grow Huayna Capac's empire.
More wood to arm my numerous forces!
These walls will protect Huayna Capac's people while his warriors go on the offensive.
It is only a matter of time until Huayna Capac is victorious. Start preparing the feasts!
Huayna Capac's troops will strike where you least expect.
Huayna Capac is victorious yet again. His empire grows.
You are quick to advance, but what use is it if you rule no people?
Huayna Capac has dealt with primitive tribes like yours before.
Why fight? Just accept Huayna Capac's superiority and we can end this now.
Huayna Capac sees that you can finally train an army. He has been waiting all day for someone to actually put up a fight!
The Inca value community. Huayna Capac guesses that you prefer isolation.
You cluster together like a litter of frightened guinea pigs.
Huayna Capac has not laughed like this in a long time. Thank you for that!
I am Huayna Capac, Emperor of the Inca. I answer to no mere mortal!
Last time, Huayna Capac sent his cook to fight for him. Now, he will deal with your pathetic army himself!
There is an even easier way out of this. Just surrender and become Huayna Capac's subject.
Huayna Capac sees that you have fallen in love with this corner of the Inca Empire.
Gather all of the allies that you can find! You will need them to face the might of the Inca Empire.
Huayna Capac thinks that you are brave and confident to fight against such odds. He also thinks that you are a fool!
Another tourist? Machu Picchu is closed today.
Huayna Capac already knew that your warriors would come. His messengers informed him.
Huayna Capac assumes that these warriors want to join the mighty Inca army?
You command a big army! Impressive...now, what are they doing here?
Ahh! You have brought some weapons to trade, yes?
The subjects that you have sent Huayna Capac are too numerous and too unruly. Take them back!
Are you sending your people to negotiate your surrender? Then where are the gifts for Huayna Capac?
Huayna Capac's scouts have found your small kingdom. When will it join his mighty empire?
You have letters and numbers, I prefer to pull the strings with my quipus!
Your power is overwhelming. Huayna Capac surrenders for the good of his people.
My empire is suffering. Huayna Capac has no choice but to concede.
Do you feel safe now? Huayna Capac thinks that you should not.
Huayna Capac sees that you have gathered the first treasure. Do not let that get to your head.
Treasures alone will not let you catch up with the mighty Inca.
Oh, you found gold. Surely you mean to tribute that to Huayna Capac?
May that food keep you alive a little longer. It cannot compare to the contents of Huayna Capac's granaries.
He who hoards all of the earth's bounties but does not share it with the gods is his own undoing.
You are blinded by greed, we Inca share our goods.
Inca punishments for theft are infamous.
Are you misleading the beloved subjects of the Sapa Inca?
Huayna Capac rules enough people already.
Are you trying to become a master builder like Huayna Capac? You are a fool—you must use stone!
The Inca build the best walls. We know how to overcome yours!
The Inca Empire keeps growing. Can yours keep up?
This trading site belongs to Huayna Capac, as do all others.
All that you can see belongs to the Sapa Inca!
Even Mother Earth pays tribute to the Inca.
Something to eat! I hope that it is not quinoa again.
I consider this your due tribute to your overlord.
Inti shows us where all of the treasures are!
The natives of this land are wise. They prefer to join the Inca.
More hands to do hard labor for the Sapa Inca!
These villagers will build some fine roads and bridges!
With this wood, our bonfires for the gods will burn even brighter!
These natives won't follow you for long, the Inca Empire is preparing to expand.
Cheer while you can. Soon this trading site will belong to the Sapa Inca!
Why do you cower behind your Trading Posts? Face the Inca on the battlefield like a real general would!
Huayna Capac has all of the power now. I would start considering the idea of finding a new home.
%1!s!, Name: %2!s!, players %3!s! of %4!s!, map %5!s!, rules %6!s!, type %7!s!, server: %8!s!

Send word across our empires--we must enlist anyone old enough to hold a weapon! We cannot allow such a pitiful victory!Send word across our empires--we must enlist anyone old enough to hold a weapon! We cannot allow such a pitiful victory!
This was already part of my plan.
You want me to train more artillery? I invented artillery!
Of course. Everyone fears the charge of my cavalry!
I see that your troops are stuck. Don't worry! My elite infantry will bail them out.
I do not wish to pay tribute at this time.
Sorry, what did you say? My new cannons are so loud!
Winter has been hard on my troops. You must wait before we can fight again.
What you are asking is simply impossible!
I need time to muster my troops.
Our Trading Posts have been destroyed! How can we acquire saffron now?
What is sweeter than Aztec chocolate? The smell of victory!
These British will not rule our icy seas!
These Dutch have no idea how to prepare a good herring, and it will lead to their defeat!
These French are ready to meet their Waterloo today.
The Germans sold us their soldiers; now we're beating them with their own men!
The Haudenosaunee made promising changes to their arsenal, but it was never a match for mine.
These Ottomans could not keep their gunpowder dry, and that has led to their downfall.
The shipbuilding techniques of the Portuguese will not save them now.
Who fears the Russians? I am the king in the north!
The Lakota never stood a chance against our sturdy Finnhorses.
How do you break the Spanish Tercio? - With a cannonball! Ha-ha-ha!
The Inca were trying to hide in the mountains. They truly underestimated the range of cannons!
The Chinese invented gunpowder, and I showed them how to use it.
The Japanese didn't shy away from a fight, but their honor could not save them from superior weaponry!
No Indian elephant is too big for my cannons!
The Aztec Jaguar warriors with their obsidian blades are worthy foes for my lion-hearted soldiers!
The British have built a professional army and expanded their arsenal. Time to launch an attack!
It's getting serious. The Dutch sold all of their tulips to field more cannons than I can.
The armor of the French cuirassiers gleams in the sun. I shall respond with the light of my cannons!
The Germans must have untold riches to muster such a big army. We should sack their towns!
The Haudenosaunee have quickly mastered the latest military tactics and become a formidable foe.
The Ottoman artillery is loud and numerous, but my gunners can also hit their targets!
The Portuguese outmaneuver us and know how to keep our troops at bay.
The Russians have reformed their army and hold numerical superiority. Follow my lead!
The Lakota army has grown and moves swiftly on the battlefield. There is no time to catch a breath!
The Spanish deploy their forces with excellence, but can they compete with mine?
The Incas are great in number and fierce melee fighters.
The mighty Chinese army is upgrading its weaponry. Let us attack now or they will tip the odds in their favor!
The Japanese Samurai are carving their way through our ranks with their sharp katanas. Impressive.
Cannons on elephants, sword whips and blade arms. The Indians are trying to outsmart us!
Uh... I'm right behind you! It won't be long...
Already? Tell me, how do you manage to develop so quickly?
Don't stay in the first age. Marvelous technologies await us!
You must advance to the next age! Technological advancements will lead to our victory!
Be careful. If your economic production does not grow, nor will your military.
Finally, now we can get started.
This battle is not in my interest, I shall focus my attention elsewhere in my empire.
My camp is under attack! I request your aid so that I can turn this tide!
My name is Gustavus Adolphus. I am destined for greatness!
If you send me your battle plans I can make adjustments that will bring us victory!
A higher difficulty this time? I see that you are finally rising to my level!
Don't think I'll go easy on them just because you lowered the difficulty setting!
Your ferocity is comparable to mine. Let us both overwhelm our enemies with it!
I am grateful to have you by my side again.
I'm glad you understand the value of having me as an ally, rather than as an enemy.
Just give me a shout when you need my help again.
We know this map well, my friend. An excellent advantage.
It wasn't my fault that we lost last time. I trust you're done warming up?
We are a dream team. Let us march all away across the land!
I was forced to pay ransom for my explorer. Such a fall from grace from our proud past...
Consider this a partial repayment of those... ancient debts I owe you.
The cod catch was great this year. Here, share it with me.
In Sweden we season our food with nothing but salt, but we do have lots of it! Here, have some.
My forests are vast and my lumberjacks very efficient. You can have this wood, as a token of our friendship.
With this timber you just might construct an empire as vast as mine!
If we wait much longer, we will lose the advantage of surprise. I must march to battle!
We will win this war by always making the first move. March, men!
I will crush these natives the same way that I crushed the Snapphanes!
Let's see if your invisible hand can stop me from plundering your trade!
With God and the victorious arms, we shall win this fight!
My army needs room to expand. I shall build another military base.
I shall found a new city for the Swedish Empire!
Take this coin. You seem like you need it.
Do you like fish? I can throw you a red herring.
We'll send you some of our finest lumber!
If an ally is in need, Sweden will answer!
I do not do well in peacetime... perhaps we could start just a tiny war?
All of this inaction is making my troops anxious.
My population is too small to support my giant army. Could you spare me some coin?
Winter has been harsh in Sweden. Could you spare us some food?
I used my last wood to build a giant goat and someone burned it down. Could you spare me some of yours?
We'll spend the coin wisely on our technological advancement.
It's no pickled herring, but it will have to do.
Thank you. I will not forget this generous contribution.
After all the times I have carried you, I am happy that you saw fit to pay some of it back.
We'll craft masterful constructions with your wood. Many thanks.
The Aztecs are dominating the battlefield. Today, I have sacrified my honor.
The British have defeated us! We shall not be ruling the waves today.
The Dutch have come to pillage my settlement...again!
I did not expect such fierceness from the French. Today, I shall surrender.
The Germans are furious. Are they still upset about Magdeburg - or is it my name?
The tomahawks of the Haudenosaunee always seem to find their target. Their technique is formidable.
I cannot believe that the Ottomans are running us off... again!
I do not want to become lost in the smoke from the Portuguese cannons. We should pull back.
The Russian army is too big for a pitched battle. We should retreat to fight another day.
The Lakota are pushing back my troops with unmatched perseverance. We should retreat immediately!
The Spanish came for our gold, but we spent it all on this lost war! We should surrender.
Despite our advanced weaponry, the Inca are dominating the battle. We should capitulate.
Let the Chinese be the central kingdom so long as we can keep the north.
United under one banner and with all of their swords facing us, the Japanese fighting prowess is too much to handle.
Camelry and elephants trample my horses... why did I decide to pick a fight with the Indians?
Let us negotiate a truce with the Aztecs, so my botanists can at least take a good look at their floating gardens.
The British are still using archers on the battlefield? It seems that I underestimated this ancient weaponry.
These Dutch took all of our fish! No wonder we have been defeated.
We are no match for the mighty French. An alliance will be in our interests for the next war.
The Germans noticed that the Schwedentrunk doesn't taste like beer. We should break camp - now!
The Haudenosaunee used all of the trees for woodworking! We had nothing left for ourselves.
It appears that the Ottomans brought guns of their own. Who would have thought?
The Portuguese opened fire before my cannons were in position. Retreat!
These Russians brought guns to a snowball fight. No wonder we lost.
The Lakota horses move too swiftly for our gunners. We should return to target practice.
My soldiers underestimated the length of Spanish pikes. Now victory is literally out of reach.
I was a fool for trusting the old adage. These Inca sticks and stones break my bones indeed!
I hate to admit it, but the inventions of the Chinese leave me stumped. How can I fight against this?
I figured that the Japanese would be too busy fighting among themselves to oppose us, but it seems that I was mistaken.
The Indians fight like tigers, and we just became their prey.
It is time for me to fade away. I have lost the game, and no one is to blame... here I go!
We are in the worst game, we are in last place, and you are the worst part of this team. Do you know how bad that makes you!?
My men march with ferocity! Our victory is ensured!
You are tough as leather! You have proven to be a worthy ally to Sweden!
The Lion of the North roars again! You are honoured to have me by your side.
Today we were outsmarted! Let us resign and fight again another day.
A good general recognizes when the battle is lost. Let us resign with honor.
I am longing to go back to Stockholm. Can we stop this bloodshed?
Our enemy lives a life of wealth through trade. If we let them continue like this, it will put my treasury to shame.
Many of the natives have been rallied to oppose us. Such auxiliaries benefit our enemy far too well.
I hope that we can find many treasures in this new world.
Is that the most exotic find that this place has to offer?
Spend that food wisely. An army cannot march on an empty stomach!
Don't tell me that you will be ignoring the war to pursue your treasure hunting obsession?
That discovery was in my territory! Keep to your own lands!
You may recruit help from the locals if you so wish.
A passable demonstration of kindness. At least you made the settlers happy.
As exotic that wood might be, will the houses you build with them be as beautiful as mine?
I have claimed a treasure! Soon, my future vision will be reality.
As soon as these coins are polished, they will be fit for my coffers!
Enough food for seconds at my banquet!
I figured that you were not interested in keeping that for yourself.
I'm quite enjoying this treasure hunt.
An extra pair of helping hands from those who know the land better than us.
My daring expedition to rescue these settlers was a success!
I wonder how many Dalecarlian horses I can carve with this wood?
I did not build this wall because I cannot stand the outside world. I just need a break from it.
Wealth is imminent! Tonight we shall feast as our forefathers did.
So, you have chosen the coward's way to to victory? It will cost you dearly!
A king, warlord, and businessman. That's me!
You may have new tools at hand, but do you have anyone to use them?
You... do know how to age up, right?
Are you still an age behind? Your mother would be so ashamed of you!
You have advanced to the next age? We will be there shortly and outshine your technological advances!
Well, you can't place first every time... or ever, in your case.
Aaaand in last place we have... you! Congratulations!
Are you building a vacation cabin for yourself over there?
I could not imagine wanting to live so close to your neighbor.
I am Gustavus Adolphus, the Lion of the North. Today you will hear me roar!
You think that last time was hard? It was a mere military exercise!
You think that this will be easier? War is never easy!
I recognize this part of the woods! I used to defeat my foes here.
The Swedish Empire is small, yet you bring all of these allies? We shall meet on the battlefield!
Through my guidance, my alliance will crush your empire!
You come to look for a king?
I see that you have assembled your army. Maybe you can pick off a moose or two with it.
What is your retinue doing here? Oh, is this your army? Could have fooled me.
Aahh! My cannonballs will turn your army into meatballs!
I have faced far worse odds than this!
My base is going up in flames like my beloved Vasa! Vengeance will be mine!
This is the force that you send to fight the Swedish Empire? You insult me!
This is your base? How very... quaint.
This is quite nice, don't you think? Why don't you delete those troops of yours? Surely you don't need them in such... peaceful times?
We shall fight again another day, but for now, I request to resign.
A great general recognizes defeat. May I offer my surrender?
Just a minor dent in my plan.
Oh, you found your first treasure. How cute.
Keep scouting for knick-knacks. They won't help you against my mighty army!
You found some gold? It's worth nothing in the hands of incapable leaders.
That's probably all the food that you need to feed your pitiful army.
Sure, pick up all of these scraps. It won't help you face my military might!
You sure are greedy, but it won't help you!
A whole new world to explore, and you choose to steal from me? Pathetic!
Those natives will not be happy to have been taken under your wing once the nest is on fire.
Your workforce has scattered through the wilderness, so now you must herd them back like sheep?
I deserved that wood. My woodworking is much more skillful than yours.
Walls? I'll blast right through them!
The locals fight with me! Clearly, they recognize who is superior.
The locals know who has the best goods for trading!
This gold will pave the way for Swedish supremacy in these new lands!
I would kill for some fresh Swedish fish...
These resources are best used in capable hands. Let me help you with this.
Unlike yours, my explorer is efficient in finding new treasures.
The natives will repay that favor by bringing me your head.
I can see it in these settlers' eyes - they are relieved to be working for me rather than for you.
More workers for the Swedish Empire!
With this wood I shall build a Torp.
You feel the need to drag natives into our war? So be it.
The locals are trading with you only because they haven't met me yet.
A true general fights on the battlefield, but whatever floats your boat.

The Swedish Empire became one of the greatest in Europe through innovation in military tactics and logistics. Its artillery and cavalry charges dominated the battlefields, particularly during the Thirty Years War. Despite a relatively small population, the Swedes fielded some of the largest armies in Europe, partly through the recruitment of mercenaries.

Gustavus Adolphus is a cunning and aggressive tactician. He strives for superior military technology and likes to attack early. Gustavus prefers to engage the enemy in close combat and dominate the battlefield with the barrage of his artillery.
Swedish Musketeer that fires quickly and counters cavalry from range. Can charge quickly with his sword equipped. Good in melee combat.

Requires the '%s' customization to be unlocked first

Ships 6 Jaegers, upgrades all Jaegers into Savolax Jaegers and allows you to retrain them in your Barracks. Savolax Jaegers have slightly more hitpoints, can use the Stealth Ability and partly cost Wood to recruit.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Gets a free Mountain Monastery Builder with each Age-Up that can be built on top of Mines to gather Influence and Coin.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Age-Up Alliances:</color> (each grant extra bonuses)
 • Two new technologies at the Mountain Monastary
 • Units/Builders at the Palace or Town Center
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique Resource:</color>
Influence is a powerful resource spent primarily at the Palace on Native Warriors and Mercenaries. All unlocked features cost Influence. Generate it with Mountain Monasteries, Trading Posts and by controlling large herds of Livestock.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Sebastopol Mortar, Abun, Gascenya, Shotel Warrior, Neftenya and Oromo Warrior

Placed on the “Roof of Africa” Ethiopia was able to assert its influence over the surrounding lowlands, thriving in the safety of its mountains. A high ground badly needed against hostile attempts to take the empire down. Ethiopia and its King of kings defied not just its African neighbors but also European colonization attempts rendering it as one of the few African regions that eluded the talons of European imperial colonialism.

Emperor Tewodros is a daring and impetuous leader. Working his way from nothing to the pinnacle of power, he is not afraid to take risks to secure victory. Whether it be through swift aggression or savvy battlefield maneuvers, Tewodros will triumph at any cost.

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Gets a free Sanga Cattle with all shipments. Universities generate Influence, especially when built in a Kingdom (nearby one Town Center, Palace and Trading Post).
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Age-Up Alliances:</color> (each grant extra bonuses)
 • Two new technologies at the University
 • Units/Builders at the Palace or Town Center
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique Resource:</color>
Influence is a powerful resource spent primarily at the Palace on Native Warriors and Mercenaries. All unlocked features cost Influence. Generate it with Universities, Trading Posts and by controlling large herds of Livestock.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Maigadi, Griot, Fulani Archers, Raider and Lifidi Knight

The wealthy Hausa kingdoms were magnets for merchants, intellectuals, and enemies. Their extensive trade relations and diplomacy enabled them to exert powerful influence over vast stretches of West Africa. The Hausa kings and emirs deployed powerful cavalry armies to compete with each other or conquer neighboring empires.

Queen Amina is a charismatic and resourceful leader. Whether it be through strong fortifications to protect a robust economy, or with deft use of aggressive cavalry maneuvers and raids, Amina will bring the full might of the Hausa people to bear against her enemies.
Royal Hausa hero with a fealty aura. Explores, fights, builds Palaces, Universities, and Trading Posts. Good against cavalry.
Royal Ethiopian hero with a fealty aura. Explores, fights, builds Palaces, Mountain Monasteries, and Trading Posts. Good against infantry.
Quick-training foot archer who loses hitpoints over time, but gains attack speed at lower health.
Musketeer who loses hitpoints, becoming less effective over time.
Quick-training, Spearman who quickly loses hitpoints, becoming less effective over time.
Heavy ranged infantry that throws javelins faster at closer targets. Good against cavalry in melee.
Fast moving shock infantry that attacks quickly with two curved swords. Good against light infantry.
Skirmisher with high hitpoints. Good against heavy infantry and light ranged cavalry.
Powerful heavy cavalry with a charged musket attack and a rapid melee attack. Good against infantry.
Ranged cavalry. Good against hand cavalry, particularly in melee.
Heavy hand cavalry with a lot of hitpoints.
Mobile Hand Cavalry with decent siege damage. Good against light infantry and villagers.
Powerful heavy ranged infantry bodyguard with a deadly melee attack.
Foot Archer armed with a short bow for a fast attack. Good against Heavy Infantry and Ranged Cavalry. Can gather Livestock.
Livestock Market. Combines Market and Livestock Pen. Can fatten and sell Livestock for wood or gold.
Influence Collected (generated by Trade Routes, Native Settlements and Herdables)
This Trading Post is generating Influence.
Request Influence generation at this Trading Post.
Powerful, defensive building that can also train units.
Trick guardians into attacking each other
Cancel all queued units and researches in all selected buildings.
Trains and upgrades African regular units.
Watch Tower that can be used to defend the border.
Gargantuan mortar which annihilates units and buildings. Slow and expensive.
Solid Shot. Higher damage, but smaller area of effect than explosive shot.
Explosive Shot. Bursts on impact, creating a larger area of effect but lower damage than solid shot.
Configure this Field to produce Food.

Improves nearby Food and Field work rates and lures huntable animals. Builds slowly but for free. Contains hunting and farming upgrades.

Configure all Mountain Monasteries to convert 25% of gathered Coin into Influence.

All Mountain Monasteries are gathering Coin with a 50% Influence Rate.

Can produce Coin and Influence when placed on a Mine.
Mountain Monastery. Can be placed on a mine and toggle between Coin and Influence generation. Trains Abun and researches Alliance technologies.
Abun. Heals injured units from range and during battle. May be tasked to gather at a Mountain Monastery.
Mountain Monasteries cannot be placed on mines that are being gathered by enemies.
Battle Canoe. Warship good at transport
Battle Canoe. Powerful, agile warship that can also train units.
Mortar ship. Good at long range bombardment.
Cannon Boat. Somewhat expensive, but powerful boat good at blasting ships and buildings from a distance.
Hausa research building, generates XP or Influence
Unique Hausa building that can toggle between XP and Influence generation. Trains Griots and researches Alliance technologies. Most effective when near a Town Center, Trading Post, and Palace.
Configure all Universities to generate Influence.
Configure all Universities to generate XP.
Musician who can inspire buildings or intimidate enemies.
Griot. Inspiring musician and storyteller who can increase the work rate of buildings and speed of nearby units. Uses instruments to intimidate enemies which slows their attack speed.
This building can't be built nearby an occupied mine.
Transforms into a Palace for town defense.
Can be used to build a War Camp or Watch Tower.
Fattening Food source and versatile Economic Building.
Transforms into a Livestock Market for free.
Ports have a greater attack, heal ships faster, and train ships more quickly.
You can now train Zebu and Sanga Cattle at Livestock Markets.
When this Shipment arrives, all of your current Food is exchanged for a smaller sum of Influence.
Berber warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Fields become free! Fields and Granaries gain more hitpoints and are built faster.
War Camp units trickle a very small amount of Influence.
Kebele Chitet: Muster a group of Levied Spearmen from the district for defence!
Woreda Chitet: Muster a group of Levied Bowmen from the district for defence!
Town Center attack increased. Allows groups of Levied Spearmen and Levied Bowmen to be called upon to defend your town.
Ships 1 Arsenal Wagon. Allows Villagers to build Arsenals and Falconets to be trained at Palaces costing Influence.
Desert outlaws move and train faster.
All outlaw, Ronin and Wokou units take up less population. Enables special outlaws or something.
Ships 2 Palace Builders, 3 Camp Builders and increases build limits. Researches Fortified Cities.
Levied Spearmen, Levied Bowmen, and Levied Gunners no longer lose hitpoints and have all damage penalties removed.
Hero attack and hitpoints increased. African Heroes get greater resource rewards from Treasures.
%1s: Sets Build Bounty (%2s) to default Build Bounty value
Buildings yield Influence as well as XP when built.
When this Shipment arrives, all of your current Food is exchanged for Influence.
Animal exchange rates recover faster. Resource exchange rates improved.
Ships 1 Cannon Boat and 1 Battle Canoe.
Maigadi hitpoints increased and Maigadi inflict more melee damage against cavalry.
Ships 1 Hausa Emir (Hero) and a number powerful heavy ranged infantry bodyguards with a deadly melee attack.
Fulani Archers gain a powerful rifle attack.
Ships 10 Berber Arquebusier. Enables Berber Arquebusier to be trained at Palaces costing Influence.
Ships 2 Villagers and 1 Abun. Villagers construct buildings and gather resources. Abuns may be tasked to gather at a Mountain Monastery or heal injured units from range during battle.
Ships a group of Villagers and Griots. Griot build limit increased.
Order the Griot to play his drums with mallets. Music! (visual only)
Too loud! Order the Griot to play his drums quieter with his hands. (visual only)
Silence! Order the Griot to stop playing his loud, noisy instruments! (visual only)
The Griot will play his royal Kakaki trumpet only when appropriate. (visual only)
Fulani Archer attack and hitpoints increased.
Buildings yield Influence instead of XP when built.
All military units are trained faster.
Towers get a cannon attack and more hitpoints.
Enables Falconets and Culverins to be purchased using Influence.
Religious theorist and commander of the faithful. Leads the Fulani cause to reform the Hausa kingdoms.
Gifted, intrepid warrior and a champion of the Ethiopian people.
An aura that increases the attack speed of the allies around you.
Claimant to the Moroccan throne, backed by the Portuguese.
Brother of the Moroccan sultan. Leads the cavalry forces of the Moroccan army.
The attempt on my life has left me scarred and deformed...
You can now train Zebu Cattle from Livestock Markets.
You can now train Sanga Cattle from Livestock Markets.
Usman dan Fodio heals units twice as fast.
Universities trickle Influence and Experience faster.
This unit gets stronger with more allied units nearby.
Is that the smell of coffee? Your infantry now moves faster.
Trans-Saharan trade now enriches this region.
Each Mosque generates extra experience points.
Reveals the location of all Trading Posts, Treasures, and enemy fortifications on the map.
The Marabouts have shared their knowledge with you.
TEAM Mill, Estates and Livestock Pens are cheaper and build much more quickly.
Is that the smell of Coffee? Your ranged infantry move faster.
Villagers train faster and become cheaper.
This unit gets stronger with more allied mercenaries and outlaws nearby.
Enables powerful cavalry improvements at the Arsenal.
Powerful Berber improvements can now be researched at the Arsenal.
Due to their tannable hides, livestock now grant a small sum of coin when harvested.
This unit gets stronger with more allied native warriors nearby.
All your Berber Archers become Berber Arquebusiers.
Provides TEAM Mosques with unique improvements.
Native warriors' attack versus buildings greatly increased.
Burning damage inflicts further damage after the target was hit.
You receive a free goat with all your shipments, starting with this one.
Desert Raider who can plunder buildings for resources. Good against buildings.
Sultan of the Sa'adi dynasty and leader of the Moroccan army.
An aura that increases the speed of the allies around you.
The Doum Palm flourishes in hot dry regions where little else grows. Harvest for wood.
The Acacia is a large canopied tree native to most of Africa. Harvest for wood.
Nile Bank long rollover. Harvest for wood.
Palm trees growing along the Nile. Harvest for wood.
Fig Trees have been cultivated since ancient times and grow wild in dry and sunny locations. Harvest for wood.
TEAM Universities trickle Influence and Experience faster.
Can build a House, Trading Post, Livestock Market, or Port
Trade Builder that can build a House, Trading Post, Livestock Market, or Port for free
Palace, Town Center and University hitpoints improved.
Palace, Town Center and Mountain Monastery hitpoints improved.
Trick enemy units into attacking each other
