Towers gain a gunpowder attack, which inflicts more damage.
Towers get a cannon attack and more hitpoints.
Granaries can’t be built too closely together.
Gascenya, Shotel Warrior and Neftenya attack and hitpoints increased. Training time decreased.
Javelin Rider and Oromo Warrior attack and hitpoints increased. Training time decreased.
Fulani Archer and Javelin Rider attack and hitpoints increased. Training time decreased.
Raider and Lifidi Knight attack and hitpoints increased. Training time decreased.
A powerful, agile mercenary warship that fires faster at close range. Inflicts high damage.
Enables Falconets, Culverins and Mortars to be purchased using Influence.
Enables Organ Guns and Culverins to be purchased using Influence.
This improvement cannot be researched during the Treaty period.
This shipment cannot be sent during the Treaty period.
To arms once more! We will not let them take us alive.
This day will mark a new era in the history of Ethiopia.
I have come to the same conclusion.
We have purchased a few guns to turn the tides of war.
We will trample anyone who dares to oppose us!
My army is on the march to your aid.
I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears, and excellent Ethiopian coffee.
I have no men to help you with!
My army is still recovering from its most recent victory.
How can they oppose the might of Ethiopia? We must teach them a lesson!
None of the US federal states is a match for the power of my Ethiopian allegiances!
The Aztecs hoped that the steep steps of their pyramids would intimidate my warriors. Little did they know that our homeland is full of mountains!
Ha! That's what happens when you leave the emperor's letters unanswered.
It looks like the Dutch should have invested their gold in me rather than in their downfall! Ha!
This devious Ethiopian prince wanted this land to fall into chaos, only I could stop him!
Ethiopia simply has a better emperor than France.
A kaiser is no match for the king of kings.
The Hausa queen fought like a true lioness, but even she must realize that I tame all lions - and lionesses.
I need to go feed the hyenas. Let us resolve this Haudenosaunee revolt quickly?
I used to be a successful outlaw myself, but in order to build an empire one must change.
Our Ottoman neighbors should not have crossed our borders to steal our cattle!
The Portuguese used to help us. It was foolish of them to underestimate us now!
The Russians sold us their best mortars, and with them their chance of victory!
The Lakota warriors are on their last legs. Finish them off! My lions and hyenas are hungry.
Do the Spanish have a queen who wishes to discuss their surrender with us?
The Swedish king loses his temper too easily. If he kept a cool head like me he may have had a chance!
I asked my princes why we cannot bring our mighty mortars. They told me that the Inca live as high in the mountains as we do.
Soon there will be nothing left of the Chinese Empire – and the Ethiopian Empire will take it all!
Japanese katana blades are not as curved as our shotels, that's why they never stood a chance.
The Indians could have made formidable trading partners. Now, they will be formidable vassals.
This United States president has gained more allegiances than I. We should destroy his white palace!
Cuauhtemoc has proven himself a great commander, but I am still the greatest!
The British have a vast empire. Shall I introduce myself?
The war chests of the Dutch will not run dry anytime soon – and they are not here to trade.
This enemy Ethiopian prince has allied with foreign powers to steal my throne! Attack now!
Do you hear that? The French cavalry must be preparing for a charge. Brace yourselves!
The German carts and wagons are outrunning our hardened feet. Faster, everyone! Faster!
I think the Hausa queen cut my letter into pieces with her sword – just as she plans to do with us!
The Haudenosaunee fight like us, but only one can be triumphant!
The Mexicans have God's blessings and the devil's weapons. I shall consult our priests and princes for advice!
The Ottomans control almost everything around us. We should disrupt their cannon production!
Those Portuguese think that they can just sail over the sea and claim our land? We must pull ourselves together and fight back!
I have imported the most powerful artillery from Russia so they cannot use it against us.
I do not think that the Lakota will pledge their allegiance to me anytime soon. Our territorial disputes are proving difficult.
The Spanish steel is resilient. I will instruct my warriors to flip their Shotel blades to sting like bees.
The Swedes have an unfair advantage! I would crush them if the gunpowder supplies could climb our mountains faster!
The Inca warriors are as fierce as mine, but Ethiopians always know a secret mountain path to surprise the enemy!
Banner armies are about to invade our lands. How do we counter those?
The Japanese army will mercilessly ravage our lands if we do not push back with faith, blood and iron.
Indian Sepoys and Elephants have been spotted! I will unleash the bees on the elephants. (laughs) –  Can you take on the Sepoys?
With age comes wisdom, strength, faith. Once I advance, I will lead us into a new age of empires!
I have sent you a letter asking to send me advisors to teach my people how to advance through the ages like you.
There is nothing more to do in the first age. Let us move on!
Follow in my footsteps and age up soon. Some of my greatness might rub off on you.
I have built a large economy before aging up, to fund an even larger army.
Welcome to the next age! Now that you can also build an army, the enemy will have no chance!
My army is crushed; my empire is in ruins. Let us quit now, I will not fall into enemy hands!
Send me your men, I require assistance to repel an enemy expedition.
They call me Tewodros the Second, but I am second to no one!
Our empires stand on the shoulders of giants. I, Tewodros, am one of them.
Against all odds, we will remain victorious!
This will be child's play for a true heir of Solomon!
With our forces combined, we cannot lose!
You proved yourself a great general. I permit you to offer me advice.
Have you had enough and decided to join me?
I, Tewodros, will protect you, just like my other subjects.
Now that we have learned the lay of the land, we have an advantage.
Follow my plan this time and things will go more smoothly than last time.
To glory once more! The enemy cannot stop a Solomonic king and his trusted allies.
My prince was taken captive, I got him back, but they have my coin instead, I will prepare an army to take back what is mine.
I assume that you will pay me back with interest?
I look very much forward to showing you my riches, because they are vast. I will send you a sample.
My cooks have prepared some Ethiopian delicacies.
I will send a grain shipment of teff.
Wood is on the way as we speak.
I hope that you will build something worthwhile with the wood that we supply.
When I am finished with the enemy base, there will be blood!
Today, I want to destroy something beautiful. How about the town of our dear enemy?
I will not allow the enemy to gather local support any longer!
Their trade is their weakness. I will strike now and cut them off from any future shipments.
Let us join our forces. They cannot stop a strike of our combined might!
My base will be bigger and better than ever, just like the army that I will build from it.
An expansion for my empire is overdue. I will build a new town center to spread my influence.
My rich gold mines are filling my treasury, I can send you coin – in exchange for military support.
We are preparing a feast and can send you a pot of injera and some flatbread. Coffee?
We can send you some fine ebony.
The king of kings always has your back. My men are on the way.
While we have a break, let us enjoy some honeyed wine and a banquet.
He who has nothing to do, scatters and gathers. And also – builds his empire.
Spare a coin for a poor old warlord?
We need more food for our royal banquet. A cow would be great!
The Lord has requested that I construct a monastery in the mountains. Could you send me some wood?
Thanks to your gold, my army will be equipped with the latest weaponry.
This will make a fine feast. Come, join me!  – Coffee or honeyed wine?
Many thanks, I send you my blessings in return.
Your resources are appreciated. May your divine judgment be merciful.
That shipment of lumber leaves little to be desired.
It is said that you can rise from rags to riches in North America. Perhaps I shall start all over as an outlaw again?
The Aztecs are about to do the impossible and defeat us!
Perhaps I should not have tried to become pen-friends with the British queen. What a foolish idea!
The sailors in Amsterdam are dancing to celebrate our demise.
Those stubborn enemy princes will plunge Ethiopia into chaos again if they expel a unifier like me!
The hooves of the French horses will bring us before our maker if we do not act soon.
Our fate is intertwined with that of the Germans. Only one empire will prevail through blood and iron.
I fear that we will soon be added to Amina's collection of petty kingdoms. Do you speak Hausa?
Perhaps we should have built our houses longer as well. It seems to work for the Haudenosaunee.
The Mexicans transformed from outlaws into soldiers much faster than I did from outlaw to emperor.
The Ottomans were lucky to have constructed their bombards earlier! I was still missing wheels for the mortars!
The Portuguese fought with us once. Now, as our enemies, they know our weaknesses too well.
Russia helped us modernize our military, now they throw us back to the Stone Age.
Lakota warriors are brave, but let us show them what we are capable of when we are cornered!
Why are the Spanish even here, did the pope sign off on this? I shall write a letter of complaint!
God has sent us an eleventh plague: The Swedish army of death fed by insatiable farmyards.
No real warrior would fight with poison, but we are really losing to the Inca poisoned arrows.
We are in serious trouble. Our influence is waning while the Chinese are buying the consulates empty with their export surplus!
The Japanese are getting so strong without eating game meat. What is their secret?
I should have traded with India earlier, their spices would have invigorated my army!
My warriors lose track of who the enemy is. Are these immigrants also United States citizens? They do help them!
Can we make the Aztecs an offer of peace before they turn us into an offering to their gods?
Must the Ethiopian and British Empires fall into ruin before the queen grants me an audience?
My empire is burning, but I also see the Dutch going up in smoke.
This Ethiopian traitor just had more luck with his allegiances! I am still the best emperor!
Three musketeers might be all that they can muster, but those are not ordinary soldiers!
Those Germans might not have the most advanced army, but they sure are advancing!
The Hausa kingdoms are divided, but unlike for us, it was not to their disadvantage.
Haudenosaunee riders are roaming our lands and stealing our cattle. They must not have enough to eat!
My people started praying in the Mexican cathedrals. They said that our rock churches are too cold.
The Ottomans cannot afford many cannons, but even in low numbers they sure pack a punch!
That was unfair! The Portuguese knew how we fought before we even were an empire!
These Russians have no manners. They did not even send a letter to declare war!
The Lakota have lost the support of their other nations, but we did not have any to begin with.
The Spanish lancers are unexpectedly effective at attacking mills and granaries. Now we have nothing to eat!
The Swedes occupied all important mountains with their torps. There was no space left to build a monastery.
I am not afraid of gunfire, but the pling of that bowstring scares me.
We could have had great trading relations with the Chinese, but instead they doomed us both.
How did we end up fighting Japan? This was a terrible mistake for both of us.
Let us make peace with the Indians to resume our trade relations. The spice must flow.
Who knew that warfare could be so complicated?
Do not give up hope yet! We can recover, even if it takes a miracle to help us out.
I have spread my influence from sea to sea. There is no way that we can lose now.
As a man I am flawed, but as an emperor I am perfect.
You know, I am a master tactician and there is no other way to word it.
O father, why have you forsaken me?! I cry that all we can do is resign.
Regret, like the tail, comes at the end when all is lost. Let us surrender.
This is when the battle's lost and won. Let us surrender before the set of sun.
Take up your shields and mount your steeds. It is time to attack their trade routes!
What are they planning to do with all of these allies? Are we getting rushed?
The first of many, my friend.
You are a skilled treasure hunter.
The point is, you can never be too greedy.
Pride cannot replace a dinner. Even if that means eating what you found on the ground.
Do not forget to fight with all that spelunking.
What?! A treasure in my base ... is clearly my treasure!! Do not affront Tewodros' wrath again.
Are the locals here capable warriors? Maybe I should invite them to my palace.
It never hurts to have more helping hands.
Not the same quality that I am used to, but it should do the trick.
Fate can always spare a coin for an old warhorse like me!
Only he who is not hungry says that the coconut has a hard shell.
Don't mind if I do. It's the Lord's doing.
This will do a fine addition to my collection!
A friendly local will help us on our quest for glory!
More followers for the true Solomonic dynasty.
That was close. My wood was almost out of stock.
Do not blame God for creating the tiger, just thank him for not giving it wings. Then build a tall wall.
It will not be long until the enemy pays tribute and sends their offer of surrender!
How can this cowardice be rewarded? Come and face me like a real warrior!
Soon our efforts will be rewarded with the finest porcelain, silk, and spices that these lands have ever seen!
Your technological prowess is pointless if you have no means to use it.
Did you get a nice cup of Ethiopian coffee in between? I could have paused for you!
Still lingering in earlier ages? I prefer more advanced technologies.
Why all the rush? Relax a little, no worries. I am going to win anyway!
Have you spied on us to advance your civilization? No, I forgot, you only learned to train spies just now.
Take your time, I don't mind an easy win every once in a while.
Your remote town will never be able to sustain itself like my mountain monasteries.
A close friend can become a close enemy.
When you are pepper, I am mustard; when you are a needle, I am a knife!
Two armies enter, one army leaves. And then I will have tea with the queen.
You too shall be slain by my sword.
You may be talented, but you are not Tewodros.
To one who knows no better, a small garden is a forest. This time, I know the map like my own pocket!
Needed to call your friends because you can't take me down on your own?
Regret, like a tail, comes at the end. And soon you will meet yours.
What a nice explorer you have there. It would be a shame if something... happened to him.
It is foolish to start a fire just to see the flames. Are you a fool to challenge a great warrior like me?
The prey enters the lion's den — and the lion is hungry!
A worthy opponent! Our battle shall be legendary!
Thorns prick lightly the man who walks slowly. Your army will provide but a tickle.
Living is worthless for one without a home, and now I am trapped in purgatory!
Where there is no shame, there is no honor. You, indeed, have neither!
Everything the light touches is my kingdom. And I am about to bring you enlightenment.
I do not attack your strategic decision making, but there is plenty of subject matter there.
Today you have been the stronger lion. Shall we agree to a truce?
I will pledge my allegiance to the righteous man who does not oppress. Is that you?
You had the choice to let me win peacefully. You have chosen... poorly!
The first might just be your last. Appreciate it while you can.
These worldly possessions will not help you find peace.
Vanity of vanities; all is vanity.
Hey, I was going to eat that! I just got a new shipment of spices overseas! My meal is ruined!
Your greed will be your downfall, bandit! I see through your dirty game!
Robbers like you shall be brought to justice!
You think that you can steal from me?! I will teach you a lesson, by stealing your throne!
Those poor locals will never see the glory and grace of a true king of kings! Pity.
May their souls receive mercy, for they have been deceived.
Steal more wood and one day you may wake up with a tiger in your room.
I fear it might take your men longer to erect these walls than for mine to destroy them.
The locals have welcomed me. They also gladly help me devise your demise.
My country will grow rich from trade, while we watch your empire fade into insignificance.
What is taken for oneself is usually not a small piece.
It looks like fate tossed a coin to its emperor.
My people say that they have a cow in the sky, but cannot drink her milk. I think I found where it landed!
Your lands, like this treasure, will soon be in my pockets.
Sorry, but there is nothing for you under the sun.
These natives were happy to find the better leader.
These villagers are lucky to have found a leader as pious and humble as me.
More followers have joined my flock.
This piece of lumber was granted to me by the grace bestowed upon my throne.
My people have been allies of the natives for centuries. Do not fool yourself into thinking that they are your friends.
My trade, your trade, who cares? Soon enough I will use our trade route as it pleases me.
You have stolen our trading sites! I will not allow this folly to continue another moment!
A partner in business will not put an obstacle before it. You do not seem to be a partner in my business.
There is no time left! Summon your fastest riders to break the enemy trade monopoly!
Defend the Trading Posts to secure our trade monopoly!
If you need an army or to break through walls, Queen Amina is just the right ally to ask.
I will personally lead the cavalry charge!
They will march all day if they have to.
Queen Amina does as she pleases.
My army is currently on a distant campaign. We will have to wait for its return.
I am still assembling my forces.
We failed to protect our trade routes!
The land of the free will soon be free — of Americans.
The Aztec priests could not predict the fall of their own empire, but the griots are already singing about my victory!
I think the British were actually cheering me when they chanted 'Long live the queen!' — right?
Dutch coins were made from African gold, now  — we take back what is ours!
If an Ethiopian king of kings is defeated by a queen, then what does that make the queen?
I have heard that the French enjoy a game called chess. My next strategy will be ... the queen's gambit!
The discordant German cities will now suffer the fate I helped the Hausa cities avert through conquest. Humiliation!
No Hausa man is a match for a queen like me! I will end this affair with a blow from my sword!
Once I conquer the Haudenosaunee nations, I will have defeated more players than you! Ha!
Hasta la vista, the Mexicans yelled. Hasta la vista indeed!
Without access to gunpowder, Ottoman overconfidence vanishes like water in the desert!
The Portuguese civilization is sinking, just like their navy off the shores of Africa!
No Russian army is large enough to withstand the charge of the mighty Hausa cavalry!
All of those bird feathers are only helping the Lakota flee faster!
As it turns out, a kola nut is still harder to crack than a Spanish infantry formation!
The Swedes can run again and build another ten Torps, but then we will burn down another ten Torps!
The Inca can hide in their hills for a while, but they will find nothing but despair up there.
So much experience with gunpowder, but the Chinese have nothing left to show for it.
The Japanese have run out of Ashigaru Musketeers. Now is the time to strike!
The Tuareg who swore me allegiance report that the Indian camels look sickly and exhausted from battling my superior Tuareg camels!
These Americans sure like their card games — and their immigrants seem more useful than my allegiances!
The Aztec War Chief has summoned a big army of foot soldiers. I shall exert my influence to obtain some artillery.
Water does not sour without a cause — and the British seem to rule the land and the sea.
Ready your torches! We have many Dutch banks to burn!
The Ethiopian king of kings wants to add all Hausa kingdoms to his collection. It is time to teach him a lesson!
The French horsemen seem even more heavily armored than my Lifidi knights. Sparks will fly once our armies clash!
I have heard that the Germans are usually a divided people like us, but now they have my undivided attention.
The enemy Hausa ruler fights like a lion! Does he not know that a lioness is much better at hunting?
The Haudenosaunee are on the prowl like hungry hyenas, and our villagers are nervous.
The Mexican guerilla warfare is starting to annoy me. Time to sweep them off with a charge of my horsemen!
The Ottoman cannons will soon be destroying our beautiful gates if we do not stop them!
The Portuguese thought that they would get rich from our gold but found nothing — but the iron of our weapons.
Soon, it will be Russia's time to attack! Our walls must hold and we must be ready to counterattack.
My Lifidi cavalry is too slow to catch the swift Lakota horsemen. Maybe we need something other than armored horses?
Spain is expanding its borders and wants to steal our resources! I will make them pay for that!
The Swedish king has prepared for war! Avoid the artillery barrages and infantry charges. Raid his farmyards instead!
Watch out! The hills have eyes and the Inca warriors — could be anywhere!
The Chinese fire more arrows than there are grains of sand in the desert. Invest in armor and fast horses!
The Japanese daimyos began a feud with my emirs that turned into a major conflict. I am exerting my influence to end it!
The Indian elephants might be smaller than ours, but are still much larger than our horses. Pierce them with spears and javelins!
You must be well-educated to advance so quickly. Did you attend any of the Hausa universities?
Do not worry, my army will advance in the field while you advance in technology.
No need to linger in the first age. You must advance soon if you want to win!
You should advance to a new age if you want to win! Hurry! Convince the people in your town center!
Impressive advances. Are we rushing them?
I have been waiting for you! Now, hurry! Gather some warriors and pressure the enemy!
I do not want to rage, but I do want to quit.
My base is under attack! Send reinforcements, I can hold them off for a while.
I am Queen Amina, feared cavalry warrior, ruler of Zazzau and all of Hausaland. Ride with me to victory!
A real challenge, good. My sword is sharpened!
I like a good practice fight! Get on a horse, charge into battle, swing the sword, and emerge victorious!
You are a fierce warrior. I would welcome you among the ranks of my cavalry if you like.
Now that I am all warmed up, the enemy has no chance against our combined might!
Maybe I can teach you a few tricks, now that we are allies.
Fear not friend, I will keep the enemy at bay.
Same procedure as last game, but with extra map knowledge.
You survived the last battle. Let us gather our forces quickly and strike back harder this time!
If it were not for someone else's influence, a man would die poor. We won as a team last time!
My Nigerian princes requested that I pay an absurd amount of money for their ransom. What frauds!
I have sent you some gold, fresh from the earth of my empire.
Queen Amina does not pay tributes to anybody, rather ... consider this a gift.
Here is food to feed your warriors, but may their hunger for conquests never be sated.
You are in luck! Our recent harvest of kola nuts produced a surplus.
Here. Use this wood to craft spears and build stables so that we can crush our enemies!
Some wood for your next architectural project. I would build stables — or fortifications.
The enemy has an outpost from which to launch attacks. I will shorten the snake with my sword while it is still growing!
This enemy town will no longer oppose us. My army is on the move!
Natives are questioning my authority in these lands. I shall give them a quick demonstration of my power.
This trading post has been reluctant to trade with our merchants. Now I will destroy it!
Let us join our forces to deal a heavy blow to the enemy. Summon all of your riders!
This new war camp will serve as a stepping stone for a new successful campaign.
I will found a new Hausa city-state here that will thrive in trade and hold off the enemy!
My gold mines are making my empire grow wealthy, so I have some bullion to share.
The kola nut harvest was particularly great this year, so I can send you some.
I saved a lot of wood by building earthen walls, so you can have the leftovers.
The Hausa will always be there for a friend in need.
It is dull to sit all day on a throne. I prefer to lead the charge of my troops myself!
My emirs want to decorate the interiors of their palaces to impress potential allies. Can you spare some gold?
Our cattle have caught a deadly disease. Could you send us some food?
I must construct some defensive buildings, do you have any wood?
A wise investment. This will finance the upcoming cavalry raid!
Your help is much appreciated. I will repay you by vanquishing our foes!
It doesn't matter how strong or smart you are. Right now only this tribute matters to me. Have thanks!
Time to build a palace worthy of a Queen!
The United States have teamed up against us and my influence over my vassals is dwindling.
The Aztecs harnessed the spirits of powerful animals like jaguars and pumas who now have encircled the lioness of Hausaland.
The British pretended to be interested only in business, but now they are buying all of our emirates.
Are the Dutch trying to outclass the legendary Mansa Musa? Their supply of gold seems infinite!
The Ethiopian king of kings will soon be king of twice as many kings if his advance is not stopped.
Remember, if the queen falls the game is lost to the French. Is there any maneuver left to save us?
It is a disgrace to think that the German cavalry raids have been more effective than mine.
This Hausa emir... this man I failed to kill is about to end the rule of Zazzau. Another Hausa state will prevail...
Haudenosaunee forces will soon ram down our ancient fortifications. Draw your swords!
Mexico is adding many states to their empire, I fear that the Hausa states might be next!
I wish that the Ottomans would have used their cannons against our foes – and not our beautiful gates.
We are out of resources! The Portuguese Empire has claimed everything — as usual.
Not even the wrathful fire inside of me is warm enough to melt the cold-blooded advances of the Russian forces.
We should enter peace talks with the Lakota. We will lose far fewer villagers after a few rounds of the calumet.
The Spanish are masterful swordsmen and horsemen. Soon, their cannons will destroy our gates!
I was mistaken in thinking that the Swedes only fight with swords like we do. Nothing prepared me for this gunpowder magic!
For all these years, I have never been the ruler of my own dreams. They are filled with angry macemen sweeping across my land.
Our lands are flooded with Chinese banner armies, while I fail to rally new warriors under just a single banner!
The Japanese are preparing an invasion! Resharpen your weapons for the last stand!
The Indian sword whips unarm us by wrapping around our takoba swords. How can we continue to fight?
The Americans invited my warriors to their Saloons to play cards and they have not come back yet.
The Aztec warriors are costumed so well that my 'warriors' confused them with actual predators — and ran.
We do not grow tea here. What does the British empire expect from our lands?
The Dutch strategy is not very original, but money rules the world — and Hausaland.
It does not matter whether the Ethiopians fight with or without gunpowder or sandals. Fierceness wins their battles!
My emirs said the French have very beautiful palaces and that they would rather preserve than destroy them.
The Germans mock us with their display of two-handed swords that frighten the cowards in my ranks!
The palace of the other Hausa ruler is more beautiful and influential than mine. I shall offer my sword to survive in grace.
The Haudenosaunee archers outrange my Fula bowmen and their warchief kicked my emir off his camel. To fight on is hopeless.
My warriors ate too many habanero peppers with the Mexicans and offered no resistance when they stole our cattle.
No matter how many cowrie shells we offered, the Ottomans would always respond with artillery shells.
I begin to believe the reports from the coast. The Portuguese did not need many men to defeat us.
These lands are filled with Russian blockhouses. I cannot leave my town without being shot at.
The only reason that the Lakota could field more horsemen is that they put no effort in building pretty houses like we do.
My men are used to open kola nuts, but the Spanish tercio formation is truly a tough nut to crack, a nut with thorns!
These Swedish Caroleans seem to understand how to use both a musket and a sword. I cannot say the same about my men.
The Inca have denied our merchants entry to their tambos. Without trade, our economy will be left in tatters!
Even now, I hear explosions in the distance. China must be experimenting with its gunpowder again.
My subjects have fallen in love with Japanese food. Now they refuse to fight the hand that feeds them.
The Indians have stolen our livestock. No cattle, no power!
See what happens when I rely on men? Next time, I will do it myself!
Pull yourself up by your bootstraps, we have an army to defeat!
Once more unto the breach, dear friend, once more!
Well played, one final push and their land will fall into our hands.
A final charge of my cavalry will break the last resistance!
War does not determine who is right. Only who is left. And there will be nothing left of us if we don't surrender.
Things are starting to fall apart, we should resign to avert harm from our people.
All of Hausaland has run out of power. We should resign.
That is not like me! I was far too distracted with other matters to think about trade.
The enemy has allied with the natives of these lands, but fear not! My allies are far more formidable fighters.
Two pieces of meat confuse the mind of the fly, I want to capture all treasures at once, but cannot decide where to begin.
And another one. Spend it wisely.
This will make some fine Funkaso for dinner.
You have been gathering so many treasures. I presume that most of them are gifts for me?
Do you really want to start a fight with me over treasures?
A native scout to help out? Ask him about the enemy!
A lonely villager can be easy to forget about. Keep him busy!
Your walls might not be as famous as mine, but you can still build a lot of them with this wood.
A coin treasure to fund my first squadron of cavalry!
A nice food treasure, but I would have preferred a fattened cow. This food will not earn me any influence at the livestock market.
I will compensate you when you need resources, but for now it is key that we thrive as a team!
Try to keep up! I do not need all of the treasures myself, but if no one else takes them, I will.
More followers are flocking to our cause!
We always have use for another helping hand, for every bit helps win the war.
This ancient log will make a fine pillar to hold up my university.
I will to build walls around me so no one can hurt me. Trust me, I am good at walling.
Ha! Was there ever any doubt that the extensive Hausa trade network would supply us?
Rally your armies! Their trade routes must fall or we are doomed!
Our trade empire might even manage to eclipse our military might? Quite a feat.
You do not see the moon because of your height, and your army will not win the war through technology alone.
Did you not hunt for food? If you do not gather the resources to age up soon, you will quickly become the hunted.
Are you too scared of aging up? Do not worry, we can share the same age even if we share nothing else.
Salt laughs at shea butter while the sun shines, but when the rain comes, it is ashamed. Let us see how you fare when the winds of war change.
To some the turtle is wise, to others — it is just a slow animal.
Do not bother aging up any further, for I will rule over your land soon anyways.
Your new town is too far out, and without palace or trade. The next wandering sand dune will bury it.
The larger the pack, the fatter the prey!
Did you really think that the Hausa would let you take over their trade routes without a fight?
I am Queen Amina. Would you rather pledge your allegiance to me or become a part of my sphere of influence?
I am Amina, warrior queen of Hausaland. I will never submit to a man, but I will have my will through the power of trade and the sword.
Some birds avoid water. The duck searches for it. —  But both fear me, the fire!
The tortoise wishes to fight with his fist, but he has no fingers!
Queen Amina has never lost ground, but maybe the hooves of my horses need to hit you harder this time.
You need all of these allies to even the odds against the combined might of the Hausa states?
The alliance against you is ready, but are you?
I hope that you have brought some gifts.
Ah! Enemy soldiers! Walking into a trap.
Yes, please. Come into my town and take a look around. It will be the last time that I open our beautiful gates for you.
My engineers have prepared for this moment, now come and show me what you have!
I see that you have to come to get a taste of my sword! Let us fight it out!
No! No! You may force me to escape, but I will strike back with the help of my Fulani and Tuareg followers!
You are not the first to underestimate African warriors. Time for a first demonstration!
Your town could never be a Hausa state. It is way too ugly for that! — I'll have to destroy it.
The griots and scholars are telling stories about great people, but I have never heard one about — you?
Some people think that I am not real. Let me assure you that I am going to be a real problem for you.
You have fought well. To save my people and towns from destruction, I offer my surrender. Will you accept?
The Hausa would rather make peace than fight with you. Can we come to an agreement?
Ahh! You are forcing the inevitable, usurper! Subjugation through the sword rather than trade!
You can get away with that one, but count yourself lucky if I let you get more than that!
Hey! I had called dibs on that one!
Nice try, but your war chest is never going to be as full as mine. Hm!
It is easy enough to find food, but hard to get away to a place where you can eat it in peace.
Are you going to throw a party? My Yoruba followers are wondering if we could join.
My emirs are looking with envy upon your treasures. They'll demand their share — sooner or later.
How dare you steal from the queen's lands?! Guards! Catch the thief!
Leave with your new friend while you still can. My riders are close on your heels!
You had better treat this villager well. There is no greater crime than an obvious lack of hospitality.
What will you steal next? My people needed this wood to make a fire, to cook — to... construct the queen's walls!
Nobody builds walls like I can, but why would I show you the gaps in yours?
These natives were amazed by the beauty of my palace. One truly cannot blame them for joining me.
Time to trade! There are still trading posts left, but mind you, some of our allied Igbo merchants are merciless negotiators.
If you wanted this, come and take it!
Riches for my emirs to build beautiful palaces, universities — or a powerful army.
Ah, good! I haven't had breakfast yet.
I am only taking what is mine. The tribute to your future queen!
This local scout will show me where to raid you first.
I found a villager who wants to join the winning side. He will do some fine work for me.
Those villagers can be glad that I found them first. Now they can work for me instead of being trampled by my raiders.
More wood, more unit production, more destruction of your empire!
Do you need additional allies to win against me? I will defeat you just the same.
This and all other trade sites fall under my jurisdiction.
Have no troops to achieve victory? I have, and this is the perfect chance to show you.
If you will not come out of hiding, I will force you to.

Noise Damage inflicts damage over time.
Heavily armored Kanuri cavalryman mercenary skilled in the use of muskets. Good against heavy cavalry.
Powerful well-drilled African musketeer mercenary ready to restore order.
Akan warrior firing a powerful old musket.
Berber light cavalry warrior riding a fast camel that terrifies horses. Good against cavalry and artillery. Countered by light infantry.
Powerful African War Chief who gains strength from nearby Native Warriors. Can heal and build. Good against cavalry.
Quick-training archer unit that loses hitpoints, becoming less effective over time.
Armored cannoneer mercenary who fires a heavy musket inflicting siege damage.
Powerful, heavy Mercenary Warship with very high hitpoints.
Egyptian mercenary equipped with an automatic-fire gun mounted on a camel. Good against infantry, particularly Heavy Infantry.
Very powerful, but slow training heavy ranged javelin infantry. Attacks closer targets faster. Carries a large shield for extra protection against ranged attacks. Good against cavalry.
Somali militiaman of the Darood clan. Specialized at countering artillery and ships.
Heavy ranged Somali javelineer. Attacks closer targets faster. Counters cavalry from range.
Fast Sudanese infantry which tosses knives from range to inflict melee damage. Attacks faster at close range. Good against heavy infantry, particularly in melee.
Quick-training and fast moving powerful lancer that slowly loses hitpoints. Attacks faster as he loses hitpoints.
Mercenary Rider of the Berber Zenata armed with a shield and javelins. Good against cavalry and artillery.
Heavy hand cavalry mercenary from Sudan with many hitpoints and dual armor. Good against light infantry and artillery.
Battle-tested woman bodyguard mercenary of the Dahomey armed with rifle to counter infantry. Attacks faster at close range by throwing knives.
Skilled archer from the desert with a long range to hit distant targets, but also shoots fast at short range. Good against heavy infantry.
A secretive stranger from the desert.
Hardy javelin warrior equipped with a large shield. The shield grants different armor types when switching combat stances. Good against cavalry.
Berber Villager that excels at gathering natural resources but is poor at agricultural gathering. Stronger and faster in groups.
Berber warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Salty camel enraged from carrying heavy bags of salt through the desert. Constructs a Salt Mine.
Charged Ability: Delivers a powerful ranged attack.
Zenatas, Berber Camel Riders and Sultans gain a charged musket attack.
All Villagers gain more hitpoints. Berber Nomads gain so much bonus damage against Cavalry that they can defend themselves from cavalry raids.
Your military efforts are joined by a Berber Sultan, that can respawn for free at your Home City military arrival point and train Berber mercenaries.
Grants a steady Coin trickle which grants more resources the more food and wood you have stockpiled.
Enemy Military units become slower when approaching the immediate vicinity of Mills, Estates, Farms, Rice Paddies and Fields.
Hero Berber Sultan. Gains attack and hitpoints from nearby Mercenaries and Outlaws.
Yoruba warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Yoruba Legionaries inflict poison damage when attacking at melee.
Each Yoruba native unit spawns a clone of itself.
All villagers gather wood faster. All native and civilian units heal slowly when close to trees or berry bushes.
All short-duration units (such as Eso Riders, Militamen, Irregulars, etc) keep 25% of their hitpoints and lose them less quickly.
Ships 2 Outpost Wagons. Walls and Gates grant XP upon being built.
Akan warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Your military efforts are joined by an Akan Tufohen, that can respawn for free at your Home City military arrival point.
Infantry training and movement speed improved. The Tufohen takes less time to respawn at the Home City arrival point.
Ships 1 Gold Prospector Wagon. All villagers gather coin faster from Mines.
All villagers gather food faster from Berry Bushes, Mills, Farms, Rice Paddies, and Fields.
All Food is converted into 50% Wood and 50% Coin.
Somali warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Trade Routes income improved. Villagers and Fishing Boats gather coin faster.
Foot Archers and Infantry armed with rifles attack faster in melee.
Increases the Build Limit of Frontier Fortifications (Outpost, War Hut, Castle, etc). Siege units and Warships inflict more damage against Frontier Fortifications.

Transforms into a Commerce Age economic building or Outpost.
Allows Askaris to be recruited from Somali Trading Posts.

All infantry get additional armor against ranged attacks and all hand infantry become cheaper.

Sudanese warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Walls (except Gates) become free to build, but take longer to be built or upgraded.
Walls (except Gates) are built and upgraded faster, and now cost half of their base cost as Food.
Mills, Estates, Farms, Rice Paddies, Haciendas and Fields cost less Wood and are built faster.
Ships 2 Red Sea Wagons (constructs most buildings).

All Cavalry and Shock Infantry get additional armor against melee attacks.
Allows Askaris and Sennar Horsemen to be recruited from Sudanese Trading Posts.
Delivers a number of Lifidi Knights and enables them to be trained in the Commerce Age.
Emirs inflict considerably more damage against Heroes and gain additional attack and hitpoints from nearby enemy military units.
Increases Fulani Archer range and siege range.
Improves Villager hitpoints and attack speed in melee combat. Villagers will tend to prefer wrestling (melee attack) in combat and only shoot at particularly long distance targets.
Lifidi Knights and Raiders ride faster and their attacks now inflict area damage, especially in trample mode.
Ships 1 Lifidi Knight per Palace and 1 Raider per War Camp and Watch Tower.
Maigadi attack and train speed improved. They now cost partially Coin and Influence.
Unlocks a new ability for your Emir. Tsetse Sabotage: may be used to sabotage an enemy Military Building, considerably slowing down its production and research rates.

Ships a Palace and allows Palaces to be built one age earlier.
Ships 1 Palace Wagon and tokens of 300 Influence. Increases Palace build limit by 1.

Walls and Gates return their cost when destroyed. Gates and wall technologies are cheaper.

Native Warrior, Outlaw, and Mercenary combat improved.
Native Warriors, Mercenaries and Outlaws are 15% cheaper, including shipments of them.
All mines last longer and their locations are temporarily revealed for 3 minutes.
You receive a free Fulani Archer for all your past and future shipments.
Each Raider and Lifidi trained so far grants a fraction of its cost as Influence into the stockpile.
Griot hitpoints, speed and build limit increased.
Griots inflict more damage. Instruments now intimidate enemies in a greater area.
Enables Levies to be called from Watch Towers and garrison inside them. Units garrisoned in a Watch Tower improve its attack by 10%

Villagers gather resources from Fields faster and construct them more quickly.
Villagers gather Coin from Fields, Estates and Rice Paddies faster.
Grants a small sum of food for each of your fields on the map. Improves food gathering on fields.
Increases the maximum food total Herdables can fatten to.
Particularly fattened Cattle containing 750 Food that can fatten further.

Ships a number of Kanuri Guard mercenaries (Dragoons). Enables them to be trained from the Palace where they cost partially Coin and Influence.
Villagers gather Food from huntable and herdable animals faster.
Neftenyas can be trained in the Commerce Age. Increases the attack of all Gunpowder Infantry.
Ethiopian Ranged infantry attack and hitpoints increased.
Neftenyas gain additional hitpoints and are slightly more resilient to cannon fire.
Enemy Infantry and Cavalry grant a small sum of Coin in addition to Experience when defeated.
Grants your Ras the Mayhem ability that can trick enemy units within a small area into attacking each other.
The Kill XP you earn from fighting slightly reduces the cost of each Age-up Alliance you research. The XP your Rases (Heroes) earn reduces the cost much more than other units.
