 • Third time: 1 Gatling Gun
Put out another call to arms! We will not succumb to such cowardice!
Parade with me, my brave fellows — we will have them soon!
Interwoven as is the love of liberty with every ligament of your hearts, the recommendation of mine is necessary to fortify and confirm.
Our artillery will soon be on its way.
A cavalry detatchment is riding to your aid as we speak.
A handpicked regiment of our best men will arrive shortly.
We do not like to be taxed excessively; be careful what you ask of us.
It is not in my strategic interest.
I have thus far avoided the necessity of those overgrown military establishments, which, under any form of government, are inauspicious to liberty.
My fellow Americans would rather fight to their deaths.
It is infinitely better to have a few good men than many indifferent ones, but I have none to spare for now.
Our trading posts have been raided! I will dispatch an expedition to punish the perpetrators!
The Aztecs' logistics are worse than ours during the Revolutionary War. Let us put an end to this.
Can I offer you some tax-free tea while we watch the British Empire collapse?
Even the Dutch will concede that the best thing about New Amsterdam was that it became New York!
Those French white flags are no match for our muskets.
Do you think that the Germans will learn after we have defeated them once?
I hope that we can lay our animosities with the Haudenosaunee to rest once their people accept defeat and bury the hatchet.
Let us show the Ottomans what a real bombardment looks like!
The Portuguese Empire overextended itself. What chance does a single empire stand against one republic out of many states?
The last Russian soldiers are hiding in a wooden fort, but I have already ordered my men to tear down this wall!
Unfortunately the Lakota were led astray against us. When the bloodshed ends, we will have a lot to learn from their ways.
Neither the angels nor Saint Francis will be able to help the Spanish avert their defeat now.
The old Swedish Empire will soon join New Sweden as the next addition to our union.
My soldiers are experienced in taking redoubts. The last Inca fortifications will be overcome just the same!
Let us give China a taste of its own gunpowder.
The Japanese may have surprised us in the beginning, but they did not have the endurance to fight for long.
Those Indian elephants might have scared my militiamen, but the Continental Army cannot be routed so easily.
Many nations admire eagles. It seems that the Aztec eagle may very well beat our own if we do not act soon.
The number of British Redcoats is quite intimidating. Fortunately, their red color makes them easy targets!
The Dutch fight so vigorously, it is as if they consider New Amsterdam to be their actual capital.
The French are going too far by bringing their revolution to us — but I suppose that we might have inspired them.
A deadly offensive by all the Germans is imminent. As if these Hessian mercenaries weren't enough!
The Haudenosaunee have mustered a great army! We should prepare our own forces at once.
The Ottomans do not bombard you with questions, for they have far more practice in bombarding towns. Our towns.
The Portuguese have some good shots in their army. Even our best firearms seem to be no match.
The Tsar's forces are preparing for a rush. Be vigilant!
The Lakota have grown in power! We should have avoided bloodshed by forcing them to surrender sooner.
The Spanish have assembled a sizable army! Let us see how their tercios hold up against our infantry tactics.
The Swedes are expanding their empire. We must push them back!
We must reconsider our strategy. The Inca hurl our musket balls back at us — with great effect.
Chinese inventors are trying to outsmart us. We must not allow that to happen!
Japan is building up its empire. Let us entice them out of their isolation — it will prove quite profitable.
It seems that we are not the only nation that is growing rich after expelling the British.
Good work, my friend. We will follow your example shortly.
Would you mind sharing your scientific progress with us?
My generals have advised me not to linger in the first age. Perhaps you should take that advice as well.
Your scientists have some catching up to do.
Perseverance and spirit have done wonders in all ages.
Welcome to the enlightened era — we have been waiting for you.
Is it wise to continue our fight?
My settlements are under attack! Send your army, and my militias will buy time to organize a defense!
The time is now near at hand which must probably determine whether Americans are to be freemen or slaves.
Liberty, when it begins to take root, is a plant of rapid growth.
The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph.
My men will still fight with the same vigor, even if it only means winning faster.
You have proven yourself a wise general. I am pleased to have your expertise on our side.
I, this day, declare with the utmost sincerity, I do not think myself equal to the presence I am honored with.
I am pleased to see that you have decided to join our alliance.
Fear not, old friend — I will bring us victory once more.

It is not a little pleasing, nor less wonderful to contemplate, that both armies are brought back to the very point they set out from, and the offending party in the beginning is now reduced to the use of the spade and pickaxe for defence.
Let us work together, and we will be unstoppable this time.
Let us prove once more that our alliance cannot be defeated.
They dared to take my explorer hostage. I had no choice but to pay an outrageous ransom!
Few men have the virtue to withstand the highest bidder.
Check in your pocket — the quarter is me too.
Our granaries are full enough, we have sent what we can spare.
Oley Valley's fields have produced enough of a surplus to feed both of us for some time.
We sent you about one redwood tree. Knock on wood!
Our great wilderness has all the lumber that we need.
My army will strike their bases to cut off further reinforcements!
We will burn their homes to the ground, and the rest of their empire shall soon follow.
This punitive expedition will teach the locals to never dare to side with the enemy again!
There is a trade embargo against you — we are about to enforce it.
Experience teaches us that it is much easier to prevent an enemy from posting themselves than it is to dislodge them after they have got possession.
I will increase my military production. The enemy will be overwhelmed by our masses.
My pioneers will quickly establish a new town center.
We have a gold rush in our lands. I will share some of the nuggets with you.
Thanks to steel plows and canals, we have an abundance of food.
We had to clear some forests to expand our empire of liberty — have some lumber.
Washington will always help an ally in need.
To be prepared for war is one of the most effectual means of preserving peace.
It seems that the enemy has decided to avoid treading on us today.
I am under no apprehension of a capital injury from any other source than that of the continual depreciation of our money. I am thus required to ask for support in foreign currency.
My armies have run out of supplies! We need food to strengthen our numbers.
Our military flutists have no instruments with which to play music, for our wood stock is diminishing. Can you spare some?
Your payment has been received. I owe you a great deal.
Thanks to your supplies, we will fight the enemy with renewed vigor.
Thank you. I owe you some war bonds.
Your gifts for my present and future felicity are received with gratitude.
Many thanks. I've passed the wood to my engineers. They wouldn't stop talking about 'repeating guns' and 'breechloaders'.
The Aztecs have sent us the shield, arrows, and cloaks. I fear that our defeat is imminent.
I heard that the British King George found me quite revolting, but I believe that is why we are losing.
How do the Dutch successfully control such a vast empire from such a tiny spot in Europe?
I hope that we are pardoned by the French.
The Germans seem very upset about not being able to read our laws in their language. I suggest that we let them settle in Pennsylvania!
We have been cut down like a cherry tree.
I am afraid to construct new magazines. The Ottoman artillery barrage is too heavy.
In our history, we never had to fight against the Portuguese. It should have stayed this way.
It was foolish of me to believe that the Russians could be toppled as easily as the British with the mere size of our militia army.
The Lakota are winning. Perhaps we should have listened to the advice of our native scouts.
It seems unlikely that the Spanish are going to decide between California and Texas. They will get them both back.
Did no one tell the Swedes that monarchies are outdated? They were supposed to lose!
It seems like Tupac is still very much alive for the Inca. I think it's best to not get involved in this revolution!
That was not fair! The Chinese have hundreds of years' more experience with gunpowder weapons.
I have a feeling that we should not have given the Japanese a reason to leave their island.
Why did we decide to fight against camels and elephants again?
The Aztecs bribed our naive militiamen with chocolate. This defeat is bittersweet.
We have driven the British into financial ruin as planned, but at what cost?
Losing half of their country to Spain only made those Dutch better at fighting.
Is it too late to return Louisiana for a refund?
My ill-disciplined militiamen agreed to drink with the Germans. Soon we will all eat sauerkraut!
How are we expected to win against a foe that knows these lands like their back pocket?
I knew that it was over when our soldiers started following the Ottoman marching bands rather than our own.
An entire militia regiment was routed by a single Portuguese organ gun. I can already hear the organ music from the funeral.
That was not a fair fight — the Russians were rushing us!
It is time to blow a little big horn of retreat!
My lousy militiamen went home, claiming that the light reflecting off the shiny Spanish armor and weapons made it impossible to aim.
The Swedes brought a knife to a gunfight — and still won.
The Inca lured us into their mountains and ambushed us. My men were already too out of breath to put up a fight.
So many unique units that we just could not counter all of them.
One more of those banzai charges and my nation will be overrun.
The Indians might not have built the most impressive wonders this time, but they impressively defeated my army.
We are outgunned — outmanned — outnumbered — outplanned.
There can be no greater error than to expect, or calculate, upon real favors from nation to nation.
My first wish is to see this plague of mankind, war, banished from the earth.
It is an honor to serve at your side, my friend. Let me know if you are interested in joining the Union.
Do not worry, my friend — war is not for everyone. I can handle this if you wish to stay back and manage your economy for some time.

Though, in reviewing the incidents of my administration, I am unconscious of intentional error, I am nevertheless too sensible of my defects not to think it probable that I may have committed many errors.
The Fire of Freedom is quenched. Let us accept defeat before our nation is nothing but ruins.
I have fought hard for the American dream, but now I must face reality and accept defeat.
They think that they can win without a fight? Let us show them what we think of cowards!
The natives of this region are wise and powerful. I would be prudent to introduce myself to them as well.
Nice find! My explorer is still warming up, it seems.
You can send it to me — I will invest it wisely.
Enjoy your snack and the American way of life.
You are doing well in this scavenger hunt.
I was about to go get that one, but have a nice day.
Recruiting the help of the locals has won many a battle.
You can build some fine architecture with those materials.
Give me liberty — or give me coin!
I discovered where the wild wings are.
You are a capable leader. You do not need this little treasure.
To me, the hunt for treasure fits together perfectly with the pursuit of happiness.
I will recruit some natives. They have valuable skills that will complement my armies.
I am always happy to accept a few more laborers in the Union.
Some lumber to expand further into the wilderness.
Sometimes it is prudent to occupy a position and fortify it.
Hold on just a little longer, and we have this one in the bag!
It looks like it is time to enact my secret master plan.
I hope that this taught you a little lesson in trickery.
You might have the technology, but I have the army.
Do not worry about aging up. We will soon come to civilize your empire.
Is your education system a little behind?
I have decided to delay my advancement to give you a chance.
I am impressed. Will you learn to read next?
We have been waiting for you. Actually, I was about to advance again.
You seem alone. I will send an army to keep you company.
Did you really think that I would confuse my ally's town with yours?
We do not accept such greedy restrictions on our free trade!
The preservation of the sacred fire of liberty is entrusted to the hands of the American people. Are you American?
I will not be going easy on you this time.
Let us see who wins when we are more familiar with the land.
Do you need all of these allies to fight against my United States?
We will not be going easy on you this time.
Welcome to the land of the free. Your explorer is also free to leave.
Your militia does not stand a chance against mine. I am not impressed.
What are you doing here? Providing target practice for my men?
All you have done is to awaken a sleeping giant and fill him with a terrible resolve.
My base is fortified and my men are rested. Are you sure about this attack?
Are you sure that you want to occupy my town? I am good at fighting off oppressors.
Are you sending us men to fill the ranks of our militia army? That is very nice of you.
Is that your state? It seems too small and irrelevant to join the United States of America.
I am George Washington and I believe in life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness — but not for you.
My name is George Washington and I'm the president of the United States of America. And all of these states have united to defeat you.
The unfortunate condition of the persons, whose labour in part I employed, has been the only unavoidable subject of regret.
It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
If you want to do it the hard way, we can arrange that.
Do not expect to get more than that.
You can collect as many treasures as you wish — my army will crush you just the same.
Why are you in such a gold rush? It is just a bad California dream.
Were you starving so badly that you started eating from the floor?
What are you? Some kind of bounty hunter? I shall put this into the Marshal's matters.
Will you keep roaming the country forever or eventually start a real business?
I will not accept such thievery!
Are you bribing the locals? I doubt that they would follow you on their own accord.
I think that those settlers will regret their choice soon enough.
I have no use for such puny treasures.
Are you hiding? Those walls will not keep you safe.
The native inhabitants simply like me better than you.
The first of many — I will build an empire of free trade.
A small prize for a man, but a huge fortune for mankind.
I heard that finding a penny brings luck. This is a good omen.
That is what I call fast food.
It looks like you did not want that one anyways.
I have found so many treasures. I will exhibit this notoriously big collection in the White House.
The locals offer their friendship. We should count ourselves fortunate.
A new wave of immigrants just arrived. We have great work for them improving the United States!
We welcome those yearning to breathe free. I am sure that more will join soon.
I think that I found about half of a redwood tree, and will put it to good use.
We do not need any help to triumph over your puny empire.
This trading post will not enable you to rise from rags to riches, but you can wipe the place clean and get out of there.
You think that you can defeat us when it comes to trade? I doubt that.
We do not need violence when we can win with the power of capitalism.

New Sweden, New Netherlands, and New England all overlapped in modern-day Delaware.
William Penn and Tamanend of the Lenape signed the Great Treaty in 1682, agreeing that their peoples would live in a state of perpetual peace.
Important seaports connected early America with international trade routes.

According to legend, in 1540 a young native showed Hernando de Soto how gold was mined, melted, and refined by his people — but it wasnt until the 1830s that the gold rush spread from Carolina to Georgia.
The First Company Governor's Foot Guard was organized in October 1771 and is the oldest extant military organization in the United States.
In 1777, General Henry Knox founded the Springfield Armory, the nation's first federal armory and a site of many innovations in manufacturing and industrialization for almost two centuries.
Together with Rhode Island's "liberty of conscience", the Maryland Toleration Act of 1649 was one of America's first examples of institutionalized religious tolerance.
Founded in 1526, San Miguel de Gualdape was the first European settlement in what became the continental United States.
Two companies of New Hampshire rangers earned repute during their fight for American independence under the leadership of the brave Major Benjamin Whitcomb.
The first permanent English settlement in the Americas was Jamestown, Virginia, established in 1607.
The history of the city of New York began when the Dutch Fort Amsterdam developed into the town of New Amsterdam, a predecessor to the culturally rich modern metropolis.
How a whole colony disappeared from Roanoke Island after 1587 remains a mystery, but the leading theory suggests that they ran out of supplies and were fully integrated into the native population.
Rhode Island's textile and manufacturing industry provided work for many, primarily attracting French-Canadian, Italian, Irish, and Portuguese immigrants.
Vermont's name stems from its New France origins, "verts monts" describing the state's characteristic "green mountains".
The plant known today as "Kentucky bluegrass" was originally introduced by Spanish settlers, and was integral to the region's ability to raise livestock and horses of renowned quality.
Overmountain Men were American frontiersmen from west of the Appalachian Mountains who put up a fierce resistance against the British during the fight for independence.
A system of French trading posts comprised the first European-style infrastructure in the Ohio wilderness.

In 1803, American representatives wanted to buy the New Orleans area for $10 million. Napoleon countered with $15 million for the entire territory of Louisiana, a realm so vast that its acquisition instantly doubled the size of the United States.

Indiana's Mammoth Internal Improvement Act was an expensive undertaking to open Indiana's wilderness to development. Despite the dire immediate effects on the state's finances, it increased land and produce value more than fourfold in the long term.
The Mississippi River served as a crucial waterway for ironclads, steamboats, and trading vessels alike.
John Deere's 1837 invention of the self-scouring steel plow turned the rich prairie of Illinois into some of the world's most productive and valuable farmland.
Hernando de Soto's 1540 expedition passed through modern day Alabama in search of gold.
Maine, nicknamed "The Pine Tree State", has over 80% forest cover, more than any other US state.
Napoleon Bonaparte gained modern-day Missouri and more from Spain under the Treaty of San Ildefonso.
The Battle of Arkansas Post was the only battle of the American Revolution fought in remote Arkansas.
French voyageurs and coureurs des bois explored and settled in Michigan during the 17th century.
American settlers in Florida rebelled against Spanish rule in 1810, creating the Free and Independent Republic of West Florida that lasted for 90 days.
Dozens of forts were erected in Texas as Spain, France, Mexico, and the United States all strove for territorial control. In later periods, they provided safety for traders and travellers.
Originally a part of French Louisiana, Iowa's French heritage is even referenced in the official state flag.
When the first European explorers arrived, Algonquian and Siouan language-speakers lived in Wisconsin.
US navy ships were often sent to protect US citizens in the conflicts that initially broke out in California.
Early Scandinavian settlers in Minnesota left their mark on its culture as the American nation expanded.

In 1841, the expert trapper and entrepreneur Ewing Young died, leaving considerable wealth but neither an apparent heir nor a system to probate his estate. A meeting followed Young's funeral, during which a probate government was proposed.
Researchers famously termed Kansas to be "flatter than a pancake".

British settlers in West Virginia proposed to form a new territory, "Vandalia". They then sought admission as a state called "Westsylvania", but were originally blocked by Virginia and Pennsylvania, both of whom who claimed the region.
Las Vegas was named by Mexican explorers passing through the region.
The first Transcontinental Railroad passed through Nebraska, establishing many townships along the way.
Colorado has the unique distinction of having had three different governors in one day.
The Dakotas were admitted to the Union simultaneously, President Benjamin Harrison shuffled the statehood papers before signing them so that no one could tell which became a state first.
South Dakota was named after its Lakota and Dakota Native American tribes.
Montana is nicknamed the "Treasure State" for its gold and silver deposits.
European explorers, including the Lewis and Clark Expedition, established the fur trade in Washington, but the state would not be admitted to the Union until nearly a century later.
The settlement of Idaho was spurred by the discovery of gold and expanded to other important metals and minerals found in the area.
Wyoming is the least populous and least densely populated state.
Two Spanish Catholic priests left Santa Fe in 1776, hoping to find a route to the California coast. They traveled as far north as Utah Lake and had friendly encounters with the natives.
Cattle trails led through Oklahoma from neighboring Texas to the railways in the north, from which they supplied cities all over the United States.
The city of Taos Pueblo is likely over a millenium old.
Arizona's state gun is the Colt Single Action Army revolver.
Russia sold its territory in Alaska to the United States in 1867 for $7.2 million, a mere 2 cents per acre.
Hawaii was admitted as a state alongside Alaska, a decade and a half after both territories served as strategic points in the Pacific theater of the Second World War.

Starts with a General who can plant an Inspiring Flag and build Forts instead of Town Centers. Advances in Age by choosing a Federal State that unlocks two powerful unique cards. Has access to Saloons, Sloops, Steamers, and unique Outlaws.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>National guard units:</color>
Chinaco (Charro), Salteador (Vigilante)
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Padre, Insurgente, Salteador, Soldado, Chinaco
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique buildings:</color>
Can build Haciendas and a Cathedral which may research unique improvements.

Born in fiery insurgency against Spanish colonial rule the young Mexican nation asserted itself against numerous revolutions and invasions.
Mexican Padre who will fight for the freedom and wellbeing of his people, even if it means his own demise.

Plants the Mexican flag to boost morale! Nearby military units (excluding artillery) and buildings inflict more damage and are created faster. Flags cannot be planted near starting Town Centers, and only one flag can be planted at a time.
Boosts the morale of nearby Mexican units and must be defended! If captured by enemies, it will be removed from the map.

Tactically planted by a General to boost nearby Mexican units and buildings. If no allied units or buildings are nearby, it can be captured by enemies and removed from the map.
 • Grants +10% Attack Damage to all Units.
 • Grants +10% Attack Damage to all Buildings.
 • Grants +25% Workrate to Military Buildings.
 • Grants +50% Construction speed to all Buildings.
An insurgent peasant armed with whatever they could find. Good against cavalry and buildings.
Stealthy Skirmisher that can see the location of enemies he recently damaged.
Very sturdy, but slow training, Heavy Infantry armed with a musket and grenades.
Heavy cavalry armed with a lance for extra range. Good against skirmishers, and holds its own against cavalry.
Mexican Chinaco attack and hitpoints greatly increased.
Upgrades Renegado to Bandido with a powerful charged action.
Upgrades Pistolero to Desperado with a powerful charged action.
Upgrades Comanchero to Cuatrero with a powerful charged action.
Mexican Church building that can revive a fallen Padre, protects nearby buildings, and has powerful unique upgrades.
Economic building that combines Estate, Mill, and Livestock Pen.
Configure this Hacienda to produce Food.
Configure this Hacienda to produce Coin.
Configure this Hacienda to produce Cows.
Configure this Hacienda to produce Settlers.
Configure this Hacienda to produce Cuatreros.
Configure this Hacienda to produce Chinacos.
Native American Skirmisher that can stun enemy units at a distance with his war cry.
Lenape warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Charged Ability: A war cry that can temporarily stun enemy units at a distance.
War Cry ability takes less time to be recharged.
Villagers gather food from Mills and Farms faster.
Upgrades the "Levy" ability to "Conscription", which can be used to call upon a larger army of Marines, but costs more.
Increases the range of State Militia and Marines and enables Sharpshooters to be trained in the Commerce Age.
Ships an additional Marine for each shipment you have sent so far this game.
Increase attack and hitpoints of ranged infantry.

Manors are cheaper. Improves market sell rates.
Increases the hitpoints of Docks, Fishing Boats, Rowboats, Sloops and Frigates.
Ships a number of State Militia
Ships 2 Outpost Wagons. All existing and newly constructed Outposts spawn 2 State Militia and support +5 population.
Ships 20 State Militia. Allows State Militia to build military buildings.
Native Warriors are trained faster. Ships a number of Native Warriors to you and your allies.
War Chief deals more damage, has more hit points, and increases building hit points.
The Mohawk send 6 Rams and 5 Mantlets.
Proud general in charge of British forces in Canada.

Plants the Canadian flag to boost morale! Nearby military units (excluding artillery) and buildings inflict more damage and are created faster. Flags cannot be planted near starting Town Centers, and only one flag can be planted at a time.
Boosts the morale of nearby Canadian units and must be defended! If captured by enemies, it will be removed from the map.
If not in combat, Salteadores will automatically be stealthy with no speed penalty - for a short duration.
Rowboat. Small oar-powered boat carrying a sharpshooter. Can fight but is better suited for stealth missions.
Rowboat. Oar-power boat carrying a sharpshooter.
Native Warriors are trained and shipped faster, ships a big group of Native warriors.
All home city resource shipments are instantly added to the stockpile.

Flies the Barbary corsair flag over the ship, preventing it from being attacked by enemy forces. Cannot be used if the unit is currently in combat and disables attacking during the active time of the ability.
Makes the unit inivisible to enemy units for a short duration. Cannot be used if the unit is currently in combat.
Technologically advanced and powerful American warship captured by Barbary Pirates.
An explosive attack that damages all units within range.
Priest and leader of the Mexican revolutionaries. Heals injured units.
Former captain in the Spanish army and leader of the Mexican revolutionaries.
An aura that increases the attacks of the allies around you.
Passive aura that increases the hit points of nearby allied units.
Shipments arrive faster and Cathedral technologies become cheaper.
Settlers gather food and coin from Haciendas and Estates faster.
TEAM Heroes attack and hitpoints increased.

Heavy infantry, hand cavalry and artillery move faster.

Switch to Gathering mode, ungarrisoning all previous gatherers and allowing units to gather resources from this Hacienda.

Ships 3 large collections of books containing 1500 XP in total.
The Padre may now area-heal multiple damaged units at the same time.
Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of His saints...

Ships tomes of 500 XP. Improves the line of sight of all units and buildings and temporarily reveals the position of your enemies.

The Inspiring Flag can be re-planted almost immediately and boosts the Work Rate of Military Buildings by an additional 25%.
Ships an additional Chinaco for each shipment you have sent so far this game. Chinacos train slightly faster.
Enables your General to construct Field Hospitals, for free. Soldados gain 10% Hitpoints and may be deployed from Field Hospitals.

Cards which deliver only crates (e.g., Cords of 700 Wood) may now be sent from the Homecity without costing a shipment but take longer to arrive.

Forts have more range and become able to attack other buildings.
Forts train units and research technologies much faster.
All Infantry and Cavalry fighting near Forts have more attack and hitpoints.
Buildings have more hitpoints, are built faster and grant Coin upon being built, instead of Experience.
Long lasting food source for fishing ships.
Heroic Mexican Priest. Explores, fights, builds Cathedrals and Trading Posts. Cannot die. If he falls unconscious, he can be rescued.
Inspiring Flags gain a much wider area of effect and improves damage by a greater rate.
Enables Zapotec technologies to be researched at the Native Embassy.
Exports of chocolate provide you with Crates of Coin from your Home City. You get 1 Crate per 2 minutes of game length (up to a maximum of 30 minutes).
Four Jaguar Warriors assemble at your Home City Gather Point.
Eight Jaguar Warriors assemble at your Home City Gather Point.
Twelve Jaguar Warriors assemble at your Home City Gather Point.
Gather your strength, our followers must break the monopoly!
Soon we will have the victory our people deserve, without the violence that usually accompanies it.
Action must be taken at once; there is no time to be lost!
We are preparing to move the cannons. These models are a bit older, you see.
Our fine horses will crush the oppressors!
My footmen are in a frenzy, thirsting for a good fight!
Our people have been robbed for generations! We cannot afford to help you at this time.
Not now, my friend. You see, it's siesta.
I must convert more followers first.
I am sorry, I could not square my conscience with this.
The Mexican army is still growing. I cannot send it into battle quite yet.
The enemy will not let us win without a fight. Let us show them justice!
We could have fought united with the United States of America against European influence, instead of fighting each other.
The Aztec Empire is no more, its people are already part of the United Mexican States.
The British cannot even control their own colonies. What did they expect to happen against us?
The Dutch make much more formidable allies than enemies.
We will make the French regret ever meddling in our affairs!
The German army has been shrinking so much, you could hide it under a sombrero.
The Haudenosaunee's days are numbered. One, two, three, four... – a joke of course, excuse me!
The Ottomans should have steered clear of Mexico. Jalapeños do not taste like baclava.
The Portuguese should have listened to the Pope. This is not their land.
Russia should not have attacked us so far from their home. It is way too hot in Mexico.
The Lakota were worthy opponents, but it is now time to stop the bloodshed.
Long live our lady of Guadalupe!\nDown with bad government!\nDown with the Spaniards!
With those tiny herrings that they eat, I am not surprised that the Swedes lacked the strength to fight.
Be careful now, the Inca are strongest when they are on the defensive.
Before long, the Chinese consulate will host a fine feast for our ambassadors to sign their terms of surrender.
No amount of isolation will help Japan now.
I am empathetic of the Indian cause against European empires, but I will not allow them to stand in our way.
The forces of the United States are saber-rattling on our borders. We must form a united front against them!
Our past is coming back to haunt us. The Aztec Empire has recovered and is about to reclaim dominance!
I see houses lining the horizon -- a frightful sight when fighting the British.
These Dutch Ruyters are a greater plague than mosquitoes! And they can't be banished with smoke, either.
A rumble in the distance! France must be parading its cavalry again.
Another shipment for the German economy means another Uhlan in our economy, wreaking havoc.
The sun shines on the expanding Haudenosaunee lands. That is why they always see us coming.
We lie on opposite ends of the Spanish sphere of influence, but with no Spaniards to fight, the Ottomans must be building their army to fight us next!
I would attack the Portuguese, but everywhere my men raid, they run into another of their town centers.
The Russian Empire is coming! Grab your sarape and prepare for a long winter.
My men feel ill-equipped to fend off the growing Lakota threat. And the trade negotiations from our Comancheros were also turned down.
Our Spanish oppressors are trying to gain control. We should drive them from our land, once and for all!
These Swedes are putting up quite a fight against our Soldados. Have your machete ready at hand to fend off their charges!
So many Inca Kanchas! They must be housing a huge army... or an even bigger economy.
The Chinese Empire is growing strong!
At least Japan sees us as an equal nation, but not in a friendly way, I'm afraid.
I hear entire forests falling in the distance. India must be expanding its economy.
I hope that you can share some benefits from the next age with us.
Knowledge is power my friend, consider advancing with your town center soon.
Are you rushing the enemy? Do not worry, I will secure our technological advantage in the meantime.
You do not yet have wings and already want to fly.
Welcome to the path of enlightenment.
Let us surrender and live, lest our people be doomed.
The enemy is at my gates, send reinforcements!
I am scholar, priest, and father of my nation. And we will fight side by side!
I have taught my people farming and pottery. Will you teach me how to wage war?
I do not take lightly the responsibility that my parish has entrusted me with.
Another day, another foe that wants to bring down our empires.
I have learned to make the right alliances after my last defeat.
With you by my side, we have nothing to fear.
Pay attention, I can teach you a few tricks! Watch the skillful gardening on my Hacienda.
Have you learned from our last endeavor?
Will the fighting in these lands never cease?
No playing around this time! Bring everything that you have! Machetes, plows, staffs...
Nothing can go wrong fighting for a righteous cause.
My General fell into enemy hands. I had to pay an absurd sum, but he will be worth it!
Our silver mines have made my people rich…and now you as well.
Now that we are no longer robbed by excessive taxation, we can share some coin with you.
We have sent you some nice, crunchy chapulines.
A shipment of cypress trees from my homeland recently arrived. I have sent you some of it.
I recently taught my villagers to use a new type of saw. If you need more wood in the future, research it at the market as well.
We must bring the enemy to their knees. I will attack their base at once!
My Soldados are eager to reclaim this town in our name!
Let us free the natives from their oppression!
I will smoke out this greedy enemy trading post and turn it into a chipotle!
We shall yet see the oppressors' yoke broken and the fragments scattered on the ground.
This will be a fine place to construct a new base.
Will you join the celebration for my new town center?
Our Haciendas are overproducing. Here! We want to share the profits with a good friend.
A grandma made too much flan for everyone, so we can send you some.
I do not know what to do with all this wood, would you take some off our hands?
My army is restless. If you need a hand, we will help you defend.
Every day that we rest, we are not bringing justice to the enemy!
Do I have time to make some pozole overnight? Hmm...
I will wage war on the invaders if you send coin!
We are preparing some tamales, but do not have any filling. Would you mind sending us something?
I need more wood to finish the Cathedral. Can you spare some?
Thank you! I will invest this coin wisely for the good cause.
With your help, my men will no longer fight on an empty stomach.
I shall pray for your good will to be rewarded.
My men are starting construction at once!
A divided nation will be easily conquered by the United States. I must rally my men!
First I thought it was the día de muertos, but then I realized that our Aztec past is coming back to haunt us in the form of skull knights!
The British are preparing a fierce attack on our lands. They think that we owe them something.
The firepower of the Dutch army is so pervasive that it smoked all our jalapeños into chipotles.
The French are shooting in our general direction, and saying that we smell like elderberries.
My Chinacos and Soldados report that they fail to pierce through the sturdy German war wagons with their lances and bayonets.
Haudenosaunee are expanding their territory, pillaging our villages!
Those Ottoman cannons are always disturbing our daily siesta!
What are the Portuguese doing here? Were they eating tortillas at the treaty of Tordesillas?
With a never-ending stream of Strelets on the front line and a swarm of Oprichniks in our town, fate has abandoned us.
The Lakota are too fast even for our best Chinacos. How are we supposed to catch up with them?
We might not rid ourselves from the shackles of Spanish oppression today.
Even without their cannons, I expect the Swedes to run in guns blazing any time now.
An Inca priestess has predicted our demise. I do not think that she needs to be a real prophet for that anymore.
These Chinese rockets hurt even more than the sting of a habanero pepper. Have you ever tried one?
If Japan was not so shy with other nations, this could have been the start of a nice friendly treaty.
The Indian elephants are stomping us into submission. If we lose this, my people will be no better off than before!
The United States may control Los Angeles and San Francisco now, but Saint Francis and the angels will always be with us!
The Aztec Empire might survive another day, but it cannot avoid the inevitable.
The British should not love their queen, but the lady of Guadalupe!
My settlers wear the same rags as the Dutch, but their banks are still bringing in great profit.
We all have a tough time, but these Coureurs des Bois are a hardy bunch.
Our men partied with the Germans yesterday. We need time to recover with a good Menudo soup.
The Haudenosaunee are building a new longhouse, preparing more space in which to imprison us.
The Ottomans stole our tortillas to make durum kebabs. My men left once they realized there would be no burritos.
We can hold back their army, but even Portuguese town centers are conquering the land.
I did not think it possible that there ever could be more Strelets than Insurgentes, but it happened!
Lakota raiders have turned our countryside into no man's land. Not even the Bandidos want it.
Spanish oppression may last another decade, but my children will rise again, even if we lose today.
I hope the Swedes let us try some mole poblano on their signature meatballs.
Those Chimu Runners are slipping through our fingers time and time again.
The Chinese are experts with gunpowder, but it seems that they are not bad with classic warfare either.
What a pity. I wanted to send a scientific mission to Japan, but we do not seem to be welcome right now. Also, I have no scientists left.
This sepoy uprising is defeating our peasant uprising. Now everyone's lands are ruined.
You need to pull us out of this sinkhole, old friend.
It is looking so bad for us, I feel the urge to visit my Cathedral and confess my sins to a padre.
We have the momentum, but should we overstay our welcome?
Your ferocity is an inspiration to our team!
Keep your spirits up, friend! I will hold them off, then you deliver the finishing blow.
My people have lost their faith - and the pretty Cathedral. We are fighting for a lost cause.
My dreams for a united Mexico are shattered. My friend, let us surrender before our civilians are slaughtered for our pride.
I would say that things look desperate for us, but I genuinely do not want to be mistaken for a Desperado.
They want to make us buy olives and grapes at outrageous prices. We cannot allow our culinary arts to find such a dark demise!
It is always good to be on friendly terms with the local population.
You beat me to this one, my friend.
Good catch, but do not let the Bandidos see you!
That treasure will fetch a fine price.
Do not fight on an empty stomach. Can I offer you some guacamole?
Do not forget to use those treasures for an army, they are more than fancy trinkets!
I prefer that you look outside my base for future endeavours.
The people of these lands know more than you think. Use their skills wisely!
It never hurts to have more help.
What will it be, a weapon for your army, or a house for your settlers?
A blessed day, a blessed treasure.
I found a centavo! Let us hope that it brings us luck!
A good afternoon snack. Only the chilis are missing.
Do not worry, friend. I will pay you back with interest, by winning our battles.
There are enough treasures for both of us, my friend. I know a few spots where some conquistadores died with their stolen gold.
This local guide will provide important knowledge of the map.
A lost soul was found, happy to help our cause!
Someone cut firewood, but never got around to lighting it.
Yes, our faith is our best defence, but I still might set up some barricades. Just to keep the coyotes out.
The combined power of our cultures will bring them to their knees!
We have been waiting to raid your revenue. I think that the time has come.
You might not be a fan of my monopoly, but you will love our homemade wine, at the right price.
While you studied books, I studied the musket. Quite uncommon for a priest, I know.
Are you taking it slow because you think an older man like me cannot catch up? Underestimating me will be your last mistake.
The next age is mightier than the sword.
Your technological prowess will not help you against the wrath of my Insurgentes!
Now that we are on more equal footing, let us have a fair fight. I will send my first Soldado.
You are late! Was your siesta maybe a little too long?
Trying to hide from everyone? Our Guerrilleros have been watching you the whole time.
Living so close to my ally is not wise. I will always defend my dear friends!
A pity to face you on the battlefield. I would have preferred a public discussion in the plaza to settle our differences.
Appearances are deceiving. All went smooth last time, but you have not reached the hard center of the avocado yet!
Was the habanero too spicy for you? Have a little jalapeño then! No worries, you will survive it. Maybe.
A tree born twisted will never straighten its branches. Just like you never change the map!
Your alliance does not scare me, for I have fate itself on my side.
You might think yourself safe this time, but all injustice will be punished, no matter the odds!
I hereby expel your explorer from my lands. Return, and you will face punishment without mercy!
Oh, how cute. Is that your army, or a Mariachi band? I love Mariachi.
Are you here for a visit? Have a look around, we are a very welcoming people.
Your army is dwarfed by the count of my villagers alone. Do not expect them to just surrender.
My base is prepared, are you?
You can take our buildings, but you will never take our freedom!
Your men might not fit into my base, at least not in one piece.
So, that pompous palace is your town center? How revolting.
Have you taken up gardening as well? My grape vines will be bursting with flavor this year, but I will only feed you the chili peppers.
Would you like to join my daily moment of silence, to pay respect to your fallen? In the past, now, and future?
Though I may die, I shall be remembered forever; you all will soon be forgotten.
I must admit, my defeat is the price that I will pay, for peace for my people.
You may think yourself wise, but this trading post was the only thing between you and my insurgent followers.
Do you really want to crawl through the dirt for those few resources?
Who did you have to murder to gather this token of injustice?
All the gold in the world will not be enough to save you from our wrath!
Are you even eating off the ground now? You could have come to our Cathedral, we feed the poor.
Your people cannot produce enough to satisfy your hunger? You truly are a Desperado.
Your greed will come back to haunt you, mark my words!
Stealing from me? I will ask some Bandidos to get it back.
This native warrior will only lead you to meet your demise faster.
Forcing peasants to work for you? Keep it up -- because of such treatment, the Mexican people became independent.
You build more walls, but my people have already faced far greater hardships than that.
I will teach the locals and in return, they will teach me.
God helps he who rises early.
You do not check the teeth of a free horse.
The riches of this land do not belong to you, they belong to the people, my people.
Aah! New seeds for the Hacienda!
I was only bringing this treasure to its rightful owner – the people of this land – before the invader, you, could take it!
My supporters in the countryside left another cache of resources for me.
More locals join the rebellion against you!
Another helping hand for the Mexican economy!
Settlers are still flocking to my righteous cause.
This wood comes in handy. What will I build with it? A Cathedral? A Hacienda? Or weapons to beat you with?
Try to appease them all you want, but they will always prefer joining Mexico over being ruled by you.
A trading post? My fellow men have already burned down more impressive buildings.
A monopoly? My people will not be oppressed, militarily or economically!
Your control over the trade routes is over. Admit defeat and avoid further bloodshed!

Basilica, Lombard

Fabulously wealthy merchant republics, kingdoms, duchies, and even the Papacy had driven the Renaissance and dominated the trade networks of the Mediterranean. However, when the Italian polities were not engaged in conflicts abroad, they fought each other nearly incessantly, until the Risorgimento gave rise to the new Kingdom of Italy.

Giuseppe Garibaldi is an impassioned and daring leader. In battle, his stubborn defense against all odds can prove both tenacious and effective, while his subsequent counterattacks will be as swift as they are decisive. Knowing the advantages modern technology can bring, he will invest his nations resources towards a plethora of economic and military upgrades.

Hospital, Fixed Gun, Depot, Commandery

One of the Mediterranean’s epitomes of a melting pot, Malta was strategically and financially important, and thus most of the surrounding powers coveted it, becoming a stronghold of the Knights Hospitaller.

Jean Parisot de la Valette is a resilient, undeterred commander. In his role as the shield of Europe, Valetta values a strong defense above anything else to uphold his sacred duties. As Grand Master and knight of the Order of Malta, he prefers honorable hand to hand fighting for his well armored units.
