Bring the mortars and every blade and man you can! We must stop them now!
One minute, one monopoly, one magnificent victory for us! The Holy Trinity!
Nothing would please me more, my lord.
The Order will put everything in order!
You men, with me! Bring that bombard.
Yes, my lord. Send the knights through the fort and wipe out those bombards!
The armies of heaven, wearing pure, white linen, will follow you on white horses.
Our brethren mercilessly march to your mission, lord.
My coffers are empty and my gunpowder is depleted.
I must respectfully decline. This is not in the interest of the order.
I have a few weapons left, but no soldiers to carry them.
I have the faith, but not the means.
New recruits are still arriving as we speak.
We have reduced the United States into one last United State.
What do you think, my dear ally? If Aztec Coyote Runners were knighted, would they be Blade Runner Knights?
It is settled. Compared to this British pirate Elisabeth, the brethren of Malta are the better islanders!
The Dutch may be bleeding coins, but – they are bleeding!
A pity for the Ethiopians. They could have made a valuable ally against the Ottomans. No Knights of Ethiopia then.
I regret the need to destroy my old French homeland, but this apostasy could not be tolerated!
The Germans are almost defeated. Since their "holy empire" is already divided, we only need to split the spoils!
The Hausa people may be hospitable, but we are the Knights Hospitaller!
The Haudenosaunee still have a longhouse left, but our blades are cutting it shorter by the minute.
After we capture Italy, I will rename Sicily to "Great Malta".
Mexico has revolted one too many times. I suggest the Order should be their next government.
We have beaten back the Ottoman invasion at Malta – we will beat them back again!
My Order may have lost some islands in the past, but the Portuguese just lost one too many Town Centers!
It seems the Russian Tsar was fighting us as much as his own people – and lost to both.
We have taken out all Lakota teepees – nowhere left to hide!
The Spanish treasure fleet is ours – and anything else they were hiding!
The Swedish Caroleans have charged the wrong hill to die on. Now they are over the hills and far away.
The Inca prisoners helped us against the Spanish. It makes no sense to kill them.
The Chinese walls were built on sand. They will not last long now.
We will not chop off any heads like the Japanese Samurai. Having to live with their defeat will be much worse for them.
Putting guns on camels was a bad idea. They wiggle too much while running!
The United States are in my dreams. Cowboys chase me through the night to the beat of their gatling guns!
These Obsidian arrowheads of the Aztec Arrow Knights are incredible! Cannons appear like a malinvestment now.
Their rockets look more frightening than they are, but their longbows are more frightening than they look.
The Dutch can hold out in a siege for a decade, but so can I!
Ethiopia has a single mortar so big it says it has the power to flatten all of Malta in a single shot!
I had a premonition of my fate, it was the hoof of a French cuirassier.
The German needle guns are turning my knights into hedgehogs!
I wish those hardy Hausa Knights would join my Order. Unfortunately, they are our enemies!
Haudenosaunee cannons might be light, but they still shoot heavy cannonballs!
The Italians have a lot faith in themselves. I understand this is why their architects construct these great Basilicas.
The Mexicans achieved the impossible and formed the United Mexican States. Now they're scarier than ever!
The Ottoman army seems to be strong, but they forget one thing: THIS - IS - MALTA!
The Portuguese expansion is concerning. We either bring our cannons in range – or wait for their Town Centers to be in range.
The Russian aggression is relentless! Their nimble Cossacks seem to slip through the cracks in our walls.
I saw heaven standing open. There was a white horse, and its rider is named Faithful and True. With integrity, he judges and wages war. He is the Lakota Rifle Rider.
If we do not take action soon, my beloved Malta will become a Spanish colony.
The Swedish king Gustavus seems to have more than one ace up his sleeve.
The Inca army is dangerous! In the blink of an eye, they appear out of nowhere and vanish as quickly as they came.
The Chinese weapons are as innovative as ours, but it is the sheer amount of gunpowder that may pulverize our forts.
I am starting to understand why Japan was never conquered, whereas our order may have lost an island – or two.
The Indian economy flourishes, but it is based on wood. Let us throw flames, rockets, and burning hoops at it!
Your progress is a shining example for all allies and enemies alike!
I admire the technological prowess displayed by your people. Care to share your secrets with the Order?
May you have forgotten to send shipments from the Home City? Or were they intercepted by ... Pirates?! Aarg! I hate those pirates!
You should read a good book. Or better, a whole library! Then you will see the light! – of the next age.
Such an impressive start, my ally! You may now cast the first stone at our sinful enemies!
I held them back while you aged up, now it's your turn!
Malta has been overrun! We need to find a new island, again!
My knights are under siege once again. Send reinforcements, we will make them pay!
I am Jean Parisot de Valette! The shield of Europe! The 49th Grand Master of the Order of Knights of the Hospital of Saint John of Jerusalem! – currently in Malta.
Together, we can beat any challenge fate can put before us!
This will be a walk in the park, with an enemy town center in the way.
Your skills have impressed me last game, now I will show you some of mine!
Maybe you can teach this old Templar some new tricks.
Had enough sparring with me? Let us try our teamwork, then.
I do not mind doing the heavy lifting, but you can take the lead this round.
Once more unto the breach, dear friend! Same old breach!
Our ship is badly damaged. Start a colony on this island and wait for more ships to arrive from Malta.
Our alliance was already unstoppable last game! Now that we are warmed up, they have no chance!
I once got captured by Barbary Pirates and held on a galley for a year. Now I am a Grand Master.
I sent you a boatload of financial support.
My fishermen have delivered their last catch on their Luzzus right to your stockpiles.
This land has more forests than we are used to from Malta.
Sound the trumpets — it is time for a charge!
Let us hit them where it hurts! — their trading posts.
Today we fight! A wall of steel united as brothers and sisters.
I will build a fortress here, a lighthouse of safety in a sea of darkness.
Our covered wagon has arrived. We must use it to build a town center near the trading post.
You will get your gold, but be cautious. These are unfamiliar waters.
I intend to build an economy ready to feed an army of lions! I might have some food over for yours as well.
I ordered too many saws and axes. I intend to put them all to use so I will have some wood to send for your own building projects.
I will never abandon a friend in time of need, my brethren are ready to restore order wherever necessary!
My soldiers are getting tired of guard service. We need a proper battle to bring everyone back in line!
Our corso was not as successful as I hoped, do you have gold to spare for the upkeep of my army?
My grain shipments were stolen by pirates. Could you please spare some for my people?
The construction of my new capital was halted due to a lack of timber. If you can send some, I will dedicate the next building to your honor!
I am both terrified and amazed by the innovative weaponry of the United States. They beat us at our own game.
Those Aztec Skull Knights seem more knightly than my own ones! They truly fight to the bone.
It is like the Battle of Crécy all over again: British Longbowmen defeating heavily armored knights.
The Dutch must be manipulating the tulip markets again, with the way they are making bank.
The Ethiopian Mountain Monasteries give coin and faith! They are truly moving mountains – and pushing us into the sea!
Sacre bleu! Even our finest halberds have trouble dealing with fully upgraded French Cuirassiers!
The Germans are as heavily armored as we are, but they outsmarted us by putting everything on wheels.
The Hausa heavily outnumber us. I have no faith for the odds to turn in our favor.
Maybe our men of faith could learn a thing or two from the Haudenosaunee's ceremonies. They seem more...powerful.
Maybe Malta should have been a part of the reunification of Italy. It is looking grim for us – and I actually speak Italian!
The healing powers of the Mexican Padre puts our order's hospitals to shame. We have a lot to learn.
I am not ready to die just yet to the Ottoman Falcon! And I do not intend to see our knighthood broken!
The Portuguese Organ Guns provide the thundering sound to the funeral rites. Our funeral rites.
The Russian blockhouses encircle us like hungry birds a shoal of fish. Alas, Malta is a nice place for fishing.
My army is out of breath! Running away from Lakota horses all day!
I am not sure what more to be afraid of: The Spanish army or the Spanish Inquisition?
My Infantry fears the Swedish cannons, my cavalry their Caroleans and Hakkapelits. We need a victory soon for morale to improve!
The Inca outnumber, outrange, and outrun us. Three reasons to give up.
I wonder how the Chinese got such a wonderful economy.
The Japanese copied and mastered the art of island hopping – unfortunately, Malta is an island.
The Indian tactics are treacherous. Their priests would not harm a fly, yet the very elephant they ride stomps us into submission!
What the United States State Militia lacks in fighting skills they make up with numbers. And they lack a lot of skill.
We simply did not have enough time to figure out the inner workings of the Aztec army.
I admit, it was foolish to assume these British islanders only wanted to "construct some houses".
The Dutch got us all into deep waters — I cannot swim in my heavy armor!
I found a Gascenya spear in my soup today, these things get everywhere!
My puny settlers had no chance against the French raids and even worse: the French Coureurs had no issue with mine!
The Germans may receive less shipments than we do, but it is like they say: Never look a gift horse in the mouth.
At first, the Hausa seemed genuinely interested in trade, until they realized that raiding is cheaper than paying.
The Haudenosaunee hatchets do not fly far, but far enough.
My Sentinels stopped guarding our fort as soon as they spotted some Italian relatives behind their big pavise shields.
We should have brought our boats to avoid drowning in a sea of insurgents.
Move the crossbows to the forward walls to attack the janissaries! Defend the fort at all costs!
If only we could have fought in a crusade with the Portuguese instead of engaging in this senseless destruction of each other!
Another Russian Strelet for my toy soldier collection! I think I have a full set now! – We can give up now!
My spies reported that the Lakota had no houses at all, so we concluded they posed no threat. We were wrong.
We keep shooting at the Spanish, but their Missionaries are doing God's work!
The Swedes would eventually eat the fish my people considered inedible. There is no winning wars with gourmets!
The Inca do not need attack us to win. Unlike us, they produce goods in their own homes.
I was hoping to beat the Chinese into a powder as fine as the dust, but to bite the dust is what they made us do.
Had I known how long it takes for reinforcements from Malta to arrive in Japan, I would never have agreed to this 'raid'.
My brethren had no chance to practise fighting against Camels and Elephants on the island we live.
It is looking grim for us. We need to sail right away before the storm breaks loose!
Do not despair, my friend! Come, and seek shelter behind my walls to regain your strength for the last stand!
With you and the Lord by my side, I have nothing to fear!
With me by your side, you have nothing to fear!
My Citadel is out of supplies. The walls are reduced to rubble. We must fight to the last man or offer our surrender.
First Cyprus! Then Rhodes! Now Malta is lost, too – but we can still save our lives and sail to another island!
We are the Knights of Saint John, we do not surrender! – We could, however, sail away. That – is not surrender!
The enemy tries to starve us out! Quick! Attack their trade routes!
We should make some allies among the locals. The enemy has the edge on us now.
Ah! Very good! I assume you intend to donate your findings to my order? For the good cause.
More treasures! An interesting source of income for my order I will continue to explore.
You must be blessed by fate to find coin so easily. Care to show me the next spot?
An army marches on its stomach! Keep that Explorer moving.
Thou shalt not steal and love your neighbor as yourself! So says the holy book.
I am sure there are more natives around. We should make sure we scout the entire area.
Blessed are the merciful, for they will be shown mercy!
Wood! It may seem plain and ordinary, but it is the source of great power. Mark my words!
A nice cache of war supplies!
Stolen gold – confiscated! And put to good use in the name of the Lord.
These food supplies will keep my treasuring expeditions fed until they find an even bigger treasure.
I had to protect this treasure—an enemy explorer had his eyes on it for too long!
Do you know how treasuring works? It is a point and click adventure, first the guardians, then the treasure.
I found a stranger who promised to fight for us—maybe he has a grudge with our opponents.
A settler was lost in the woods and now was found, by me.
I found a round table—with this fine piece of wood, I shall reinstate the Knights of the Round Table!
You can never wall yourself in too early! I will build an indestructible citadel that can withstand ten years of siege!
Once our trade network is as well-connected as my knightly order rulers from all over, the world will obey to our will.
Ha-HA! Time to bring out my secret demolition squad of petards sitting behind your base!
I would like to play a game: Trip to Jerusalem! The player without access to my trade route gets eliminated. Go!
Racing ahead with no goal in mind will only get you lost.
It must be a divine sign that a small knightly order puts your presumptuous "empire" to shame!
Hanging in old ages for nostalgia will not win wars. Even our oldest knights know how to fire a musket by now.
Rushing ahead gives you little without the resources to capitalize on it.
What were you still looking for in the previous age? Courage? Chivalry? Power? We already took all of it.
No amount of gold is enough to weigh up your sins. That is why I should take that gold.
I am Jean Parisot de Valette! The shield of Europe! The 49th Grand Master of the Order of Knights of the Hospital of Saint John of Jerusalem – and the last proper knight in this battle.
We are the Knights Hospitaller. We will bring you to the hospital!
We are the Knights Hospitaller and we will beat you up good for the hospital!
Last time was a good warmup, this time do not pull any punches!
I have been to this place before. You could call it a Déjà-vu.
Your eyes are full of fire. On your head, too many crowns. Yet you will cry out for help—there will be no one to save you.
What is your untalented explorer trying to find in my base? The fountain of youth? Is he not a bit too old for that?
Your ragtag band of bandits does not scare me.
Your blades are as dull as your men.
You come not to bring peace, but to bring the sword. Now let us see how blades fare against stone walls!
Do you see those walls? My order can hold out until reinforcements arrive.
You gained no honor from this victory, only a small island.
Are you always picking on someone smaller than yourself?
Be careful now, I know where you live.
All quiet on the front today. Do you maybe want to attempt a siege tomorrow? I would like to test some new explosives.
We Knights Hospitaller are known for hospitality! Why not come around for a good beating? You will enjoy your stay in the hospital.
Your show of force has left a lasting impression on us. Would you like to become the new Grand Master?
An honorable loss against a worthy opponent. Shall we end all hostilities now?
My trade! I will tear your economy apart for this!
Do not get too fond of your find, I will destroy whatever you use it on.
I have more important matters to attend to. Keep that treasure.
All these coins you gather will be confiscated by my brethren – sooner or later.
That food pales in comparison to what my fishermen are bringing in every minute.
Hoard all treasures like a dragon, you will still be slain by this knight.
You use your actions on treasures, I use them on the preparation of your demise.
Such brazen disrespect to the property of a knight will not be accepted!
I did not want him to join my forces anyways, he would only slow my men down.
Build all you want with it, our ingenious engineers invented plenty of ways to set things aflame!
Your bulwark of cowardice will not stand. No crack, no gap in your wall goes unnoticed by legendary defenders like us!
I have met an order of independent warriors and we saw that our interests align, your destruction.
Come to my trading post! I trade bible quotes for coin. It is a unique experience.
The Lord giveth and the Lord taketh away.
Even a Templar is more motivated if he also fights for a good sum of gold.
This field ration will keep my brothers healthy and full of energy!
If you wanted it, you should have sent your explorer to get it.
Do not worry about treasures, I almost got them all by now.
A new member for our Order!
No amount of gold is enough to weigh up your sins.
Not on my watch, my friend. Not on my watch!
This monopoly will be the final nail in the coffin of your empire!
Here we either make Italy, or we die.
Now we only need to cling to our empire of commerce like the Medicis!
The beat of my cannonfire will teach a lesson they will never forget.
The heavy plashing of our horses' hoofs will signal our brisk approach.
My infantry will make a forced march to catch them off guard.
I only have a sabre and a carbine, which I carry on the front of my saddle.
I can offer neither pay, nor quarters, nor food; I offer only hunger, thirst, forced marches, battles and death.
Recruitment for my next expedition has not completed.
I will not endanger my people for such a wasteful endeavour.
My men are still weary from our last adventure.
Our traders have been robbed of their rightful posts!
The United States, once admirable in their fight for liberty, have fallen from fates favor. Down with king Washington!
Soon I can found the United Aztec Republic, free from tyranny!
A shame to see the British in such shambles. Even the Forum Romanum looks more stable.
My men are eager to gain their share of the Dutch banks when this expedition succeeds.
Maybe the end of the Ethiopian king of kings could mean the beginning of a republic of republics.
I would not lose sleep over a French monarch losing his head.
Are we fighting Prussia or Austria now? It does not matter. Let us finish off these Germans!
The Hausa leaders developed monarchist tendencies. We had to stop them.
Unless there are a hundred Forest Prowlers still in hiding, the coming battle will be as swift as it will be decisive!
A pitiful end for the Maltese, I had the pleasure of fighting along them in my first battle.
Mexico was fighting for a worthy cause, but was led astray long ago.
The Ottomans must no longer tread upon that part of the world kept by them in misery.
Portuguese exploration skills did not translate well into military victories today.
Soon we can rebuild the Genoese trading posts in the Black Sea and trade in Russian ports tax free!
The Lakota are formidable guerilla fighters, but – why the horses? They make much easier targets!
These Spanish royalists do nothing but issue a few bombastic proclamations – and keep themselves out of harm's way.
It looks like the Carolean charge is no match for the Italian countercharge!
The sun is setting on the Empire of Inti.
Once the Chinese emperor surrenders, the Forbidden City will be open to everyone!
Japanese swords have quite an edge, but our bayonets also have a point.
I hope to capture a boatload of Indian spices – I have some old friends who can turn it into a boatload of money!
Posterity will call the United States the Great Emancipator, a more enviable title than any crown could be, and greater than any merely mundane treasure.
I heard stories of the old Aztecs on my journeys, but I never expected to receive such a lively example of their power!
Once enemy to despotism, friend of the oppressed, the British Empire has forsaken its destiny. Let us take it down!
Our Lombards are slowly losing the financial war with the Dutch Banks. For once we could call the Guardia di Finanza.
Ethiopia is not content with just owning the roof of Africa, they also want a Palace on top of it!
Even while at odds with the French, I have the utmost respect for our brother-republicans.
The Germans seem to have put aside their internal quarrels and united their firepower. Luckily, I have done the same for my beloved Italy.
I never managed to see Hausaland, but if we are not vigilant, we will soon become a part of it. I will not serve an emir!
I think the Haudenosaunee are making a free republic without me, but – so did the Corsicans. So we still have a chance!
I always thought the Sicilians are the scarier islanders. Today the Maltese knights have proven me wrong!
This Mexican priest is the personification of falsehood. I would have been a much better Mexican revolutionary!
Our Galleasses humiliated the Ottomans at Lepanto, but now there are more Galleys and Janissaries than the eye can see!
If they could, the Portuguese would construct Town Centers on the stars. Per aspera ad astra!
I once sold oranges to Russia in Taganrog; they may not have enjoyed their taste – for now they are coming after us!
The Lakota have as many horses as Italy has painters! Unfortunately, a hoof hurts more than a brush.
The Spanish Bourbons are a thorn in my side! I will need to succeed where Pisacane failed!
Here's the plan: If the Swedes attack, we just kill their leader in the fray of battle and we win the war!
I have dealt with Inca bolas before. They scare our Bersaglieri. Even if they wanted to run for their lives, they could not.
The Chinese weaponry is ingenious. Leonardo da Vinci would be jealous.
The fighting spirit of these Japanese Samurai is the one our troops need to win.
I hear the stomping of Indian elephants at night, but I do not know if they are so close, or just haunting me from afar.
Mamma mia! You race through the ages like a red Roman chariot!
Your technological progress is faster than the Bersaglieri can run. Breathtaking!
Without the benefits of Commerce, we can never hope to defeat our enemies.
Do not be afraid to age up – new things await you!
A splendid feat, now take the battle to our enemies as soon as you can!
Ah! You've finally returned from your travels – or from exile? I know how time flies, I have been through the same.
We are facing great adversity on the field of battle, I am close to admitting defeat.
My republic has seen better days than these, I must resort to asking you for immediate help.
Anyone who wants to carry on the war against the oppressors, follow me! Anyone who loves his country, follow me!
To arms, all – all of you!
There is no shame in choosing a lower difficulty, but do not expect remorse from me now.
You have conquered and you will conquer still, because you are prepared for the tactics that decide the fate of battles.
To this wonderful page in our country's history, another more glorious still will be added, with your valuable help.
Did I leave such a memorable impression on you that I have been chosen as your ally this time?
The hour of battle will find me with you again, by the side of the champions of Italian liberty.
Odd. I have been to this country before!  – Can we travel to another country next time?
And so we meet again, marching together to the redemption of our brothers who are still slaves of the stranger.
We shall meet again before long to march to new triumphs.
Being extorted to save my explorer has only strengthened my resolve!
Our Lombards made rich profits – here is your share for protecting us.
Take this and hire some mercenaries for our next battle. If you don't know where to look, I know a guy.
Our farmers were particularly industrious today, here are some tomatoes!
You know the feeling: Someone cooked too much pasta. Have some!
Put this fine cypress wood to good use!
Cypress forests sprawl my land; I am glad to be rid of some of it.
I have mustered my men, our spirits are high, their town will lay in ruins by tonight!
Their trading endeavours make them richer than my Lombards – I will destroy their trade routes right now!
The freedom of our people is near!
I am not afraid to get right up to my enemies and build in their front garden.
The more Italian city states, the better!
We just started this Lombard banking business but it already returns more coins than I need. Here!
As long as my people do not go hungry, I will provide you with Food.
A lot of trees must fall for this; only time will tell if I can fell enough.
If you ever should be so circumstanced as to require the help of an ally, cursed be the Italian who would not step forward with me in defence.
This is not the carnival in Venice. We will not mask ourselves. We will go in all guns blazing!
I saw the bottom of my war chest today, I need Coin urgently!
My people are starving, I can't maintain my armies this way. Please send me some of your bread.
I have promised a nice priest to repair the Basilica, but I am in need of some of your timber!
My war chest is overflowing now! Let us bring down some monarchies!
We will have a great feast tonight then!
The United States should be an example to us – their unity makes them unbreakable!
The Aztecs are not discouraged by their losses. On the contrary, they seem encouraged to fight on!
It is somewhat humiliating that my revolutionary Redshirts are losing to British Redcoats – but there are just too many.
Whether the world economy booms or collapses, the banks always win. – A Medici would be handy now. Too bad they are dead.
The Ethiopians have a mortar so huge it has shattered my dream of a free Republic of Italy with a single shot.
We will make the French pay! For the Tapestries of Raffaele, shot through with French bullets! Let them pay for the losses—no, not the losses, but the insult cast on Michelangelo!
The German needle guns are devastating; my army is in stitches.
Do you think I could visit a Hausa University incognito? Their amassed knowledge must be incalculable.
The forests are filled with tomahawks, handy while chopping trees, but my Villagers refuse to go now.
The Maltese knights must be getting support from the Pope again. I should have marched on Rome when I had the chance!
Mexico is doing too well, maybe our last chance is to incite another revolution to topple their government?
The grip and reach of the Ottoman Empire rivals that of the Roman Empire. Legions of Janissaries subdue these lands.
I wish that I and my fellow Brazilian Revolutionaries were more successful against these Portuguese puppet rulers when we still had a chance!
Is it always this cold here? Or why is the Russian empire thriving today? – Quick, someone hand me my poncho!
I was wrong, South America's horses are not the best in the world. The Lakota in the north have an even mightier kind.
As if it could not get any harder the Spanish decided to create the Kingdom of Two Sicilies. One Sicily is enough!
One more Carolean charge and I will have no one left to countercharge.
Yes, these Bolas Warriors are terrifying, but these Inca slingers put our Bersaglieri to shame.
The Chinese still have so much gunpowder left stored after beating us that they are starting to shoot it in the air for fun!
The Japanese kids seem to have learnt a lot about our weaknesses when they visited Italy ages ago. Crazy!
Camels! Elephants! Tigers! Indian beasts sent by a violent ruler to tear us  – the half-naked gladiators  – into pieces!
The Americans call us gangsters, but look at them! Cowboys, Owlhoots, and Gunslingers roam the countryside!
I had a terrible day. I woke up and stepped on a War Hut. I ate breakfast and bit on an Eagle Scout.
The British Longbowmen may have a tea break before they take a shot, but our Pavisiers were even slower to place their shields in time.
Even the Papal Guards were unnerved by the sheer amount of Dutch halberdiers. Like roses made of steel.
What are the Ethiopians putting in their coffee to beat us so handily? Oh right, coffee, we should have tried that!
These French think themselves on the side of fine arts and culture, yet half of their heroes are Italians! I have had enough!
The German mercenary swords are only feeble reeds now, but we have suffered one too many sword blows, too.
These Fulani Archers fire so many arrows at us, not even our Pavisiers dare to shoot back. Let us hope the Hausa run out of arrows soon.
My Bersaglieri keep firing at the portable walls that the Haudenosaunee are bringing. Who can blame them? It is what they were trained to do.
The Maltese order of knights is almost down to their last man, but  – who is that terrifying Scottish swordsman?
Is this a naval battle? All I see is a sea of Mexican Insurgentes!
We offered so little resistance that the Ottomans will capture the rest of Italy just as easily as the Venetian colonies!
If we do not improve our situation, our people and those of Portugal might join together and overthrow us all, and then make their own republic, since none of us are fit to rule.
The Russian Oprichniki made no difference whipping their own workers and ours. Unfortunately, their troops cost less than our expensive mercenaries.
Where, I ask, are the Carabinieri when you need them most?! Against the Lakota for example! Not a single one!
Spain seems to have an economic crisis, but dragged us into it as well. Only a fat Spanish treasure ship can save us now.
The Swedes seem to be low on gunpowder, but at this point they can beat us even with their blades alone.
The Inca have the high ground, but we still might have a shot. Ideally with one of Leonardo's mortars.
I don't know for how much longer our Pavese shields can stop those Chinese Chu Ko Nu bolts!
Japan is composing a lot of poetry lately; their favorite new topic seems to be our demise.
Unfortunately, Marco Polo did not show us everything about India that we should have seen.
I am in mighty company! Sadly, I can not keep up with you.
When this war started, I had full confidence in our alliance. I am reconsidering my choice of allies now.
It is a great day to be alive! We shall not let this victory slip through our fingers!
I have never met a great tactician like you! It is an honor for every Italian to have fought alongside you in this war.
I am a gentle soul and thus I will forgive you for not performing to my standards. Luckily I outdid myself this time, which will grant us this victory.
A treacherous Minister of war squandered doubloons, supporting his splendid banquets in the first capitals of Europe.
If there were still powder and shot, we would continue the fight—not for victory, not to save ourselves, but for honor!
I have nothing around me but men lying down overcome with fatigue, and hear no sound except the lamentations of the unfortunate wounded, not yet transported to the hospital.
We have allowed our sworn enemies to build up their trade. Now it is time for us to rectify that mistake.
They have already befriended the local population. We cannot win a war in a land where the populace is against us – we must start making allies as well!
Already living off the land are you? Great to see you adapt so quickly to these circumstances.
We should leave nothing behind for the enemy, take all that you can!
I wonder who left their purse behind.
Ah! Cantucci! What a sweet surprise!
I should pay close attention to your treasure-gathering technique, it is very efficient.
I was saving that one for later!
It is not a bad shout to get to know the locals better.
He who finds a friend, finds a treasure.
Extraordinary to find so many planks in the wild.
Exquisite treasures in this region! I want to bring a few of them to my island home on Caprera.
A treasure full of coin! My old pirating instincts do not leave me hanging!
Ahh! Some cheese, some olive oil and tartufo. A firework for the senses!
I hope you did not need that treasure. Eventually it is a team effort, right?
Ahh! This is just like in my early days traveling through South America.
We found a lost soldier who will teach us the way of fighting in these lands.
A new member joins the liberation front of Italy!
This wood will house my next military expedition.
All great Italian cities have proper walls! Genoa, Milan, Pisa, Florence, Venice, Rome, ... – and even I am bit of an architect myself!
Let us beat these greedy capitalists at their own game!
If this is the end, I am pleased that we could at least settle our disputes in a civilized manner.
Your loss is imminent! To save face, I can offer you a place in our Basilica. There is plenty of space, and you can also atone for your sins and other failures.
You think your fighters can handle such advanced weaponry without blowing themselves to pieces? Better hand it over to me now before anyone gets hurt.
Have you taken a break? Forgotten about your ... 'Empire'?
The old Romans were arrogant, but they would have been right to call you barbarian – considering how far you are behind.
Keep repeating the same strategies and you will need to get patched up! Because after I perfectly countered your plan, you will need one for your bruises.
Ready or not, here my rush comes. Or not.
Welcome to the age of your destruction!
All alone hiding in the wilderness? Watch out for the wolves. They are hungry!
This town of yours is so close to my ally. Unless it wants to become a part of Italy, it is going to be in trouble!
I am Guiseppe Garibaldi and my favorite enemies are oppressive, corrupt monarchs who tax too much. Did I describe you well?
Your timid doctrinaires can carry their servility and miserable fears elsewhere. This people is its own master!
We will no longer follow in the trail of men whose hearts are foul.
There is no point in lying, Pinocchio. Your wooden nose came a little too close to the fire in the last game!
I have a memory of this place – and I will use that knowledge to bring about your defeat.
Our odds may look odd, but I won worse!
You asked for a battle, we will give you a war.
Your explorer does not seem so bad. But our explorer rediscovered the Americas! How do you top that, eh?
Even the Pope commands more Papal Guards than you have men in your army.
I know, I know! The Basilica looks truly magnificent. Surely that is why some of your men are paying me a visit?
Our barricades are strong and numerous! The bastions crowned with cannons to fire upon the enemy! And the young army, impatient with warlike ardor, is placed at points where the attack is expected!
This battle will not even be my magnus opus – let me direct this opera anyway.
You barbarian! You destroy and ransack like the Huns just for the sake of it! I shall avenge this insult!
Are these your emissaries? – or did I already buy off all the mercenaries that were available? Curious.
Your people must be unhappy with your rule, working for a town in such disarray.
We have a little problem. My men just cannot agree on how to defeat you. – All options seem promising!
My comrades have a plan to overthrow your despotic rule that steals your worker's incomes and builds an empire on violence!
He who dies for his country has lived long enough. Let us end this?
Today I am obliged to retire, but for a few days only. Do you accept?
You have not just disappointed me with your unjustly aggression, you have disappointed the world.
You gather treasures, I gather people looking for freedom.
Take what you can, while you still can.
Oh, I think I lost that treasure here a decade ago, thanks for picking it up, I will collect it soon.
With some salt and olive oil, it is going to taste magnificient!
Your indiscriminate looting of the countryside will turn the populace against you – to my advantage!
Looting your treasuries seems more and more lucrative. Keep going!
Feel right at home in my base, soon enough a prison here will house you forever.
You really needed to drag the inhabitants into this? Royals – always need to make a scene..
Another poor soul that needs to be freed from a tyrant. I will gladly be that Spartacus.
That wood will not be sufficient to build a chair to fit your rich, royal ... body.
Walls, walls, ... no battle? What are you, a Roman tortoise? Come out and play!
Natives of the country, and therefore perfectly acquainted with every place, choose the most thorny spots for their ambushes.
First of many! Even the Medici had their humble beginnings.
My natural instinct for exploration will always grant me the best treasure on the map.
An old pirate friend left this one for me.
This food will make the rations for my next expedition.
That treasure was not yours. It was already there before you invaded this land.
I know you cannot compete in treasures against an experienced explorer like me, but you could try a little harder.
A local scout joined my army, he knows the perfect spot to ambush you!
I will save the people lost in this land from your tyranny!
Even strangers are eager to join my new nation.
This wood will make my town more beautiful than yours, and more defensible.
I will make acquaintances with the locals soon; they will not fight on the wrong side for long.
You might be the first to trade, but I will be the one to make a profit.
Our Italian merchants will teach you a lesson in building a real trade empire.
The Pope forbade the usury of our Lombards, so we had no choice but to fall back on a more honest type of business.
Build a Trading Post to conquer this City State.
Build a City Tower for fortification and defense.
Trains mercenaries. Provides religious improvements and generates experience points for the entire team.
Trains mercenaries. Provides economic improvements and generates Coin for the entire team.
Archaic archer who quickly loses hitpoints if not within a City State. Becomes stronger with every age.
City Defenders: Call a handful of City Guards to defend this City State!
You cannot call upon City Guards right now.
Conquer this City State to build a defensive City Tower.
Eliminate all hostile units and build a Trading Post here to conquer this City State.

There are five Strategic Points. Victory is achieved if your team controls all of them for one minute. Capturing a Point provides a chunk of resources. Your base also contains a Supply Cache, which will trickle additional resources.
Defend the fort Headquarters until time runs out.
The fort walls cannot be damaged, so attackers can only break through the gates. The ocean holds vast amounts of fish and whales – do not let the enemy claim the waters!

Boosts the morale of nearby units and grants resources when captured.
Achieve a League Victory by capturing and holding the majority of the Italian City States.

Once all nearby enemies are defeated, a City State socket can be tasked to build a Trading Post on itself freely. Controlling and holding the majority of City States until the end of the League Victory timer will result in victory.
Raid and skirmish in Polish territories.

Each team has a different setup. The northern raiders can claim Cossack Camps which produce Cossacks for free over time. The southern defenders start with villages that trickle resources. A trade route runs through the middle where outlaw units and technologies are available.
Fight to survive by the cold shores of Finland.
At certain intervals, resource crates previously lost in the blizzard appear in the center of the map. Claim them before your enemy!
Battle on the shores of the Black Sea.
Claim the Trade Route and win by Trade Monopoly.
To start a Trade Monopoly, you must capture the majority of Trade Route sockets along the map's only trade route.
Strengthen your war effort by capturing Factories and Fixed Guns.

Spread throughout the peninsula are Factories and enormous Fixed Guns that you can capture by bringing troops near them. Fixed Guns have shorter range than usual, but possess a powerful long-range attack ability!
Salvage lost resource crates for additional resource income.
Battle for control over the German provinces.
Control more than 50% of Villages in the map when the peace negotiations finish.

To control a Village, capture the flag in the middle of it. Controlling a Village grants a trickle of resources, with certain resources trickling faster depending on the Village. You can also raze the buildings in a Village at any time to loot its resources. A burned down Village will not grant its owner any resources, though it will rebuild itself over time.
Increase your resource income by holding or looting Villages.
Establish or break temporary alliances with other belligerents.
You can make or break alliances by changing diplomatic stances in the 'Player Summary' screen. Bear in mind that, for this scenario, alliances do not affect the victory condition.

Deep Learning Super Sampling (DLSS) is an NVIDIA RTX technology which uses a deep learning neural network to boost frame rates and generate beautiful, sharp images for your games. It gives you the performance headroom to maximize quality settings and increase output resolution.
